loans.use: to purchase food stuff and other ingredients to prepare her dishes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and fish to cook for sale.

loans.name: Iamze

texts.en:
Iamze is 41 years old. She lives in Gori District with her family; her husband Muraz, two sons (19 and 16 years old) and her mother-in-law (retired). The main source of income for the family is agriculture. They have a dairy farm with 3 milk cows and 3 calves. Iamze produces cheese and sells on average 50 kg of this product in the Gori market. Along with the dairy the family is busy with farming. They grow cabbage, onions, plums, apples and cherries on the family-owned 1 hectare plot of land. Iamze and Muraz sell harvested products to local green grocer retailers. The total average monthly income of the family is 1000 lari. 

Iamze requested credit for an expansion of the dairy farm. She will purchase 2 milk cows. With 5 milk cows the family will be able to increase production and sales of cheese by 60%. The income of the family will increase and Iamze will be able to purchase additional household goods to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase 2 milk cows

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 7 children. 

Erlinda provides motorela, or motorcycle, services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy tools & to pay for  gasoline for the services.

Erlinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Erlinda hopes to improve her services in order to be able to pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy tools for the maintenance of the motorcycle like a T-wrench, an air compressor and to pay for gasoline.

loans.name: Josifena

texts.en:
Josifena is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 

Josifena has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 20 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Josifena has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Josifena hopes to improve her business and pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo and beverages.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
This is Eufemia, 57, resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. She is a single parent and a mother to her children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Eufemia operates a buy and sell business. She buys general merchandise from wholesalers and sells the items, with a little profit. Her products are men's and women’s clothes and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to her low selling prices and the many options she offered. She is also into direct selling for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy RTW products and items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Eufemia hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan, a 46-year-old resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines, married to Manuel, an employee, and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Susan operates a buy-and-sell business, purchasing men's and women’s clothes from wholesalers to resell at a small profit. Customers are attracted to her low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community, and she earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Susan is requesting a Php 10,000 loan to buy RTW products and merchandise items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.

Susan hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise needed in her business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a single woman with three children, one of whom attends school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. For the past ten years, she has operated a tailoring business. Her potential customers are local neighbors. With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase embroidery and cloth materials for her business.

loans.use: to purchase embroidery and cloth materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is 54 years old and married with 10 children.

Beverly works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Beverly has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Beverly aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
As a widow and parent of four children, Cecelia works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing and fish vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from seaweed cultured. Cecelia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat for her fishing and fish vending business.

Cecelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Yanthi

texts.en:
Yanthi is a 29-year-old entrepreneur, who is married to Welem, a 30-year-old man. They are blessed with four children, namely: Marly, 8, who is attending the second grade of primary school; Roy, 7, who is attending the first grade of primary school; Derwin, 4; and Juwita, 2. 

Yanthi has been running a kiosk for two years. She provides daily-need items, e.g., sugar, instant coffee, snacks, raffia, instant flavoring, instant noodles, soap, and cigarettes. 

The income generated from the business enables her to meet her family's needs. Yanthi was thinking to add more stock to her business but she needs more money to do so. Luckily, she got information from a TLM field officer on the individual lending program that can assist her in improving her business. She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 Rupiah (IDR). She would like to buy more of the items she stocks.

loans.use: to buy sugar, instant coffee, snacks, raffia, instant flavoring, instant noodles, etc.

loans.name: Roquellio

texts.en:
Roquellio is a fisherman from Talibon, Bohol. He is married and has six children ranging from age 10 to 21. Roquellio's family relies on his fishing business. He works hard to improve his earnings and provide for his family's basic needs. He is struggling to sustain his children's education and hopes to have all of them finish college and have bright futures. 

Roquellio has requested a loan to purchase fish nets and crab traps, and to repair his fishing boat. This will help increase his profitability and help him achieve his goals.

loans.use: to purchase fish nets and crab traps, and to repair his fishing boat

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
This is Marilyn, 35, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband is Orlando, a security guard. She together with her husband manages their household while operating the business. She works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Marilyn operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines, and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper and other materials. They sell these to junk shops for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries like factories and others of that sort. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan. She will be incorporating the loan in her current revolving fund used to buy recyclable materials from collectors. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Marilyn hopes her business grows more in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for recyclable materials needed in her business

loans.name: Wahida

texts.en:
Wahida is a single woman with two school-going children. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees, food, and transport. 

Wahida has operated a nursery school for children from the neighborhood. She also does outside catering which provides her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her school to accommodate her children in the future. 

With the 50,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) she wants to purchase furniture and textbooks for her school. She decided to join to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase furniture and textbooks for her school.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
This is Adelaida, 39, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Virgilio. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. She works hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 

Adelaida offers massage services. She offers whole body massage and also does manicures and pedicures for her customers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy supplies for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Adelaida dreams to be able to have her own place and hopes to have a house and lot someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for supplies and materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for his grocery store

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en: Mwanasiti is a married woman with four children who all attend school. She owns a house that does not have electricity nor piped water. Mwanasiti sells coconuts to people from the neighboring area and has been doing so for the past five years. She says market competition is her major challenge and school fees are her greatest monthly expenditure. Mwanasiti plans on opening a kiosk in the future.  She plans to use the loan of KSh 20000 to purchase 2000 coconuts.

loans.use: to purchase 2000 coconuts.

loans.name: José Joaquín

texts.es: José Joaquín, tiene la edad de 49 años, es casado, y tiene 3 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. El quiere  comprar Semilla de maíz y frijoles e insumos  para Sembrar en finca de 10 hectáreas que es de su propiedad.   Tiene varios años que se dedica a su finca y quiere crecer y también desea que su finca sea muy productiva. Es el primer  préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. No  ha realizado otros préstamos en bancos estatales o Cooperativas, pero FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. El  también tiene el deseo de brindarle a sus hijos la educación necesaria  para que sean en el futuro  personas preparadas y puedan enfrentar de manera más fácil la vida. En la actualidad es miembro de una asociación de produtores de granos básicos, la cual ayuda a otros productores  para poder vender las cosechas.
texts.en:
José Joaquín, age 49, is married and has three children who are his greatest priority.

He wants to buy corn and bean seeds and supplies in order to plant ten hectares on his farm, which is his own property.  He has been devoting himself to his farm for several years.  He wants to grow, and he also wishes for his farm to become more productive.

This is the first loan that he has received from FUDESCOSUR.  He had no previous loans with state banks or cooperatives, but FUDESCOSUR offered  the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

He has the desire to give his children the education they need in order to be prepared in the future and so that they are able to face life in an easier way.

He is currently a member of an association of basic grains producers.  This association helps other producers to be able to sell their harvests.

loans.use: to plant corn and beans.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 53 years old and married with seven children.

Thelma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Thelma has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from vegetable vending.

Thelma aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Josef

texts.en:
Josef is 35 years old. He lives in a small village in Gori District with his family which includes his wife Ketevan, their two children ages 12 and 9, his parents and one grandmother. 

The family earns their living through the agricultural business. They grow various fruits and vegetables, including tomatoes, onions, apples and peaches, on a family owned plot of land.  Josef sells harvested products in a local open market. Josef has a mini-tractor he uses for tilling the family owned plot of land. Also, Josef provides tilling services to neighboring farmers. Along with the agriculture work, Josef works seasonally as a worker/painter. He fills  house-painting orders, mainly during the summer. The total average monthly income of the family is 1200 Laris.

Josef requested credit for purchasing fuel for his tractor to cultivate the plot of land. Also, he will purchase fertilizers and pesticides to prevent parasites.   After these seasonal process improvements, the family will achieve a better harvest than in previous years. Part of the credit will be used for purchasing piglets. He will raise them and after six months sell the grown pigs for a higher price.  Pigs will also bring additional income to the family. Josef and Ketevan plan to reinvest the profit for further development of the family business.

loans.use: to purchase fuel for his tractor to till the land, fertilizers, pesticides and piglets.

loans.name: Sandra Beatriz

texts.es: Sandra es una mujer de 31 años que vive en Quinindé ubicada en la provincia de Esmeraldas o la “Provincia verde de Ecuador”, donde se pueden ver las típicas plantaciones de la palma africana alrededor, las casitas de caña guadúa y las plantaciones de banano, en un clima cálido, donde el pueblo ha progresado con el trabajo de su gente y con esfuerzo han prosperado para que mejoren sus condiciones que a pesar de las dificultades han conseguido salir adelante. Sandra no es diferente a los demás, ella tiene 3 hijos que asisten a la escuela para poder mejorar su calidad de vida, su familia sueña con un hogar mejor donde la situación económica no sea un obstáculo para poder alcanzar estos sueños y lograr sus metas. A pesar de la falta de capital, Sandra ha logrado comenzar con una tienda de víveres desde hace 2 años en la cual pasa cerca de 9 horas al día y gracias al esfuerzo que ella ha invertido en el negocio ha podido darles a sus hijos una mejor educación, seguridad económica e incentivos para seguir y lo más importante un ejemplo como madre emprendedora que les impulsa a ser mejores como personas y dejar un legado en su propio pueblo. Con la lucha constante, Sandra desea hacer crecer este legado para sus hijos que van creciendo y cuyas necesidades van cambiando y desea invertir ahora en mercadería de manera que los ingresos mejoren. Esperemos que con esta inversión pueda fortalecer su tienda y se cumplan las metas de Sandra.
texts.en:
Sandra, age 31, lives in Quinindé in Esmeralda or “Provincia verde de Ecuador” (Green province in Ecuador).  This is where you can see the surrounding typical African palms, the houses made from bamboo, and the banana plantations.  It has a warm climate, and the town has progressed with the people’s work.  With effort they have prospered in order to improve their living conditions.  In spite of the difficulties, they have succeeded in getting ahead.

Sandra is no different than the rest.  She has three children who go to school in order to be able to improve their quality of life.  Her family dreams of a better home where the financial situation would not be an obstacle to fulfilling these dreams and achieving their goals.

In spite of the lack of capital Sandra managed to start a grocery store two years ago.  She spends close to nine hours a day in the store.  Thanks to the effort that she has invested in the business, she has been able to give her children a better education, financial security, and incentives to go on. 

The most important thing is that she is an example of an enterprising mother who pushes them to be better people and to leave a legacy in her own town.
Sandra, struggling constantly, wishes to expand this legacy for her children.  Her children are growing, and their needs are changing.  

She now wishes to invest in merchandise in a way that will increase her income.

We hope that with this investment she will be able to strengthen her store, and that Sandra will accomplish her goals.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa is single and 38 years old.  In 2005, Rosa established her drinks, pure water and mobile phone recharge card business. She began to empower herself to meet her basic needs. Rosa works 7 days a week and 10 hours each day; she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000.  Rosa needs a loan to buy more drinks, pure water and mobile phone recharge cards for her business. In the future, Rosa plans to build a house and expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more drinks, pure water and mobile phone recharge cards for her business.

loans.name: Señor Del Cautivo Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Señor del Cautivo” en el distrito de Urubamba de la provincia de Urubamba. Ya son cuatro años que funciona el banco comunal y está bien organizado. Este banco comunal está conformado por quince personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; venta de artesanía, yeso, madera, chicha de maíz,  verduras, flores, frutas y otros brindan servicios como por ejemplo albañilería y construcción. 
 
(El señor Fortunato está levantando la mano en la fotografía). El señor Fortunato nació en el distrito de maras de la provincia de Urubamba y vive donde  nació,  tiene 40 años de edad, es casado y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene cuatro hijos. Su actividad económica principal del socio Fortunato es la elaboración de yeso, él tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio donde produce yeso. Su actividad económica complementaria es la albañilería. En esta oportunidad el socio Fortunato requiere el préstamo para hacer el mantenimiento de las maquinarias y también comprar leña. Su anhelo de Fortunato es comprase un carro para transportar su mercadería a diferentes ciudades. 
 
Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends formed the communal bank “Señor del Cautivo” in the district and province of Urubamba. The communal bank formed four years ago and is well organized. This communal bank is made up of fifteen people who are searching each opportunity in order to get ahead and with their daily efforts to provide a better future for their children. The economic activities of the members are, for example, selling crafts, plaster, wood, corn liquor, vegetables, flowers, and fruits, and others offer their services, for example, as masons or construction workers.

Mr. Fortunato is raising his hand in the photograph. Mr. Fortunato was born in the district of Maras in the province of Urubamba and lives where he was born. He is 40 years old, married and from this beautiful relationship he has four children. Fortunato’s main economic activity is making plaster. He has a little workshop at home where he makes the plaster, which supplements his work as a mason. At this time the borrower Fortunato is requesting a loan in order to maintain his machinery and also to buy firewood. Fortunato’s dream is to buy a car in order to transport his merchandise to different cities. 

The borrowers across-the-board appreciate the opportunity offered and they promise to make the various payments on time as agreed.

loans.use: to maintain his machinery and to buy firewood

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 56 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Yolanda runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in the store.

Yolanda has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as spices, noodles, and sardines. 

In the future Yolanda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children.

Felicitas has a shop that repairs TVs, CD players, irons, and electrical fans. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy tools like a screw driver, electrical tape, and electrical wire, and to pay for the electricity for her services.

Felicitas has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Felicitas hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy tools to use in repairing electrical fans, televisions, CD players, and irons.

loans.name: Memunatu

texts.en: This is 38-year-old Memunatu.  She is married and has 3 children ages 22 years, 7 years and 9 months old. She has one additional dependent.  In 2010, Memunatu established her building materials business. She began her business after her parents had the idea for it while she was growing up. Her business helps her provide for her family's livelihood. Memunatu works 7 days a week and 8 hours each day; she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Memunatu requests a loan in order to buy more building materials like cement, zinc and iron rods. In the future, Memunatu plans to build a house and establish her own shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more building materials like cement, zinc and iron rods.

loans.name: Tumu

texts.en: Tumu is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 40,000 to establish a beauty salon. With the loan, she wants to purchase a new blow dryer, hair pieces and hair chemicals. Since her previous loan, her monthly income and profit has increased; she would like to expand into another business with the additional money she has saved.

loans.use: to purchase a new blow dryer, hair pieces and hair chemicals.

loans.name: Evelyn Del Carmen

texts.es: Evelyn del Carmen de treinta años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos los cuales aún asisten a una escuela cercana a la localidad donde residen, vive en zona urbana, ella posee una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad, frijoles ,lácteos, embutidos, leche, huevos entre otros, últimamente ha aumentado la demanda pues su negocio es el más surtido de la zona donde vende productos de primera calidad y a precios bajos, además el servicio es excelente; Evelyn es una mujer muy activa, responsable y sobre todo con una gran humildad, piensa que la motivación es lo que te ayuda a empezar pero el hábito te mantiene firme en el camino, quiere ser constante para llegar al éxito y hacer crecer su negocio es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, producto instantáneo, embutidos, lácteos, golosinas que a la fecha no posee y sus clientes estan pidiendo. Evelyn tiene la seguridad que de esta forma hará mayores ventas y por consecuencia incrementará sus ganancias a fin de mejorar las condiciones en que vive con su familia.-
texts.en:
Evelyn del Carmen, 30, lives with her common-law husband and their two children who go to school near town.  They live in the urban area and she has a store where she sells essential goods such as beans, dairy products, sausages, milk, eggs, etc.  Lately, she has seen an increase in business because her store carries the widest variety in the area and she sells top quality products at low prices.  She also offers excellent service.

Evelyn is a very active, responsible woman, who above all else is someone with great humility.  She believes that motivation is something that helps you get started but habit is what keeps you on the right track.  Through determination, she aims to become successful and grow her business.  Therefore, she has requested a loan through INTEGRAL that she will use to buy the basic grains, instant products, sausages, dairy products and sweets that she does not have now but which customers have been requesting.  Evelyn is sure that this will increase her sales and earnings so she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, instant products, sausages, dairy products, and sweets.

loans.name: Maredil

texts.en:
Maredil works hard to support her family. Maredil is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

Maredil requested a loan of PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase more ingredients for her restaurant business.

Maredil has been in this business for a year now.

In the future, Maredil would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 46-year-old Aminata.  She is married and has 4 children, ages 17, 13, 10  and 9 years old. She has one additional dependent who lives with her because he needs assistance. 

In 1996, Aminata established her plastic shoes business. She began her business because she had not had the privilege of attending  school and had assisted her mother in selling cakes.  She married a businessman who gave her money to start a business. Aminata works 7 days a week and 11 hours each day; she earns about Le 1,700,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Aminata requests a loan in order to buy 20 dozen plastic shoes for women at a cost of Le 165,000 per dozen and 12 bundles of comfort slippers at a cost of Le 135,000 per dozen.  The remaining Le 80,000 will be used to pay the transportation cost.   

In the future, Aminata plans to acquire a shop, build a house and expand her business.  The loan will help her to increase stock and create room for development.  Transportation costs are sometimes high.   She is a hardworking and determined businesswoman.  She will continue to take loans from ARD until she achieves all her goals.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy 20 dozen plastic shoes for women @ Le 165,000 per dozen and 12 bundles of comfort slippers @ Le135,000 per budle.  The Le 80,000 balance will be used to pay the transportation cost.

loans.name: Marìa Santos

texts.es:
María  es una mujer de 60 años de edad, su estado civil es soltera y tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad. Vive en casa propia en el caserío Positos, en el distrito de Mórrope. La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría son trabajadores independientes dedicándose al  comercio y crianza de animales, adicionalmente se dedican a la agricultura.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica María  es la crianza de  animales menores. Cuenta con 30 años de experiencia en dicha actividad. Su crianza lo realiza en su propio domicilio y gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo  cuenta con clientela fija que son comerciantes del mercado de Chiclayo.
El monto del crédito solicitado es de 2,500 nuevos soles, se destinará para inversión en compra de animales menores (aves), caprinos y ovinos  para la cría y engorde. Con el préstamo actual tiene pensado ampliar corrales para la crianza y comprar alimento para engorde de animales menores y ganado porcino. Actualmente  se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a  animales debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona.
texts.en:
Marìa is a woman of 60 years of age, her marital status is single and she has two adult children. She lives in her own house in the village of Positos, in the district of Mórrope. Their quality of life is that of a subsistence community, most are self-employed workers working in commerce and breeding animals, and in addition they work in agriculture.

Marìa’s business is breeding small animals. She has thirty years experience in this activity. The breeding takes place in her own home and thanks to her work and efforts she has regular customers who are traders from the Chiclayo market.

The amount of the loan being sought is 2500 soles to be used to invest in the purchase of small animals (birds), goats and sheep for breeding and fattening. 

With the current loan she is planning to expand the breeding pens and buy animal feed in order to fatten the small animals and pigs. In regards to the animals, currently she wants to increase her inventory since it is a profitable activity in the area.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and small animals for breeding and fattening

loans.name: Emmah

texts.en:
Emmah is married and has three children attending school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent.

For the past two years, Emmah has operated a cereal sales business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing more cereals shops in the future. 

With the requested Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of rice, green grams, onions and sweet potatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice, green grams, onions and sweet potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Abdurahim

texts.ru: Абдурахим проживает в районе Дангара. Ему 44 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Он занимается животноводством. Абдурахим в основном закупает скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается четыре года. Кредит берет для закупа телят.
texts.en: Abdurahim lives in the Dangara district. He is 44 years old, married, and has four children. He is involved in animal husbandry; he buys livestock for later resale. He has been doing this kind of work for four years. He is asking for a loan to buy calves.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials for carpentry

loans.name: Lela

texts.en:
Lela is 44 years old. She lives in Kareli district, East Georgia. Lela is a widow and lives with her family: 21-year-old daughter and parents-in-law (retired). Lela’s daughter works as an assistant pharmacist in a local drugstore. Lela runs the agricultural business of the family. They have 1.25 hectares of land: 0.30 hectares is used for growing tomatoes and the rest of the plot is used for a peach and apple garden. In addition, the family has a small dairy farm with two milk cows. Lela’s mother-in-law produces and sells on average 30 kg of cheese per month. The total average monthly income of the family is 1000 laris.

Lela requested credit to purchase fertilizers for the plot. Also, she will purchase drugs for treating plants with parasites. With properly done seasonal work, Lela will produce a better harvest than in previous years. She will use the increased income for house renovation as well as purchasing additional household goods to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and drugs

loans.name: Luz De Campo Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal Luz De Campo está conformado por doce emprendedores que se unieron para salir adelante, este grupo ya ha venido trabajando con fundación león 2000 en el crédito otorgado anteriormente han demostrado ser responsable y con deseos de superación, los emprendedores expresan que gracias al financiamiento han aumentado sus productos y sus clientes. Antonio es parte desde grupo y su actividad es a la venta de artesanía que es buscado por extranjeros y nacionales, en la actualidad está solicitando financiamiento para comprar materiales para la realización de las artesanías  y poder ofrecerles a sus clientes variedad
texts.en:
Luz de Campo Communal Bank is made up of twelve entrepreneurs who came together so they could move forward. The group has been working with Fundación León 2000 and received a previous loan, demonstrating they are responsible people interested in self-improvement.  

The members say that, thanks to the funding they received, they have expanded both their product lines and their customers. Antonio is part of this group. He has a business selling handicrafts that are sought after both nationally and internationally. Currently he is applying for a loan to purchase materials to make his crafts and to be able to offer his customers more variety.

loans.use: to purchase material to make his handicrafts and to be able to offer his customers more variety.

loans.name: Benia

texts.en:
Benia is 53 years old and married. Benia has nine children, two of whom are in school.

Benia is in the agriculture business raising livestock in the Philippines. Benia requested a loan of PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to raise.

Benia has been raising livestock for nine years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Benia would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock to raise.

loans.name: Fayziddin

texts.ru: Файзиддин проживает в районе Дангара. Ему 58 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Он имеет средне - специальное образование. Более 25 лет Файзиддин предоставляет услугу такси. Кроме того он занимается скотоводством. Этим видом деятельности занимается три года. Кредит берет для закупа телят с целью увеличения поголовья крупного рогатого скота.
texts.en: Fayziddin lives in the Dangara region. He is 58 years old, married, and has two children. He has a secondary techincal education. For more than 25 years Fayziddin has been providing a taxi service. He is also involved in anaimal husbandry. He has been involved in this kind of work for three years. He is asking for loan to buy calves to increase his number of cattle.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a widow with two children. She operates a fish selling business which she started four years ago to support her children since her husband died. Agnes is requesting a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase bundles of fish for sale. She faces a challenge of seasonality in her business. Her major dream is to establish another business in the future. Agnes joined Yehu because of its mission of empowering women.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for sale.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 50 years old and single.

Geraldine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (convenience) store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Geraldine has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from a boarding house.

Geraldine aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Expeditha

texts.en:
This is Expedita, 49, resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Rogelio, an employee. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Expedita oversees operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts, accessories and also for the maintenance of her motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Expedita dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of their "tricycle".

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
This is Milagros, 65, resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. She is a single parent and a mother to her child. She, together with her child, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Milagros oversees operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 every day.

To help her continue to operate her business, she is requesting a Php 16,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts, accessories and also for the maintenance of her motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Milagros dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle

loans.name: Rahmatullo

texts.ru: Рахматулло житель города Душанбе. Ему 64 года. Он разведен. У него один ребенок. Рахматулло более 20 лет занимается торговлей. У него имеется продуктовый магазин. Он берет кредит для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Rahmatullo lives in the city of Dushanbe. He is 64 years old, divorced, and has one child. Rahmatullo has been working in sales for more than 20 years. He owns a grocery store. He is asking for a loan to increase his product turnover.

loans.use: To buy groceries and household goods

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy alpaca wool.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en: This time, Cherry is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase more fruits like apples, oranges, and watermelons to sell in her food stall. This business that was previously funded through NWTF and KIVA lenders continues to provide Cherry and her family with additional income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fruits like apples, oranges, and watermelons to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: This time, for her 10th cycle loan, Evelyn is borrowing PHP 22,000 to fund her hog raising business. This business was previously funded through KIVA lenders and NWTF to provide her and her family with income that is building and expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: La Unión Hace La Fuerza Group

texts.es: Gaby de 32 años de edad es conviviente con 01 hijo aún dependiente, su familia   ha sido su motivo de seguir luchando cada día. Gaby comenzó trabajando en un taller de costura, con los conocimientos que adquirió en dicho taller decide iniciar su propio negocio la cual actualmente  brinda servicios de costura, este negocio le ha sido de mucha ayuda pues apoya a su pareja con los gastos del hogar. Con los deseos de seguir progresando solicito su último crédito para la compra de telas y así poder realizar sus trabajos. Su mayor deseo es de comprarse un carro pues lo piensa alquilar como servicio de transporte.  Gaby es integrante de la Alcancía Comunal “La Unión Hace La Fuerza” la cual está conformado por 07 personas responsables. Ellos agradecen el crédito brindado.  Gaby es la primera del lado izquierdo, ella viste una chompa negra y pantalón plomo.
texts.en: 32 year old Gaby lives with her partner and has 1 son. Her family has been her inspiration to keep striving every day. Gaby began working in a dressmaking workshop. With the knowledge that she gained in this workshop, she decided to start her own business which currently offers dressmaking services. This business has been a great help to her and she can support her partner with the household expenses. With the desire to keep progressing, she is requesting her latest loan to buy fabrics and so to be able to do her work. Her greatest desire is to buy herself a car and rent it out as a transport service. Gaby is a member of the community bank "La Unión Hace La Fuerze" which is comprised of 7 responsible people. They are grateful for the loan they are offered. Gaby is the first person on the left side. She is wearing a black sweater and gray pants.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is a 30-year-old married woman with two young children. Her husband is a fisherman. Violeta has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for four years. She sells sugar, vinegar, canned goods, and toiletries in her store. She earns 3,000 PHP each month. Violeta works hard to help provide for her family's basic needs and save for her children's future education.

Violeta is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise to sell such as biscuits, canned goods, and detergent soap. This will help increase Violeta's sales and profitability.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell such as biscuits, canned goods, and detergent soap.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 24 años de edad, casado, con un hijo de 4 años a su cargo. Vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en el Caserío San Isidro del distrito de Tambogrande. Luis vive en este sector y  no  cuenta con servicios básicos.
La actividad que desarrolla Luis es la agricultura, lo cual cuenta con 0.25 has de herencia por parte de sus  padres, en el cual tiene sembrado plantaciones de limón y mango las que se encuentran en producción y esto le permite vender semanalmente, esta actividad la realiza hace más de 3 años, así mismo se dedica a la crianza ganado ovino y aves de corral como pavos, gallinas, los cuales  lo comercializa en el mercado local. Su esposa lo apoya en sus actividades que realiza.
El monto solicitado es de  1,000 nuevos soles, que serán utilizados  para el mantenimiento de cultivo de limón como es la  compra de  abono foliares y  fertilizantes; y de esta manera podrá obtener buenos rendimientos y cosecha para la obtención de mejoras de sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Luis is a 24 year old man who is married and has a 4 year old son in his care. He lives in his own home which is located in the village of San Isidro in the district of Tambogrande. Luis lives in this area and does not have basic utility services. 
Luis is a farmer and has 0.25 measures of land that he inherited from his parents where he has planted orchards of lemons and mangoes that are productive and enable him to sell every week. He has been doing this for more than 3 years and he also works raising cows, sheep, and poultry such as turkeys and hens which he sells in the local market. His wife helps him with this work.
The amount requested is $400. This will be used to keep cultivating the lemons. He will buy foliar fertilizer and other fertilizers and in this way he will be able to have better production and a better harvest so he can improve his income.

loans.use: to continue cultivating lemons.

loans.name: Sumac Maky Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Sumac Maky” en la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son varios años que funciona el banco comunal y está bien organizado. Este banco comunal está conformado por diez personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; venta artesanía, venta de comida, algunos son empleados públicos de un hospital en el área de nutrición y otros se dedican al cuidado de niños. 

(La señora Nely está levantando la mano en la fotografía). La señora Nely nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive donde nació, tiene 49 años de edad, es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene tres hijos. Su actividad económica principal de la socia Nely es la elaboración y venta de artesanía como por ejemplo tejidos, ella tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio donde elabora algunos de productos que vende. En esta oportunidad Nely requiere el préstamo para comprar lana  de alpaca.    

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.

Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas. Cusco se caracteriza por ser una zona turística, por sus centros arqueológicos, por su centro histórico, por sus paisajes, por su historia, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
A group of friends and neighbors formed the community bank "Sumac Maky" in the city of Cusco. The bank has been running for some years and it is well organized. This community bank is comprised of 10 people who are always looking for opportunities to get ahead and, with their daily efforts, to deliver a better future for their children. The economic activities of the members are, for example: selling crafts, selling food, some are public employees in the hospital in the nutrition section and others care for children. 
(Nely has her hand raised in the photo.) Nely was born in the city of Cusco and lives where she was born. She is 49 years old, married, and has 3 children from this beautiful relationship. Her main economic activity is making and selling crafts such as, for example, weaving. She has a small workshop in her house where she makes the products that she sells. At this moment, Nely needs a loan to buy alpaca wool. 
The members are grateful for the opportunity offered to them and promise to repay their different amounts at the established time. 
Cusco is located in the district and province of Cusco in the department of Cusco in the very heart of the ancient city of the Incas. Cusco is characterized as a tourist destination, by it's archaeological sites, it's historical center, it's countryside, it's history, it's traditional fiesta of Inti Raymi and for being the location of one of the seven wonders of the world: Machupicchu.

loans.use: to buy alpaca wool.

loans.name: Fausta

texts.en:
Fausta is a single mother of three children. Two of her children go to school. She has a business of knitting tablecloths and placemats. She has been in this business for eight years.  She moves door-to-door selling her tablecloths. She sells to all categories of people, but on retail. 

She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more rolls of cloth, thread, and needles.  She generates additional income through hiring out a motorcycle and through rearing chickens. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters.  

She aspires to see her business grow big so that she can get a permanent premises for her business and also to educate her remaining two children up to university. She resides in a home that she owns and the family has access to electricity, but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics, thread, and needles for tablecloths and placemats.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes, shoes and handbags to sell.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. 

Eliza has a shop that sells ready-to-wear RTWs (a clothing brand name) like T-shirts. She has had this business for three years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy stocks of RTWs, like T-shirts and pants, to sell.

Eliza has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a married man with five children, all of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house with his family that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing. 

Wilson operates a green grocer and his neighbors are his potential clients. He buys his goods from the market and sells them from home. He faces the challenge of the high cost of transportation in his business. He dreams of establishing another business to earn more income in the future.

With the loan he is requesting, he wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables, carrots, tomatoes and onions. Wilson joined Yehu to access loans to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of green vegetables, carrots, tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is married and has two school-going children. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Alfred cites food and rental bills as his greatest monthly expenses.

For the past two years, he has been operating a retail shop business. Neighbors and passersby are his potential customers. He dreams of expanding his retail shop to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, he wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, charcoal and washing detergents.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, charcoal and washing detergents.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 50 lots of seeds, hire a pump, buy fertilisers and pay laborers

loans.name: Orilla Del Itata Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Orilla del Itata” está conformado por 17 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran venta de abarrotes, preparación y venta de empanadas, venta de lencería por catálogo, venta de ropa usada y venta de artículos de bazar, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chillán.
Marcelina presidenta del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en la última fila, ocupando el primer lugar de derecha a izquierda. Usa su cabello recogido y se peina hacia atrás. Como referencia viste un chaleco color negro, jeans azules y zapatos color negro, se logra ver un poco de su vestimenta.
Ella se dedica a preparar y vender tortillas de rescoldo (Se prepara con harina de trigo, manteca y sal y se cocina en el rescoldo de un fuego que normalmente se hace sobre arena fina, para mejorar la cocción. Luego de desenterrarla, se limpia las cenizas y comúnmente se retira algún borde quemado y se sirve en trozos). Marcelina se dedica a éste negocio desde hace 15 años, comenta que su clientela es fija y también tiene clientela rotativa, pero frecuente.
Trabaja de lunes a domingo, prepara y cocina sus tortillas durante las mañanas en su casa y durante las tardes se dedica a venderlas en un local que ubica a tres cuadras de su casa.
Sus ingredientes los compra en supermercados mayoristas y directamente a los proveedores.
Con el crédito comprará leña para la temporada de invierno, para cocinar sus preparaciones de tortillas.
Una de sus metas para el futuro es instalarse con un almacén donde pueda vender todo tipo de abarrotes. 
Marcelina vive junto a su marido y su hija de 18 años, quien estudia la carrera de Asistente de párvulo.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo esperanza, ya que el crédito le permitirá invertir en su negocio, para la temporada de invierno. Además comenta que ha aprendido estrategias de contabilidad, las cuales ha podido incorporar en su negocio. 
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
“Orilla del Itata” Communal Bank is made up of 17 entrepreneurs, who engage in different businesses, among them, grocery sales, the preparation and sale of empanadas, catalog sales of lingerie, the sale of used clothing and household items. All live in the city of Chillán.

Marcelina is president of the communal bank. She is shown in the last row of the photo on the end going from right to left. She has her hair drawn back. For reference, she is dressed in a black jacket, blue jeans and black shoes. You can see only a little of her attire. 

She prepares and sells “tortillas de rescoldo.” (They are prepared with wheat flour, butter and salt and are cooked in the cinders of a fire that is normally made on fine sand in order to improve the cooking.  Then they are dug out, the ashes cleaned off and usually the burnt edges removed and they are served in slices). She has been in business for 15 years and notes that she has regular customers as well as others who come and go, but come back frequently. She works from Monday to Sunday and prepares and cooks her tortillas in the mornings at her house and during the afternoons she sells them at a place about three blocks from her house. She buys her ingredients directly from suppliers at a wholesale supermarket. 

Marcelina will use the loan to buy firewood to cook her tortillas during the winter season. One of her future goals is to install a shop where she can sell all kinds of groceries.

Marcelina lives with her husband and her 18 year-old-daughter who is studying to be an assistant pre-school teacher.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity provided by Fondo Esperanza since the loan will enable her to invest in her business during the winter season. In addition, she notes that she has learned principles of accounting that she has been able to incorporate in her business.

Chillán is a settlement in the south central part of Chile. The name means “Seat of the Sun” in Mapudungun, the language of the indigenous Mapuches. Chillán is known as the “Cradle of the Country” or “The Land of Artists” because the city has given birth to people prominent in Chile’s history, such as, for example, the well known pianist, Claudio Arrau.

loans.use: to purchase firewood to cook her tortillas during the winter season.

loans.name: Eudocia

texts.es:
La Sra. Eudocia; ella tiene 67 años de edad y es viuda y tiene 6 hijos, uno de los cuales depende todavía de ella.
La Señora Eudocia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de chicha (bebida a base de maíz) y maíz, la socia también trabaja en la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, luego los vende en el mercado de la ciudad de Cusco; y por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a familia, 
Eudocia quiere mejorar y mantener su negocio de venta de chicha, maíz y animales, por ello solicita un préstamo para comprar maíz y alimentos para sus animales.
Eudocia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Andahuaylillas, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco - Perú
texts.en:
Señora Eudocia is 67 years old. She is a widow with six children, one of whom still depends on her.

Señora alternates her daily activities with a business of selling chicha (a corn-based beverage). She also raises small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens; she then sells them in the market in the city of Cusco. Through these small businesses, this communal bank member is raising her family.

Eudocia wants to improve and maintain her business of selling chicha, corn, and animals, and for this reason she is applying for a loan to buy corn and feed for her animals.

Eudocia belongs to the communal bank "Las Triunfadoras," which is located in the district of Andahuaylillas, which is in the province of Quispicanchis and the department of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy corn and feed for her animals

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: This is 49-year-old Isatu. She is a widow and has three children who are 26, 16 and 2 years old.. She has one additional dependent.  In 2000, Isatu established her peanut business. She began her business because she wanted to help her husband support their family. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 800,000 every month in profit from this business. She would like a loan of Le 3,000,000. Isatu requires a loan in order to buy more peanuts for her business.  In the future, Isatu plans to build a house and to give her children a quality education. She is thanking you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more peanuts to sell

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is a farmer in the Kitale area of Western Kenya and is married with six children between 26 and 13 years old. The first five are already schooling. She has been in farming for five years and currently sells her produce of maize and beans to the local market.

Everlyne has made a second loan request of 30,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds and venture into poultry farming as well. She says this will improve her farming income and enable her to expand her farming business and educate her children.

She says the poor road network and poor market prices are the challenges. She also advocates for an education loan product.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence  is a single mother of three children, and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling fish and has been in this business for six months. She has applied for a loan of 100000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more boxes of fish. She doesn’t have any other income generating activity. Her major business challenges are scarcity of fish and thieves. She aspires to see her business grow big so that she can start fish smoking. She  resides in a home that she rents, and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish

loans.name: Oui Group

texts.fr:
Adidja fait partie du groupe  Oui  et habite à Bujumbura. Elle a  29 ans et est mariée à Libère, un cuisinier. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants, âgés de  3 à 12 ans, dont 3 étudient.
Elle  a sous sa charge sa petite sœur qui étudie à l’école primaire.

Adidja fait le commerce de l’huile de palme depuis 10 ans.

Elle est à son quatrième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter huit bidons d’huile de palme (20l chacun) supplémentaires. En tout,elle aura 28 bidons  d’huile de palme à revendre, pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines  années elle voudrait construire une maison dans sa parcelle.
texts.en:
Adidja belongs to the Oui group and lives in Bujumbura.  She is 29 years old and married to Libère, who works as a cook.  They have four children together, ages 3 to 12.  Three of their children are in school.  Adidja also takes care of her younger sister, who is in primary school.

Adidja has been selling palm oil for the past ten years.

This is her fourth loan from Turame.  With her KIVA loan, she will increase her capital and buy eight additional bottles of palm oil (20 liters each).  All in all, she will have 28 bottles of palm oil that she will resell in order to make more money.

In the coming years, Adidja would like to build a house on her lot.

loans.use: to buy eight additional bottles of palm oil (8 liters each) and increase her capital.

loans.name: Tugirubumwe Group

texts.fr:
Béatrice fait partie du groupe Tugirubumwe. Elle a 52ans, elle mariée avec 11 enfants le moins âge a 11 ans et le plus âge a 33 ans, dont 6 scolarises .Son niveau d’études est 6 ans de primaire.

 Béatrice est agricultrice de légumes. C’est son deuxième cycle  de prêt avec ACB. Elle va acheter 100 kgs des graines  des choux des semences, 10 kgs  des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance du business, est demande d’autres crédits pour augmenter la capacité de  ses activités et acheter d’autres champs pour augmenter la production agricole. Dans l’avenir Béatrice voudrait être le meilleur pour l’agriculture dans son secteur. Avec le profit  elle prévoit de continuer à paye les frais scolaire de ses enfants et améliore le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Béatrice is a member of the Tugirubumwe group.  She is 52 years old, married, and has 11 children.  Her youngest child is 11 years old and her eldest is 33.  Six of her children attend school.  Béatrice herself studied up to the sixth year of primary school.

Béatrice is a vegetable farmer.  This is her second loan cycle with ACB.  She will buy 100kg of seeds, cabbage seeds, 10kg of fertilizers, and will pay laborers.

Béatrice's strategy for growing her business is to request further loans in order to increase her capacity and to buy more fields in order to increase her production.  In the future, Béatrice would like to become the best farmer in her area.  She plans to use her profits to continue paying her children's school fees and improve her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy 100kg of seeds, cabbage seeds, 10kg of fertilizers, and to pay laborers

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is 42 years old and a mother of five children between 23 and 11 years old. She has been in active mixed farming for 15 years. Her farm currently produces maize and beans, which is mainly sold to the local market with only a very small quantity reserved for family consumption.

Pamela has made a loan request for 30,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry for a new venture into poultry farming. She aspires to have a farm of not less than 2,500 birds. She believes the poultry business will help her improve her salon business, which she runs in the local market. She reiterates a larger portion of her income will go into the education of the children.

She notes that poor prices for farm produce and animal diseases are still great challenges.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is a resident of Kitale in western Kenya and carries out farming in his rural home there. His farm is currently producing maize, milk, vegetables, bananas, and eggs, which are sold to the local market. He is married with two children, aged ten and five, both of whom are in school. Besides farming, he carries out battery charging and salon business at the local market. He runs his farm with the help of one farmhand.
Evans has requested a loan of 30000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to boost his poultry farming business by buying more birds. He hopes to increase the number of his birds and meet his family's basic needs with more ease.
He says that Juhudi Kilimo loans have empowered many farmers financially.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es: Juan es  una  persona   muy trabajadora, que  día  con día  se  esfuerza  por  acondicionar  su   vivienda  ya  que  se preocupa  por  brindar a   su  familia una  excelente  estabilidad,  el  se  acerco  con nosotros  ya  que  requiere  pintar  y  enyesar las paredes de el  exterior  de  su   domicilio  para  que  este  pueda  tener  una  mejor  imagen,  agradece  el  apoyo  brindado para la realización de su proyecto  ya  que  gracias a la  facilidad de   pagos  que   le brinda la institución a  ido  realizando  diversas  mejores a   su  hogar.
texts.en: Juan is a very hardworking man who strives daily to improve and keep up his house so that his family can have better stability and quality of life. He is requesting this loan so that he will be able to paint and plaster the exterior walls of his home and improve its overall appearance. He is grateful for the support he has received, and as a result of the ease of the payment system, he has been able to complete various improvements to his home.

loans.use: to paint and plaster the exterior walls of his home.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
La Sra. Faustina ahora tiene 40 años de edad, Vive en Andahuaylillas, provincia de Quispicanchis en Cusco – Perú, está casada y tiene 5 hijos aun pequeños.

Faustina se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de artesanía, ella vende chompas, maletines, collares y aretes entre otros productos. Ella expende sus productos en la plaza de armas de Andahuaylillas y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos.

La Sra. Faustina quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio, para ello ella necesita un préstamo para comprar más artesanías al por mayor y surtirse de productos para la próxima temporada turística.

Faustina pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Andahuaylillas, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.
texts.en:
Faustina is 40 years old, and lives in Andahuaylillas, in the province of Quispicanchis in the department of Cusco, Peru. She is married and has five children.

Faustina makes a living buying and selling crafts and artisan goods. She sells sweaters, purses, necklaces, earrings, and other items. She displays her products in the main plaza of Andahuaylillas, and through this business she makes a living and works to provide for her children.

Faustina desires to expand and improve her business, and she is therefore requesting this loan in order to purchase artisan crafts in bulk and stock up on merchandise for the next tourist season.

Faustina belongs to the community bank, “Las Triunfadoras” (the triumphant), which is located in the Andahuaylillas district in the province of Quispicanchis and the department of Cusco.

loans.use: to purchase artisan crafts for resale.

loans.name: Diomedes

texts.es:
Diomedes es un hombre  de 31 años de edad, es conviviente y  con 02 hijos como carga familiar, Vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en  el  Caserío Peña Viva Cólera Distrito de Tambogrande. Diomedes vive en  la parte rural  de este distrito.
Diomedes se dedica a la ganadería y  agricultura por más de 05 años, y además cuenta con  1.0 ha de terreno agrícola en  el cual tiene sembrado limón que cosecha semanalmente y además se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como ovinos.
El monto solicitado es de 2,300 nuevos soles que lo invertirá en limpieza y mantenimiento  del campo y así mismo realizará la fertilización adecuada al  cultivo de limón; así como también la compra de alimentos balanceados para el engorde de sus ovinos; y esto le va permitir seguir creciendo en su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Diomedes is 31 years old, and lives with his partner and their two children in their own home. They live in the Caserío Peña Viva Cólera community in the district of Tambogrande. Diomedes lives in the rural part of the district.

Diomedes has made a living for the past five years raising livestock and working in agriculture. He has one hectare of arable land planted with lemon trees that he harvests and tends on a weekly basis. He also works raising small animals such as sheep.

He is requesting a loan in the amount of 2,300 nuevos soles, which he will invest in the cleaning and maintenance of his land, as well as in fertilizers for planting lemon trees. He also plans to purchase feed for his sheep, which will help him to grow his business.

loans.use: to invest in maintaining his land, and to purchase feed for his animals.

loans.name: Agustina De La Concepcion

texts.es: Agustina de la Concepción ella se ha desempeñado en el servicio al cliente con un comedor y bar lo cual ha obtenido buenos resultados gracias al servicio que brinda a su clientela dicho negocio está ubicada en su casa de habitación ,esta emprendedora ha podido mantener el negocio prospero  y cumplir con sus sueños, de ser exitosa con su herramienta de trabajo gracias  al financiamiento que fundación león 2000 le ha brindado el crédito lo solicita para invertir en la compra de productos para la elaboración de los diferentes platillos que ofrece en su negocio  como son: arroz, verduras, carnes blancas y rojas, aceite, utensilio de cocinas entre otros.
texts.en: Agustina de la Concepción serves customers in her restaurant and bar, which have given her good results thanks to the service that she offers her customers. This business is located in her home. This entrepreneur has been able to keep her business prosperous and accomplish her dreams of being successful in her means of work, thanks to the financing that Fundación León 2000 has offered her. The loan she is applying for now will be invested in the purchase of products to make the different dishes that she offers in her business, such as rice, vegetables, red and white meats, oil, and cooking utensils, among other items.

loans.use: to buy rice, vegetables, white and red meats, oil, and cooking utensils, among other items

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Maya is 41 years old. She lives in the Gori District with her family, which consists of her husband, Tamaz, her  21-year-old son and 16-year-old daughter. Maya works as a music teacher in a village school. Her husband owns a truck and is busy transporting various goods. Maya leads the agricultural business of the family. In particular, she runs a dairy farm with two milk cows. She produces on average 30 kg of traditional Georgian cheese and sells it in the village. Along with the above-mentioned businesses,  the family is busy with vegetable and fruits growing. They grow tomatoes, cabbages, plums, apples and cherries. Maya and Tamaz sell the harvested products to local greengrocery retailers. The total average monthly income of the family is 900 Laris.

Maya requested a loan for purchasing an additional milk cow. With three cows, she will be able to increase production and sales of cheese by 50%. It will increase the income of the family and they will be able to improve their living conditions

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Jannet

texts.en: Jannet live in the airport community. She is married and has four children between the ages of 1 and 16. Three of her children are in school and live at home. For the past 10 years, she has been selling charcoal. She makes more profit since she sells a very good charcoal. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. She plans is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal  for her business

loans.name: Julio C. Tello Al Progreso Group

texts.es: Anabel tiene 29 años de edad es separada con 01 hijo aún dependiente. Anabel cuenta con una moto la cual brinda servicio de transporte, lleva trabajando de esta manera hace mas de 02 años, comenzó vendiendo comida ambulatoriamente lo que pudo ahorrar con sus trabajos para la compra de su propia moto. Anabel se siente orgullosa pues gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo a podido sacar adelante a su hijo sola, ya que es madre soltera. A futuro le gustaría instalar una boutique en su domicilio, pues le permitiría estar cerca de su hijo. En esta oportunidad solicito el crédito para el mantenimiento de su moto. Anabel es integrante de la Alcancía  Comunal “Julio C. Tello Al Progreso” la cual está conformado por 08 mujeres emprendedoras. Ellos agradecen el crédito brindado ya que hacen posible su progreso. Anabel está ubicada en la parte posterior viste una chompa ploma con rayas rosada.
texts.en:
Anabel is 29 years old, has one son and is separated from her husband. Anabel has a motorbike that she has used for transportation to and from her job for over two years. She began by traveling around and selling food in the area, and saved up to purchase her own motorbike, which has allowed her to expand her sales area. She is proud that her hard work has allowed her to help support her son, since she is a single mother. In the future she would like to set up a boutique shop in her home so that she can be home with her son.

She is requesting this loan in order to do maintenance work on her motorbike. Anabel is a member of the community bank, “Julio Tello al Progreso,” which is made up of eight women entrepreneurs. They are all grateful for the support that has made their work and progress possible. In the photo, Anabel is located toward the back and is dressed in a striped pink and gray sweater.

loans.use: to maintain and repair a motorbike.

loans.name: Teobaldo

texts.es:
Teobaldo es un hombre de 54 años de edad, casado y con 02 hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus hijos. La cual está ubicada en el Caserío Las Mónicas Mz A Lote 140  Dist. Tambogrande, pero cuenta con servicio de luz.
La actividad que desarrolla el Teobaldo es la ganadería y agricultura; el ganado al alcanzar tamaño y peso óptimo los comercializa en el mercado local. Tiene 1.50 has de terreno agrícola, las cuales están sembrada con mango Var. Kent. La que se encuentra en producción. Su esposa se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral.
El monto solicitado es de 2,000 nuevos soles que será para la compra de alimento balanceado para su ganado y para la fertilización del cultivo de mango, lo cual le va permitir seguir creciendo con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Teobaldo is 54 years old, and is married with two children. He lives with his wife and children in their own house, which is located in the Caserío Las Mónicas A Lote 140 community of the district of Tambogrande. They have access to electricity. 

Teobaldo works in agriculture and also raises livestock for resale in the local market. He has one and a half hectares of arable land that he has planted with Kent variety mangos, which are presently in their growth cycle. His wife works raising chickens and barnyard fowl. 

He is requesting a loan in the amount of 2,000 nuevos soles, which he will invest in the purchase of feed for his cattle, and in fertilizers for growing mango trees. With the support from this loan, he will be able to continue growing his business and improving his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase feed for his animals and fertilizers for growing mango trees.

loans.name: Marìa Betty

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 37 años de edad, conviviente, con 03 hijos dependientes, vive en casa propia en el caserío Tranca Sasape distrito de Mòrrope, pero cuenta con servicio de Luz. Su cónyuge se dedica a la agricultura, donde le apoya económicamente.
La actividad que realiza la María es la crianza y venta de animales, donde los  cría en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Así mismo cuenta con bastante experiencia en este negocio y sus ventas lo realiza quincenalmente. Así mismo María  también se dedica a la venta de pollo sacrificado, el cual vende por kilos.
El La actividad que realiza la clienta es la crianza y venta de animales, los cuales cría en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Clienta negocia quincenalmente sus animales. Clienta también se dedica a la venta de pollo sacrificado, el cual vende por kilos.
El monto solicitado es de 1,500 nuevos soles dicho crédito  será destinado para la compra de alimento para animales y en compra de fertilizante  para su cultivo de arroz.
texts.en:
