Maria is a woman of 37. She lives with her partner, and they have three dependent children. She lives in her own house in the little village of Tranca Sasape in the district of Mórrope, but they have electrical service. Her partner works in agriculture and provides economic support.

Maria's work is raising and selling animals, which she raises in pens located behind her home. She has quite a bit of experience in this business, and she makes sales every two weeks. She also sells butchered chickens, which she sells by the kilo.

She is applying for a loan of 1500 PEN. This loan is destined for the purchase of feed for her animals and for the purchase of fertilizer for her rice field.

loans.use: to buy feed for small animals and fertilizer for her rice field

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is 35 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and has three children between the ages of 3 to 18 years. All of them are in school and live at home. Her husband works as a security man. 

For the past eleven years she has been involved in business. She was taught by her mother how to sell rice, oil, pepper, bitter ball (an eggplant-like vegetable), and okra in the market. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, oil, pepper, bitter ball, and okra for her business. In the future, she wants to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, pepper, bitter ball, and okra for her business.

loans.name: Ariel

texts.es:
Don Ariel es un señor de 32 años está casado con la señora Lucy juntos tienen 2 hijas pequeñas, son una familia unida viven en la provincia de Punata en la ciudad de Cochabamba, el señor Ariel y su esposa trabajan mucho para ofrecerles un mejor nivel de vida a sus hijas, su principal actividad es la producción de la leche cruda para lo cual cuentan con ganado lechero y el producto entregan a una empresa que se dedica a la elaboración de productos lácteos, doña Lucy estudio para profesora pero hace más de 3 años que no puede conseguir  trabajado esto a consecuencia del gran desempleo que existe en Bolivia por tal motivo se dedicó a otro actividad. El destino del crédito es para la compra de un ganado lechero con lo cual incrementar su producción y tendrá mayor ingreso.
Entre sus sueños y metas esta terminar de construir su casa ya que le falta la obra fina y crecer hasta tener una pequeña granja de por lo menos 30 cabezas de ganado lechero.
texts.en:
Ariel is a 32 year old man who is married to Lucy. Together, they have two little girls. They are a close family. They live in the province of Punata in the city of Cochabamba. Ariel and his wife work a lot in order to offer a better quality of life to their daughters. His main activity is producing raw milk, for which he has milk cows. He delivers his milk to a business that makes dairy products. Lucy studied to be a teacher but she has not been able to get work for 3 years as a result of the high unemployment in Bolivia, so she does other work. The loan will be used to buy a milk cow to increase his production and bring in better income. 
Finishing his house is one of his dreams and goals - it is missing the finishing work. He also wants to grow his farm and have at least 30 head of milk cows.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru: Малика проживает в Гиссарском районе. Ей 36 лет. Она замужем. У нее шестеро детей. Малика вместе с мужем занимается торговлей. У нее имеется продуктовый магазин. В этой области она 10 лет. Она берет кредит для приобретения небольшого холодильника для газированных напитков.
texts.en: Malika lives in the Gissar region.  She is 36 years old.  She is married.  She has six children.  Malika works in sales together with her husband.  She owns a grocery store.  She has worked in this sphere for 10 years.  She is taking out a loan to purchase a small refrigerator for carbonated beverages.

loans.use: to purchase a small refrigerator for carbonated beverages

loans.name: Oscar Eduardo

texts.es:
Oscar es un hombre de 44 años de edad, conviviente y con 03 hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa propia con su conviviente y sus hijos. Su domicilio se encuentra  en el Caserío El Convento Dist. Tambogrande, además cuenta con los servicios básicos.
La actividad que desarrolla el Oscar es la ganadería y agricultura lo cual posee experiencia en este negocio; el ganado al alcanzar peso y tamaño  lo comercializa en el mercado local. También cuenta con 0.50 ha de terreno agrícola en donde siembra arroz. El cultivo de arroz actualmente tiene 30 días de trasplantado. 
El monto solicitado es de 2,000 nuevos soles dicho crédito será destinado para la compra de  fertilizantes para su cultivo de arroz.Gozan de muy buenas referencias.
texts.en:
Oscar is a 44 year old man with a common-law marriage and three children under his care. He lives in his own house with his spouse and children. His home is in the small village of El Convento in the district of Tambogrande and it has basic services.

Oscar works in and has experience with livestock and agriculture. When the livestock reach a certain weight and size he sells them in the local market. He also has 0.5 hectares of agricultural land where he grows rice. His current rice harvest was planted 30 days ago. 

The loan request is for 2,000 PEN (Peruvian Nuevos Soles), which Oscar will use to purchase fertilizers for his rice crops. He has very good references.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for his crops of rice.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: Mohamed, 41 years old, is married and has children aged 18 and 12. In 1997, Mohamed established his local foodstuff business since he needed a source of income to provide for his family's livelihood. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about SLL 900,000 every month from this business.  Mohamed requires a loan of SLL 3,000,000 to buy more local foodstuff for his business. In the future, Mohamed plans to build his own house and educate his children to the university level. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more local foodstuff for his business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther, 49 years old, lives in Buchanan. She is married and has 8 children aged between 10 and 36 years old. Six of the children live at home and attend school, and the two oldest live on their own. Esther's husband works with a company as a heavy duty mechanic.

For the past 27 years, Esther has been involved in local soap making. Her mother taught her how to make the soap. Esther is requesting a loan to purchase caustic, oil, and others items for her business. In the future, she wants to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase caustic, oil, and others items for her soap making business

loans.name: Nasim

texts.ru: Насим житель города Душанбе. Ему 25 лет. Он женат. Он предоставляет услугу, такси. В этой области Насим два года. Он берет кредит для приобретения новой машины.
texts.en: Nasim lives in the city of Dushanbe.  He is 25 years old.  He is married.  He offers taxi services.  He has worked in this business for two years.  He is taking out a loan to purchase a new car.

loans.use: to purchase a new car

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.ru: Сабохат жительница города Душанбе. Ей 51 год. Она разведена. У нее двое детей. Она занимается шитьем матрасов (курпача). Этим видом деятельности она занимается 7 лет. Кредит берет для покупки тканей чтобы сшить матрасы для продажи.
texts.en: Sabohat lives in the city of Dushanbe.  She is 51 years old.  She is divorced.  She has two children.  She sews patchwork mattresses (kurpacha).  She has worked in this sphere for 7 years.  She is taking out a loan to purchase fabric in order to sew mattresses for sale.

loans.use: to purchase fabric

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: La señora Marcelina tiene 47 años está casada con el señor Mario, tienen 3 hijos de los cuales 1 ya es independiente, y sus otros dos hijos estudian, son una familia unida y muy trabajadores, doña Marcelina nos cuenta que su marido enfermo por una parálisis cerebral y que poco a poco se está recuperando y su deseo más grande de doña Marcelina es que se recupere totalmente para que pueda seguir trabajado ya que ella sola está manteniendo a toda la familia. Su principal actividad de la señora Marcelina es la producción de la leche cruda, para ello cuenta con ganado lechero donde el producto vende a una empresa que se dedica a la elaboración de productos lácteos, el destino del préstamo es para la compra de forraje para la alimentación de su ganado, este préstamo le ayudara mucho ya que necesitaba acumular forraje para la temporada de sequía y de esta manera no tendrá escasez de alimento para el ganado y tendrá más producción de leche y con lo cual incrementara sus ingresos, además la señora Marcelina es una madre muy buena ya que le heredo a su hijo mayor un lote de terreno donde su puedan construir y de esa manera no pasar incomodidades, entre otro de sus deseos es que sus dos hijos estudien hasta tener una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 47 years old, is married to Mario and they have 3 children of which one is now independent. Her other two children study.  They are a united and very hard-working family. Marcelina tells us that her husband became sick due to cerebral palsy and that little by little he is recovering.  Marcelina's biggest desire is that he completely recovers so he is able to continue working. Since she is alone she is supporting the whole family.  

The main business of Marcelina is the production of raw milk, for which she has dairy cattle and sells the product to a business that works in the production of dairy products. The loan will be used to buy fodder to feed the cattle. This loan will help her a lot since she needed to accumulate fodder for the drought season. In this way she will not have a shortage of food for the cattle and will have higher production of milk, with which she will increase her income. 

Furthermore, Marcelina is a very good mother. She gave her oldest son a lot of land as inheritance where they can build and in this way not be uncomfortable.  Another of her desires is that her two sons study until they have a professional career.

loans.use: to buy fodder to feed her dairy cattle.

loans.name: Rùben

texts.es:
Rubén es un hombre de  63 años de edad, vive en casa familiar, vive con 02 hijos mayores de los cuales aportan en la canasta familiar, su domicilio está ubicada en el caserío Tongorrape distrito de Motupe, así mismo cuenta con los servicios básicos de luz y agua. 
La actividad que desarrolla el Rubén  es la cría y comercio de ganado,  esta actividad la realiza desde hace  20  años lo cual posee bastante experiencia y lo aprendió esta actividad de su padre. Cuentan con clientes  ya establecidos en la zona. 
El  monto solicitado es de 2,000 nuevos soles dicho crédito será destinado para la compra de alimentos de sus animales, y de esta manera poder tener mejores ingresos para su hogar y  mejorar su calidad de vida. Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona ya que el titular cuenta con clientela ya establecida.
texts.en:
Rubén is a 63 year old man and lives in a house with his family. He lives with his 2 older children, who help with the family needs. Their home is located in the settlement Tongorrape in the district of Motupe. Here they have basic services of electricity and water.

The business that Rubén carries out is the rearing and sale of livestock. He has carried out this business since 20 years ago, so he has plenty of experience and learned this business from his father. He has established clients in the area.  The total requested is 2,000 nuevo soles. Said loan will be intended to buy food for his animals. In this manner, he will be able to provide a better income for his home and improve his quality of life. For this area, there isn't greater competence in the region since the owner has clients already established.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for his animals.

loans.name: Asirya

texts.en:
Asirya is a widow from Kfar Yassif. She began working to create a monthly income for herself and her family many years ago when her husband passed away. Originally, she sold pita made over an open fire pit. She has branched out to include additional homemade items and crocheted items, which she sells.  Asirya is expanding her business activity and introducing pita and bread made in the tabun oven. This will allow her to increase her supply and meet demands from her customers. The business is located in her home and draws clients with her fresh and delicious pita & bread.

Asirya needs her loan to purchase a special tabun oven and bread making supplies and materials.

Asirya wants to continue and provide an even better income for her family and draw clients from throughout the area.

loans.use: To purchase a special tabun (clay) oven and bread making supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Mahmadrajab

texts.ru: Махмадрачаб проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 52 года. Женат. Имеет пятерых детей. Махмадрачаб занимается торговлей. У него имеется магазин со смешанным ассортиментом. Торговлей он занимается десять лет. Кредит берет для приобретения парфюмерии и покупки продуктов с целью увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Mahmadrajab lives in Kulob.  He is 52 years old.  He is married .  He has five children.  Mahmadrajab works in retail.  He has a store that sells a variety of products.  He has worked in retail for ten years.  He is taking out a loan to purchase perfume and other products in order to increase his turnover.

loans.use: to purchase perfume and other products for sale

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La señora Luisa tiene 39 años de edad, ella es conviviente y vive con  su pareja que es cocinero, ellos tienen 3 hijos. Ellos aún no se casan porque esto genera mucho gasto y no están en condiciones de hacerlo, porque tienen otros gastos importantes, Luisa se dedica a la crianza de  animales menores tales como cuyes, chanchos, y aves de corral. 
Ella solicita el préstamo para comprar más animales para engorde,  hacerlos reproducir y venderlos ya que representan todo su patrimonio y sustento familiar..
La socia agradece el préstamo otorgado y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
La socia Luisa; pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; Ubicados en el distrito de Andahuaylillas de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú.
texts.en:
Luisa is 39 years old and in a common law marriage. She lives with her partner who is a cook, and they have 3 children.  They are still single because they are not able to handle the expenses associated with married life. In addition, they have other expenditures that they have to deal with at the moment.  Luisa raises small animals such as guinea pigs, piglets, and chickens.  She requests a loan to by more animals for fattening, breeding and to sell them. They represent all of her wealth and family sustenance.

Luisa appreciates and values the loan that has been provided to her. She agrees to make her payments on the established due dates. Luisa is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Triunfadoras”, which is located in the district of Andahuaylillas and of the city of Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: to buy animals for fattening and sale.

loans.name: Josè Antonio

texts.es:
José es un hombre de 26  años de edad, Soltero sin carga familiar directa, Vive en casa propia, próximo a contraer nupcias. Cliente vive en la zona urbana marginal del distrito de Lambayeque,   cuenta con servicios de  luz, el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 100  familias.
La actividad que desarrolla el José es el transporte público de pasajeros en una moto taxi, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 2 años, el ámbito de desarrollo del negocio es la zona urbano de Lambayeque.
El monto solicitado es de 1,500 nuevos soles dicho crédito será destinado para invertir en la compra de planchas de eternit para el techado de su casa y compra de SOAT para su renovación.
texts.en:
José is a 26 year old single man with no family members under his care. He lives in his own house that has electricity and he is the next to get married. He lives in the outskirts of an urban zone in the district of Lambayeque, in a small community with approximately 100 families.

José provides public transportation for passengers in a motorcar-taxi, an activity he has been doing for 2 years. The reach of his business is the urban zone of Lambayeque.

The loan request is for 1,500 PEN (Peruvian Nuevos Soles), which José will use to purchase Eternit brand plates for the roof of his house for its renovation and also to purchase SOAT vehicle insurance.

loans.use: to purchase Eternit brand plates for the roof of his house and to purchase SOAT vehicle insurance.

loans.name: Ollantay Ii Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Ollantay II” en la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son varios años que funciona el banco comunal y está muy bien organizado. Este banco comunal está conformado por doce personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; venta de comida, artesanía, abarrotes, cosméticos y otros se dedican a brindar servicios de transporte urbano y rural. 

(La señora Margarita está levantando la mano en la fotografía). La señora Margarita nació en la ciudad de Anta de la provincia de Anta del departamento del Cusco pero vive en la encantadora ciudad del Cusco, tiene 60 años de edad, es casada y fruto de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos. Su actividad económica principal de la socia Margarita es la venta de productos de primera necesidad  como por ejemplo azúcar, fideos, arroz y otras cosas más. Su actividad económica complementaria es la elaboración de tejidos de chompas de lana de alpaca. Ya son quince años que se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Margarita requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería por mayor como por ejemplo sacos de azúcar, sacos de arroz y  con el resto comprar lana de alpaca y lana sintética. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.

Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas. Cusco se caracteriza por ser una zona turística, por sus centros arqueológicos, por su centro histórico, por sus paisajes, por su historia, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”. 

(La persona que aparece en la parte inferior de la fotografía llego tarde a la reunión).
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends formed the communal bank “Ollantay II” in the city of Cusco. The communal bank has been operating for several years now, and it is very well organized. This communal bank is made up of twelve people who are always looking for opportunities to get ahead and provide a better future for their children with their daily efforts. The members' economic activities include sales of food, handicrafts, groceries, and cosmetics, while others dedicate themselves to providing urban and rural transportation services. 

(Margarita is raising her hand in the photograph.) Margarita was born in the city of Anta, in the province of Anta, department of Cusco. However, she now lives in the enchanting city of Cusco. She is 60 years old and married, and from this relationship she has four children. Margarita's main economic activity is selling basic staple products, such as sugar, noodles, rice and other items. Her complementary economic activity is making sweaters woven from alpaca wool. She has been selling groceries for fifteen years now, and it is going very well for her thanks to the dedication she puts into her work. At this time, Margarita needs the loan to buy merchandise on a wholesale basis, such as sacks of sugar and sacks of rice. With the rest, she will buy alpaca wool and synthetic wool. 

All of the members are grateful for the opportunity provided to them, and they are committed to making their various loan payments on schedule. 

Cusco is located in the district and province of Cusco, in the department of Cusco, at the very heart of the ancient city of the Incas. Cusco is known as a tourist attraction thanks to its archaeological centers, its historic city center, its landscapes, its history, and its traditional festival of Inti Raymi, and because one of the seven wonders of the world, Machu Picchu, is found here. 

(The person who appears in the lower part of the photograph arrived late to the meeting.)

loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise such as sacks of sugar and sacks of rice, as well as alpaca wool and synthetic wool.

loans.name: Sullay

texts.en:
Sullay, 35 years old, is married and has 2 children aged 1 and 5. In 2007, Sullay established his spare parts business. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,800,000 every month from this business. Sullay would like a loan of SLL 4,000,000 in order to buy the following items: 10 lift-pumps @ SLL 750,000, 50 oil filters @ SLL 750,000, 100 universal joints @ SLL 1,500,000, 20 brake kits @ SLL 600,000, and 20 cylinder heads @ SLL 400,000. This loan will help him to increase his profit and to expand the business. Frequent price increases are affecting his business a bit.

In the future, Sullay plans to build a house and acquire a garage on his own. He is hardworking and reliable. Sullay hopes to continue to access loans from ARD. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Issa

texts.en:
This is 51-year-old Issa. He is married and has four children aged 21, 21, 10, and 8 years. 

In 1986, Issa established his business selling sandals, crepes (a kind of shoe), boots, etc. Working seven days a week and eleven hours a day, he earns about Le 2,080,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Issa requires a loan in order to buy shoes - 6 bags @ Le 500,000.

In the future, Issa plans to build a house, buy a car, send his son abroad, and open a shop. The loan will help him to earn more income.  Shortage of the items from suppliers is his major challenge. He is a trustworthy and hardworking businessman. He will repay the loan within the specified period.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy shoes - 6 bags @ Le 500,000.

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en: Esperance, 28 years old, sells a variety of items in the shop that she has been running for the past two years. With this loan she wants to buy more sodas, potatoes, bananas and beans to sell. Esperance plans to use her profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sodas, potatoes and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Gibrila

texts.en: Gibrila, 28 years old, is married and has 2 children aged 5 and 3. In 2008, Gibrila established his retail business, selling items such as powdered milk, sweet milk, cocoa, biscuits, sweets, soap, paste, batteries, etc. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,400,000 every month from this business.  Gibrila would like a loan of SLL 4,000,000 in order to buy more stock as follows: powdered milk - 2 cartons @ SLL 1,320,000, batteries - 5 cartons @ SLL 850,000, sweet milk - 5 cartons @ SLL 1,000,000, sachet milk - 9 bundles @ SLL 315,000. Gibrila will use the balance as transport. In the future, Gibrila plans to build a house, educate his children and improve his family's living standards. This loan will help him to achieve these goals. Gibrila is a hardworking businessman. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy stock for his business

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is 33 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married with six children between 1 and 11 years old. All of the children live at home and attend school. Her husband works for a company. For the past seven years, she has been operating a shop (restaurant). She learned this way of selling from  her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, oil, charcoal and other items for her business, In the future, she wants to build a house for her children..

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, charcoal and other items for her business

loans.name: Ibrahim S.

texts.en: This is 46-year-old Ibrahim S. He is married and has five children who are 20, 18, 15, 11 and 6 years old. He has one additional dependent (an orphan)who lives with him. In 2007, Ibrahim S. established his used bicycles business.  Working 7 day.a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,900,000 every month from this business.  He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Ibrahim S. has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy bicycles. He needs  (26 size) - 10 pieces @ Le295,000; mountain bicycles - (24 size) - 7 pieces @ Le270,000, BMX bicycles -(20 size) - 1 piece @ Le150,000.  The balance of Le10,000 will be used to pay laborers. In the future, Ibrahim S. plans to build a house, buy a car, and provide quality education for his children.This loan will help him to accomplish his plans. His major challenge is competition. He is hard working and honest. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy bicycles and pay for labor

loans.name: Yanah Futha

texts.en: This is 40-year-old Yanah Futha. She is married and has four children aged 19, 12, 10 and 4 years old. In 2002, Yanah Futha established her clothing and bags business. She began her business because she used to assist her mother after school hours.  She stopped in class 5 and she was handed in early marriage to a driver who established a business for her. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 2,708,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. Yanah Futha requires a loan in order to buy lace 30 pieces @ Le100,000 and Bamakoh Cloth 10 suites @ Le200,000. In the future, Yanah Futha plans to educate her children up to university, travel abroad, and build a house. The loan will help her to improve the business.  She is a hardworking businesswoman.  She hopes to get another loan after paying this loan.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy lace and Bamakoh Cloth

loans.name: Muna

texts.en:
Muna lives in Buchanan with her husband and four children. The children are between 7 and 12 years old, are in school and live at home.

For the past 12 years, she has been selling fresh Bonnie fish in the market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and learned this way of selling from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fresh Bonnie fish for her business.

Her goal is to send her children to school until they graduate.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh Bonnie fish for her business.

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en: Francoise is 30 years old. She sells trousers and sweaters for kids. She has spent six years in this business. From the experience she has, she is capable of making her business more convenient to the customers by requesting a loan to buy more sweaters and trousers for kids. She plans to use the profits for expanding her volume business.

loans.use: To buy more children's trousers and sweaters to sell.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 35 years old. She is a mother of two children between 8 and 14 years old. She has sold charcoal for seven years. She has requested the loan to buy more charcoal to sell. With the profits, she wants to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Lucillia

texts.en:
Lucillia is 44 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married with five children between the ages of 11 and 23.

For the past five years, she has been selling used clothes in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her aunt. She enjoys the money she receives from her business every day. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Lucillia hopes to improve her children's education and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира более 20 лет занимается шитьем. Ей 39 лет. Она замужем. У нее пятеро детей. Замира берет кредит для покупки новой швейной машинки.
texts.en: Zamira has been sewing for more than 20 years. She is 39 years old, married, and has five children. Zamira is asking for a loan to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Marthe

texts.en: Marthe sells animals, especially goats. She is married to a businessman. With the loan, she wants to buy more goats to sell. She plans to use the profits for resolving all the family issues that she is facing now in the way of providing for the family.

loans.use: To buy more goats to sell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia is 20 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and she has a two-year-old child who lives at home. For the past 11 years, she has been selling rubber dishes (cups, plates, bowls) in the local market. She started this business with help from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rubber dishes (cups, plates, bowls) for her business. She plans to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more rubber dishes (cups, plates, bowls) for her business

loans.name: Demetria

texts.en:
Demetria is 54 years old and is a married woman with five children aged between 15 and 27 years. Her husband is a farmer.

Demetria sells Natasha and Personal Collection (Filipino-owned direct sales companies) products to her community. She earns 3,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month doing this business. Demetria aims to improve her business and provide a bright future for her children.

Demetria is requesting a loan to buy more products to sell, such as cosmetics and clothes. This will help increase her sales and profitability.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell such as cosmetics and clothes.

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Isata. She is married and has children aged 10 and 7 years. She has one additional dependent who is her sales assistant. 
 
In 2010, Isata established her drinks and cement business. She began her business because she failed to get a job after she left, so she then decided to go into business and be self-employed. Her business helps her provide a livelihood for her family. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Isata requires a loan in order to buy more drinks and cement for her business. In the future, Isata plans to build a house and educate her children well. She is thanking you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more drinks and cement for her business.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es:
Jenny 
500.000
Orotina 
	 Mujer microempresaria de 40 años y con dos hijos menores, actualmente vive con ellos y su esposo en un distrito del Cantón de Orotina en la provincia de Alajuela. Se presenta como una mujer emprendedora, maneja desde hace 10 años su negocio, que ha sido un importante apoyo a los ingresos de la familia, además genera empleo,  ya que 2 personas de la comunidad reciben mercadería, obteniendo ingresos para el apoyo de sus hogares también. Ella empezó  esta actividad para trabajar desde la casa y estar  cerca de la crianza de sus hijos pequeños, por lo que le permite además de cuidarlos generar ingresos desde el hogar.

	 En un inicio pidió crédito a una distribuidora de productos pagando puntualmente e iniciando con un pequeño capital de trabajo para su negocio. En el 2006 solicita un préstamo a Fundación Mujer por 500.000 para la compra de mercadería, el cual canceló 3 meses antes de la fecha establecida.

	Es una actividad consolidada, tiene 2 proveedores grandes y maneja 2 jóvenes que venden el producto en la zona además de ella. Es una microempresa bien estructurada. 

La actividad, ofrece una gran variedad de productos (ropa interior, licras, mañanitas, boxer, sostenes, juegos de niña y pijamas, entre otros), genera empleo en la zona y además demostró una excelente conducta de pago en un préstamo anterior. Se requiere de capital para comprar más producto ya qu ese ha crecido en clientela y se necesitan cubrir nuevos pedidos.
texts.en:
Jenny is a 40 year old entrepreneur with two young children. She currently lives with her children and husband in the district of Cantón de Orotina in the province of Alajuela. 

Jenny is an entrepreneurial woman who has spent the past 10 years handling her business. The business has been an important support for the family's income and in addition it generates employment: two people from the community receive the merchandise and earn income to support their homes as well. Jenny started this activity in order to work from the house and be close to raise her young children. The business allows her to not only take care of the children but also to generate income from the home.

In the beginning she asked for a credit from a product distributor, paid punctually, and initiated her business with a small capital. In 2006 she requested a loan from Fundación Mujer for 500.000 for the purchase of merchandise, which she paid off 3 months before the established date.

It is a consolidated activity that has 2 large suppliers and 2 young people in addition to Jenny who sell the product in the zone. It is a well-structured small business.

The activity offers a great variety of products including underwear, tights, bathrobes, boxers, bras, children's games, and pajamas, among others. It generates employment in the region and in addition demonstrated an excellent payment conduct with a previous loan. More capital is needed in order to purchase more products, since they have attracted new customers and need to cover new requests.

loans.use: to purchase men's, women's, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Luzarina

texts.en:
Luzarina is 52 years old. She is a married woman with three children ages 19, 20 and 23. 

She sells fish for a living. She also makes dried fish and raises pigs to sell. She earns 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month doing these activities. 

Luzarina works hard to provide for her family's basic needs. She requested a loan to buy pigs to raise and more fresh fish to sell. This loan will help increase her sales and business profitability.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise and more fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Sandrine

texts.en: Sandrine is aged 23. She is married to a driver, and they have two children aged 3 and 5. She has been selling saucepans for one year. She needs the loan to buy more saucepans to sell. She expects to use the profits for expanding the business through investing in the business.

loans.use: To buy more saucepans to sell.

loans.name: Marie Louise

texts.en: Marie Louise is a mother of two children. She sells shoes, and she has been doing business for the past three years. She would like to get the loan to buy more shoes to sell. With the profits, she will increase the volume of the business by adding more merchandise.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more second-hand clothes and spare parts for the bajaji (motorized rickshaws).

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en: Jean Damascene is a father of four children, and all of the children go to school. He owns a restaurant, which he has been running for the past 10 years. Jean Damascene is 37 years old. He has requested the loan to buy more foodstuffs for use in the restaurant. He plans to use the profits for building his home.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for use in the restaurant.

loans.name: Nadine

texts.en: Nadine is 37 years old. She has run a restaurant for eight years. She wants the loan to buy more yeasts, tea, breads and fresh milk for making tea. She plans to use the profits for savings, and provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more yeasts, tea, breads and fresh milk.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia es una mujer de 38 años de edad, conviviente, con 02 hijos en su poder, Vive en casa propia con su esposo e hijos domicilio esta ubicado en el caserío Bello Horizonte distrito de Tambogrande – Piura; además cuenta con los servicios básicos de Luz y agua.
La actividad que desarrolla la Celia es la venta de ropa, accesorios y además se dedica a la crianza de animales entre ganado ovino y aves de corral. Así mismo tiene experiencia en este negocio aproximadamente más de 6 años. Además  es muy conocida en la zona, posee un buena relación con sus clientes  y cuenta con apoyo de sus hijos y cónyuge.
El monto solicitado es de 2200 nuevos soles dicho crédito será para surtir su negocio (compra de polos, short de temporada de invierno) y compra de alimento balanceado para sus animales. Celia tiene grandes deseos de superación y crecimiento en el negocio.
texts.en:
Celia is a thirty-eight year old woman and spouse who cares for two children. She lives in her own home, which is located in the village of Bello Horizonte in the district of Tambogrande, in Piura, with her husband and children. Additionally, they now have the basic utility services of electricity and water. 
Celia sells clothing and accessories, and also raises lambs and chickens. As a result, she has been working in this business for more than six years. She is well-known in the region, she has a good relationship with her customers, and she relies on the help of her husband and children.
She is requesting a loan of 2200 PEN [$850] which she will use to supply her business (by purchasing t-shirts and winter shorts) and to purchase healthy feed for her animals. Celia has a great desire to get ahead and to help her business to grow.

loans.use: to supply her business with merchandise and to purchase healthy feed for her animals.

loans.name: Karla

texts.es:
Perfil Karla 
C 300.000 
Puntarenas.
	 Es madre de 3 hijos, tiene 37 años vive en la zona de Puntarenas, en él Pacífico Central de Costa Rica;   obtuvo el bachillerato en un colegio técnico,  ha trabajado en varias empresas en el área contable pero la necesidad económica y el tener hijos pequeños no le permitieron seguir de esta forma;  ella junto a su esposo decidieron que estuviera en la casa ya que él trabaja como guardacostas y se ausenta 2 semanas al mes. Con decisión y ante la necesidad económica decide arriesgar un capital hace 2 años con el que inició, manteniendo hasta la fecha un micro negocio.  Invirtió la mitad del dinero del alquiler de la casa, comprando bisutería y comenzó a venderla en su barrio y en las instituciones de la zona, recuperando el dinero y obteniendo una ganancia con la cual ha seguido comprando mercadería. Buscando la posibilidad de crecer se acerca a la Oficina de la Mujer  de Puntarenas donde le brindan información de Fundación Mujer. Desea incrementar su capital y así comprar otros productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y mejorar los ingresos para el apoyo a su hogar.

	. Ella tiene una pensión de 60000 colones por su hijo mayor y los otros dos son apoyados por su actual esposo. Ella busca el crecimiento de su empresa ya que se ha consolidado en su zona pero no le alcanza lo ganado para comprar otros productos de mayor valor como ropa y bolsos de moda, para damas.


	 Emprendedora acostumbrada a trabajar y desarrollar sus capacidades laborales de la mejor forma,  han ido mejorando su calidad de vida, ya que adquirió una casa propia de bienestar social. Su mayor deseo es tener su propio bazar pero va avanzando poco a poco, si requiere de un capital para diversificar su mercadería y poder crecer con su negocio, el cual es pequeño pero consolidado.
texts.en:
Profile: Karla
300,000 CRC [$625]
Puntarenas
Karla is thirty-seven years old, the mother of three children, and lives in Puntarenas, on the Central Pacific Coast of Costa Rica. She earned a diploma at a technical school and she has worked in accounting for several businesses, but her financial needs and her small children did not make it possible for her to continue working this way. She and her husband decided that she should stay at home since he works in the coast guard and is away for two weeks each month. As a result of their decision and her financial needs, she decided to invest her capital two years ago to start a micro business, which she still runs. She invested half her money renting a house and purchasing imitation jewelry. She began to sell the jewelry in her neighborhood and in establishments in the region, recouping the money she invested and earning a profit which she used to continue purchasing more merchandise. When she looked for an opportunity to grow her business, she went to the Women’s Office in Puntarenas where she was informed about the Fundación Mujer [Women’s Foundation]. She wants to increase her capital and be able to purchase other products so she can offer them to her customers and improve her earnings to provide for her household.

She receives 60,000 CRC [$119] in alimony for her eldest child. Her other two are provided for by her current husband. She is looking to grow her business since it has grown stronger in her region, but she has not yet earned enough to purchase products of greater value, like fashionable clothing and bags for women.

She is an enterprising woman who is used to working and developing her abilities in the best way possible. She has improved her quality of life since she has acquired her own home for her social well-being. Her biggest dream is to have her own store. Little by little, she keeps moving forward. She needs capital to diversify her merchandise and be able to grow her business, which is small but strong.

loans.use: to purchase imitation jewelry, in addition to clothing and bags for women.

loans.name: Monique

texts.en: Monique is a mother of two children. She is 30 years old, married to a truck driver. She has requested the loan to buy more charcoal to sell. Monique plans to use the profits for expanding the business for a better future.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: El Paraiso  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal  El Paraíso está formado por 14 socias y 2 socios quienes viven en diferentes sectores de la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, este lugar es de clima frió, tiene varios lugares para visitar y sentir la paz y tranquilidad de la naturaleza. Su gente al igual que nuestras socias se dedican a la cría de animales, agricultura y comercio, muchos laboran en la ciudad ejerciendo diferentes actividades económicas, son personas de un corazón muy cálido, amables, gentiles y siempre mantienen vivo sus tradiciones y cultura.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señorita. Rosa Cecilia, tiene 27 años de edad, es madre soltera de un niño de 4 años de edad. Vive  en una casa que es de su propiedad.

La Señorita. Rosa Cecilia se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y a la cría de cerdos, pollos y cuyes  a los que los vende en su comunidad. También dos veces por semana trabaja en el arreglo de casas.

Se encuentra en su quinto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos, pollos, cuyes y en el alimento para los mismos.
 
Su sueño es de viajar y conocer varios lugares del mundo.
texts.en:
The El Paraíso Communal Bank [Paradise Communal Bank] consists of fourteen women and two men who live in different parts of the Cumbe parish in Cuenca, a place with a cold climate which has many places worth visiting to enjoy the region’s natural peace and tranquility. The people of Cuenca, like the communal bank’s members, raise animals and work in agriculture and commerce. Many work in the city, performing different jobs, and all are very warm-hearted, friendly, courteous, who always keep their traditions and culture alive.

One of the members of the El Paraíso group is Rosa Cecilia, who is twenty-seven years old and a single mother who cares for her four year old son. She lives in a house which she owns.

Rosa Cecilia takes care of her duties in the house and raises hogs, chickens, and guinea pigs, which she sells in her community. Additionally, she works twice a week cleaning houses.

She is requesting her fifth loan with the communal bank, and she will invest it by purchasing hogs, chickens, and guinea pigs, as well as feed for them.

Her dream is to travel and see the world.

loans.use: to purchase  hogs, chickens, and guinea pigs, as well as feed for them.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en: Farida is 37 years old. She sells beans and she has been selling beans for two years. With the loan she wants to buy more beans to sell. The profits from the business will be used to invest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more beans to sell.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua sells charcoal at Asebu near Cape Coast, which she has done for 2 years now. Efua is married. Her husband is a farmer. She uses her income  to help her husband to pay their accommodation bills. Efua will use her loan to purchase bags of charcoal to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, Efua will produce the charcoal she sells herself.

loans.use: purchase bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua lives together with her husband and 2 children at Asebu near Cape Coast. Efua sells charcoal, which she has done for 6 years now. She is married, and her husband is a photographer. She uses her income to help her husband to feed and clothe their children. Efua will use her loan to purchase bags of charcoal to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, Efua will produce the charcoal she sells herself.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is a small-scale trader. She trades in children's dresses, ladies wear, underwear, brassieres and panties, which she has done for 3 years. She  lives at Asebu near Takoradi. Monica is married and has 1 child. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their accommodation bills. Monica will use her loan to purchase children's dresses, underwear and ladies wear. With the new profit from her expanded business, she wishes to build a shop to enable her to sell dresses.

loans.use: to purchase children's dresses, underwear and ladies wear.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba cooks rice, gari and bean stew for sale at Asebu near Cape Coast. Aba is married and has 1 child. She has been in this business for 5 years. Aba uses her income to help her husband to pay their utility and accommodation bills. She will use her loan to purchase bags of rice, gari, beans and fish to cook for sale. With the new profits, Aba plans to build a better stall for the sale of her food.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, gari, beans and fish to cook for sale

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina sells frozen beef, chicken and fish at Asebu near Cape Coast, which she has done for 10 years now. She is married with 3 children. Her husband is a mechanic. Faustina uses her income to assist her husband to feed and clothe their children. Faustina will use her loan to purchase frozen beef, chicken and fish to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase frozen beef, chicken and fish to sell

loans.name: Jyambere Mugore Group

texts.fr:
Marie Gorette fait partie du groupe Jyambere Mugore. Elle a 30 ans et elle est mariée avec 4 enfants, le moins âgé a 1 mois et le plus âgé a 9 ans. Son niveau d’études est 5 ans de primaire.

Marie Gorette est agricultrice des maïs. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va louer un champ, acheter 400 kg de maïs (semences) et 50 kg de fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance du business, est demande d’autres crédits pour augmenter la capacité de  ses activités et acheter d’autres champs pour augmenter la production agricole. Dans l’avenir Marie Gorette voudrait être la meilleur dans l’agriculture dans son secteur. Avec le profit  elle prévoit de construire une maison  et continuer à assure le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Marie Gorette is a member of the Jyambere Mugore group.  She is 30 years old, married, and has four children, ages one month to 9 years.  Her education level is five years of elementary school.

Marie Gorette is a maize farmer.  This is her second loan with ACB.  She will lease a field, buy 400 kilos of maize seeds and 50 kilos of fertilizers, and pay for the cost of labor.

In order to expand her business, her strategy is to request other loans in order to increase her level of activity and to buy additional fields in order to increase her crop output.  In the future, Marie Gorette would like to be a major farmer in her region.  With her profits, she is planning to build a house and to continue to ensure the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to lease a field, buy 400 kilos of maize seeds and 50 kilos of fertilizers, and pay for the cost of labor.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua lives together with her husband and 7 dependents at Asebu near Cape Coast. Ekua produces charcoal for sale,  which she has done for 8 years now. She uses her income to assist her husband to pay their children’s school fees. Ekua will use her loan to purchase firewood to produce charcoal to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, Ekua will produce the charcoal in large quantities.

loans.use: purchase firewood to produce charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Avtandil

texts.en:
Avtandil is 50 years old. He lives in Sagarejo District, East Georgia with his family: wife – Khatuna, two sons (26 and 23 years old), and parents (retired). Avtandil is a truck driver. He has his own truck and gets orders for transportation of various goods. Along with the abovementioned, he is actively involved in the family's agricultural business. They have a vineyard with a total area of 0.8 hectare.  Avtandil and his sons work in the vineyard during the year and they sell the harvested grapes in the village to local retailers. The total average monthly income of the family is 1000 Laris. 

Avtandil requested credit to purchase drugs for the vineyard. He will use them for the treatment of the vines from parasites. After properly completing the seasonal agricultural work, the family will have a better harvest of grapes than in previous years. They will sell the harvest for higher prices and the family will get more income, which will be used for improving family living conditions. In particular, Avtandil plans to finish the renovation of his house, started a couple of months ago.  Avtandil couldn’t finish it because of lack of financial resources.

loans.use: buy plant medicine for his vineyard

loans.name: Badri

texts.en:
Badri is fifty years old. He lives in a small village of Tskaltubo District, West Georgia. Badri lives with his twenty-two-year-old daughter and two grandsons (five and three years old). He is the only income provider of the family. Badri grows greens on a family-owned plot of land; he sells harvested greens in Kutaisi (nearby town). Total average monthly income of the family is 350 Laris. According to Credo calculations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Badri requested credit for the start-up of a new type of agricultural business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit Badri will purchase wooden materials, a polyethylene cover and will build the greenhouse. A small part of the credit will also be used to purchase cucumber and tomato seeds. Badri will grow cucumbers and tomatoes throughout the whole year in the greenhouse and will sell harvested products on Kutaisi market. The income of the family will significantly increase and Badri will be able to create better living conditions for his daughter and grandsons. Along with the above-mentioned, in the future the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase materials to build a greenhouse.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is thirty years old. He lives in Kvareli District, East Georgia. George is unmarried and lives with his younger sister and niece. His sister is a single mother and George is the only income provider in the family. At the moment the only income of the family is approximately 100 Laris per month, which comes from the sale of a small amount of vegetables, grown by the family on their own plot of land. According to Crede estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

George requested credit to start-up in the trade business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit George will open a butcher’s store in a family-owned small building near to the local market. He will purchase a fridge and meat for resale. He will purchase meat from local farmers and sell it in the store. According to George’s estimations the average monthly profit of the store will be approximately 500 Laris. The income of the family will significantly increase and they will be able to improve their living conditions. In addition to the above-mentioned the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase refregerator and meet for resale

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is sixty-two years old. He lives in Khoni District, West Georgia with his family: his wife – Darejan and two sons (twenty-three and twenty years old). Darejan works as a nurse in the village. Michael has health problems and receives a relevant pension from the government. The family owns a plot of land, where 250 nut trees are grown. Michael sells nuts on Khoni Market. The total average monthly income of the family is 450 Laris. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Michael requested credit for the start-up of an agricultural business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit Michael will purchase four calves and three lambs. He will place the calves and lambs in the cattle-shed, located in his yard. During six months Michael will feed them and after six months, he will sell the grown calves and sheep for higher price. Michael plans to reinvest the profit in the same business and purchase more domestic animals to expand his business. As a result of the start-up loan the income of the family will increase over the long-term. They will be able to improve their living conditions and in addition to the above-mentioned in the future the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase lambs and calves.

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi is 52 years old. He lives in a small village of Kareli District with his family: wife – Tsiala and two adult sons (31 and 20 years old). All family members are involved in the family agricultural business, which is the only source of income for the family. They have a pig farm with 9 pigs. Giorgi sells on average 50 piglets per year. Also, the family has 2 milk cows. Tsiala produces cheese and sells it in the village. Along with the above mentioned, the family has 2 hectare land. They grow tomatoes, cabbage, cherries and peaches. Giorgi and Tsiala sell harvested products to local greengrocery product retailers. Total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris.

Giorgi requested credit for purchasing fertilizers. After fertilizing the land the family will get better quality and more harvest than the last year and their income from sales will increase. The increased income will allow the family to purchase needed household goods to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua produces charcoal for sale at Asebu near Cape Coast, which she has done for 2 years now. Ekua is a single parent and has 7 dependents.  She uses her income to feed her children and pay their school fees. Ekua will use her loan to purchase firewood to produce charcoal to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, Ekua will produce the charcoal in large quantities.

loans.use: to produce charcoal to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace operates a grocery, which she has done for 8 years now. The items in her grocery shop are different kinds of drinks, biscuits, toffee, powdered milk etc. Grace is married with 4 children. Grace uses her income to assist her husband to pay their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries to sell. With the new profit, Grace plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to sell

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort lives together with her husband and 5 children in Asebu near Cape Coast. Comfort sells charcoal, which she has done for 3 years now. She is married, and her husband is a mason. She uses her income to assist her husband to feed and clothe their children. Comfort will use her loan to purchase bags of charcoal to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, Comfort will produce the charcoal she sells herself.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Fusena

texts.en: Fusena sells waakye (rice and beans cooked together). She serves it with gari, macaroni, meat and fish stew. Fusena has been selling waakye for 10 years now. She is married. Her husband is a farmer. She uses her income to assist her husband to pay the utility bills. Fusena needs this loan to purchase bags of rice, beans and other ingredients for the preparation of her waakye for sale. With the new profit, Fusena will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, beans and other ingredients for the preparation of her waakye for sale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is into gari production. Gari is made out of cassava. She sells it at Breman near Elmina, which she has done for 3 years now. She is married to a farmer and has 3 children. She uses her income to assist her husband to pay their accommodation and utility bills. Mary will use her loan to purchase cassava to produce her gari to sell. With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cassava to produce her gari to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is into gari production.  Gari is made out of cassava. She sells it at Breman near Elmina, which she has done for 10 years now. She uses her income to assist her husband to pay their accommodation and utility bills. Mary will use her loan to purchase cassava to produce her gari to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cassava to produce her gari to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is the lady pounding fufu. She operates a chop bar, where a variety of African dishes are sold. This she has done for 4 years now. The food served is fufu, banku and rice balls. She is married to a driver and has 5 children. Mary uses her income to assist her husband to pay their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase food stuff and other ingredients to prepare food for sale. With the new profit, Mary plans to acquire a better place to serve her customers.

loans.use: to buy food stuff and other ingredients to prepare food for sale

loans.name: Agartha

texts.en:
Agartha is a single parent living with her two children in Asebu, near Cape Coast, Ghana. Agartha sells children's wear, ladies wear, cosmetics, towels, sponges, etc. She has been selling cosmetics for the past six years. As a single parent, she uses her income to feed and clothe her children and to pay their school fees. 

Agartha will use her loan to purchase more children's wear, ladies wear, cosmetics, towels and sponges for resale. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase children's wear, ladies wear, cosmetics, towels and sponges for resale.

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina has been a petty trader for the past three years, trading in ladies wear, underwear, and braziers. She lives in Ekroful, near Cape Coast, Ghana.  Augustina is married with four children. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their accomodation bills. 

Augustina will use her loan to purchase children's dresses, underwear, and ladies wear for resale. With the new profit from her expanded business, she wishes to build a shop which will enable her to sell the dresses.

loans.use: to purchase children's dresses, underwear, and ladies wear for resale.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua has produced and sold palm kernel oil in Asebu, near Cape Coast, Ghana, for the past fifteen years. She is married with five children. Her husband is a member of the fire service. Ekua uses her income to support her husband in feeding and clothing their children.

Ekua will use her loan to purchase palm fruit and palm kernels for the production and sale of her palm kernel oil. With the new profit, she will buy a machine to produce her palm kernel oil.

loans.use: to purchase palm fruit and palm kernels to produce and sell palm kernel oil.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en:
Ernestina has operated a grocery store in Asebu, near Cape Coast, Ghana, for the past five years. The items in her grocery store are different kinds of drinks, biscuits, toffees, powdered milk, etc. Ernestina is married to a farmer and has seven dependants. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their children's school fees. 

She will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries to sell. With the new profit, Ernestina plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children.
 
Teresita has pigpens and sells grown and matured pigs. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy animal feeds for the pigs like hog starter, hog grower and hog finisher.

Teresita has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Teresita hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy feeds for pigs like hog grower, hog starter and hog finisher.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is 48 years old and married with 3 children. With 2 children in school, Esmeralda works very hard to provide for them.

Esmeralda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Esmeralda has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, cream, sugar, eggs, etc.

In the future Esmeralda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Malta

texts.en:
Malta is 61 years old and married with 6 children. 

Malta has a fishing business in the Philippines. Malta requested a 25,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

Malta has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Malta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina is married and has 7 children. Magdalina is 53-years-old and lives in the Philippines.

Magdalina is a farmer and and manages coconut production to earn a living. She has been doing this for 14 years and every month she earns PHP 5,000 from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 1,400 to pay for labor cost in farm maintenance.

Magdalina been a member of GDMPC for a year. Magdalina hopes to finish the studies of her children.

loans.use: to pay for labor cost in farm maintenance.

loans.name: Bhawani

texts.en:
Bhawani is 42-years-old . She is Married and has 4 children aged 23, 22 18 and 13. In 1996, she established  her tailoring business.  Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 6 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy raw materials for her business.  

In the future, Bhawani plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order. Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines. These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal. With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 37 years old and married with 2 children.  With both children in school, Evelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Evelyn runs a sari-sari (convenience) store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell to her customers.

Evelyn has been in this business for 8 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, feeds, soft drinks, sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, Evelyn would like to save money to expand her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anania

texts.en:
As a married mother of 4 children, Anania works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Anania is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy tools and equipment for her sewing machine

Anania has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for her sewing machine

loans.name: Lynn

texts.en:
Lynn is 54 years old and married with 2 children.

Lynn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items like shampoo, snack foods and other groceries to sell.

Lynn has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Lynn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like shampoo, snack foods and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 50,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Mirasol has been in this business for 17 years. Mirasol earns more income from a general store and hog raising.

Mirasol has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita is 49 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Melita is borrowing 50,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her chickens.

Melita has been raising livestock for 10 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her chickens

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 54 years old and married with three children.

Norma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 26,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items like soft drinks, canned goods, detergent and other groceries to sell.

Norma has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Norma aspires to save enough money to buy a truck for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soft drinks, canned goods, detergent and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Roselyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from hog raising. Roselyn is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Roselyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 56 years old and married with four children.

Susana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Susana has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Susana aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto is a 47-year-old married man with 6 children aged between 2 and 24 years. He owns a vulcanizing shop and is involved in seaweed farming. Ernesto hired workers to do seaweed farming for him so he could focus on his vulcanizing shop. He works hard to provide for his family's basic needs and sustain his children's education.

Ernesto is requesting a loan to purchase tools and pay for the labor of seaweed farmers. He hopes for his ventures to succeed and for his family to have a more stable living.

loans.use: to purchase tools and pay for labor of seaweed farmers

loans.name: Aliena

texts.en:
Aliena is 58 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living through hog raising in the Philippines. Aliena is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Aliena has been hog raising  for 20 years and also earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is a married woman with 4 children. Her husband works as a farmer. Lucia is also a farmer and works with her husband on their land. She helps grow rice crops for selling. She also raises pigs and goats to help augment their income. Lucia requested a loan to purchase rice seeds and fertilizers. She hopes to have a better income so she could pay for her children's school expenses.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean works hard to support her family. She is married and has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines.

Mary Jean requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more dried fish to sell.

She has been in this business for 12 years now.

In the future, Mary Jean would like to save enough money so she could send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Mary Ann works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from catering services.  Mary Ann is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.

Mary Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her business

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie is 45 years old and has 4 children. She is married and has 3 children who are in school.

Lenie is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional pigs, feeds and vitamins for her business.

Lenie has been raising pigs for 4 years now and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Lenie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional pigs, feeds, and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en: Marcela is a 54-year-old married woman living in the town of Bien Unido, Bohol with her family. She has been involved in seaweed farming for more than 10 years. Marcela earns 10,000 PHP per month doing this type of farming. She also hires laborers to help her with planting seaweeds. Marcela works hard to provide for her family and pay her obligations. She plans to use this loan to buy straw, pay for labor, and repair her boat. This will help Marcela's business profitability.

loans.use: to buy straw, pay for labor, and repair her boat

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Cecelia works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling gasoline and farming sugarcane. Cecelia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more items like blouses, pants and other clothing to sell to her customers.

Cecelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like blouses, pants and other clothing.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of 7 children, Agustina works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Agustina is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more rice to sell to her customers.

Agustina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell to customers.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 50 years old and married with 5 children.

Evelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more inventory to sell in her general store.

Evelyn has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

Evelyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Hassel

texts.en:
Hassel is 54 years old and married with 4 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Hassel runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more inventory to sell.

Hassel has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, sugar, and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future, Hassel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory to sell.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina is a 44-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She is a farmer and has been growing and selling rice for more than 10 years. Marina is able to support her husband in providing for their basic needs through her income. She has applied for a loan to purchase fertilizers and pay for equipment rental. This will help Marina improve her yield and pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for equipment rental

loans.name: Nena Lisa

texts.en:
Nena Lisa is 32 years old and married with 1 kid.

Nena Lisa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, canned goods, groceries etc. to sell in her store.

Nena Lisa has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Nena Lisa aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, canned goods, groceries etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Arjean

texts.en:
Arjean is 46 years old and married with 10 children.

Arjean works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional inventory for her business.

Arjean has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

Arjean aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for her business

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a sari-sari (variety) store owner from Trinidad, Bohol. She is a married woman with four school-aged children. Jessica's husband is a fisherman.

Jessica sells various items in her store such as biscuits, instant noodles, coffee, shampoo and soap. She also sells her husband's catch at the market. Jessica does her best to support her family. She plans to use her loan to purchase fishing nets and more merchandise to sell such as toiletries and canned goods. This loan will help increase her sales and profitability.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and more merchandise to sell such as toiletries and canned goods

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 33 years old and lives in Caputol, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has three children.

Rosemarie has a general store that sells a variety of products such as soft drinks, noodles, etc. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for house renovation.

Rosemarie has been a member of PMPC for one years.  In the future, she hopes to own a house and lot someday.

loans.use: to renovate her house.

loans.name: Bebegene

texts.en: Bebegene is a married woman with one child. She is involved in fishing. Her husband is a fisherman and she helps him manage their business. Her husband operates their fishing boat to catch fish and she sells his catch at the market. Bebegene is planning to raise pigs to help augment their income.
