That is how she set up her business, which is now her grocery store, where she is helped out by her husband and youngest daughter.  She also depends on other sources of income, as her husband and some of her children give her money for her household expenses.  She sells her products in her own community, as she is happy where she is and she has a good clientele who visit her daily.  She is asking for this loan to buy staple grains, soft drinks, eggs, soap, bread, juice, and milk, all of which are needed for her business and which she hopes will help her, as she will be able to stock her business with the products that earn her the most money.  Her plans for the future are to have a big business that is well stocked with all the products to satisfy every one of her customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, soft drinks, eggs, soap, bread, juice, and milk

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma works hard to support 4 children. She is married and buys and sells livestock to earn a living, in the Philippines.

Wilma requested a PHP 4100 loan through NWTF to purchase of solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Wilma is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase of solar lamp.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman who has four children.  She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She sells coconuts at the market and Mwanasha has been in business for two years. Her primary customers are her local residents. Her major challenge is seasonality, and food is her greatest monthly expense.

With the Ksh 15000 loan, she will be able to purchase more coconuts for sell.

loans.use: to purchase more coconuts for sell.

loans.name: Mohamad Fayez

texts.en:
Mohamad Fayez is a 48 year-old widowed father of four children.  He is a hard working man who sacrifices his life for his children's happiness and living.

Mohamad Fayez has been a furniture maker since 1993.  His special talent is painting furniture and he is well known in the region.

Mohamad Fayez  is applying for a loan from KIVA partner Al Majmoua, to buy necessary business products such as paints and furniture coloring materials.

This is Mohamad Fayez's second experience with Al Majmoua, his previous loan helped him improve his business, and he is very optimistic about this loan.

loans.use: to buy necessary business products such as paints and furniture coloring materials.

loans.name: Racar Bajo  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Racar Bajo está formado por 5 socias y 3 socios quienes viven por la comunidad de Racar en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, se caracteriza por tener una gran riqueza natural y arquitectónica, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultura de la Humanidad, su gente es de un corazón cálido, amable, gentil y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. 
Nuestras socias y socios en su mayor parte se dedican a laborar en el trabajo que sus padres les han enseñado siguiendo la tradición de elaboración de ladrillos, cría de animales y a la agricultura.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señorita. Mayra, tiene 20 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres, su padre trabaja en el extranjero y su mamá tiene una fábrica de ladrillos.
 
La Señorita. Mayra trabaja en un taller de costura de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, esta actividad la realiza hace un año.  Los fines de semana estudia en una academia de belleza.

Es socia del banco comunal hace un año y medio, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales para su estudio como maquinas para cortar el cabello, tijeras, tintes y otros productos.
 
Su meta es culminar sus estudios y llegar a ser profesional.
texts.en:
The Racar Bajo Communal Bank is comprised of five female and three male members who live in the community of Racar, in the city of Cuenca.  This city, known for its cold climate, abundant natural resources, and architecture, was named a UNESCO World Heritage Site in December of 1999.  The inhabitants are warm-hearted, friendly, and courteous people who maintain the culture and traditions of their towns.  Most of the members work in the trades taught to them by their parents, and carry on the traditions of making bricks, animal husbandry, and agriculture.

One of the members of this group is Mayra.  She is 20 years old, unmarried, and lives with her parents.  Her father works outside of the country and her mother has a brick factory.  Mayra works in a sewing workshop from Monday to Friday from 8:00 in the morning until 6:00 in the evening.  She has held this job for one year.  On the weekends, she studies at a beauty academy.  

She has been a member of the communal bank for one and a half years.  She plans to invest the new loan in the purchase of items for her studies such as hair cutting implements, scissors, dyes, and other products.  Her goal is to complete her studies and become a professional hair stylist.

loans.use: to purchase hair cutting implements, scissors, dyes, and other items for her studies.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es una mujer con 62 años de edad, casada, con 4 hijos, vive con su familia, en una el distrito de Cayalti provincia de Chiclayo, y cuenta con los servicios básicos de agua, desagüe y luz.
  Julia cuenta con un statio wagon  que se dedica al servicio de transporte público y cubre la ruta de los caseríos Cayalti- Zaña y viceversa, desde hace más de 8 años.
El monto solicitado del préstamo es de 4,500 nuevos soles lo solicita el  préstamo para el mantenimiento y compra de SOAT de su vehiculo y  de esta manera obtener ingresos y  poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Julia, 62, is married and has four children.  She lives with her family in Cayalti District, Chiclayo Province.  She has basic utilities: water, sewage and electricity.

Julia has a station wagon that she uses to provide transportation services on the Cayalti-Zaña route; she’s been in business more than 8 years.

She’s asking for a 4500 new sol loan to service the vehicle and purchase SOAT (required accident insurance policy) for her vehicle in order to obtain more income and be able to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to service his vehicle and buy insurance.

loans.name: Yawah

texts.en: Yawah is 43 years old and lives in Airport Community. She is married and has six children between the ages of 6 and 29. Three of them are presently in school and live at home, while the oldest one is working. Since 2004, she has been selling peppers, beans, peanuts, sugar, and flour. She makes more profit and has more customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more peppers, beans, peanuts, sugar, and flour for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more peppers, beans, peanuts, sugar, and flour for her business

loans.name: Akimu

texts.en:
Akimu is a 27 year old married man with two children who are not yet enrolled in school.  He lives in his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  

He sells coconuts and has been in this business for the last three years.  Akimu describes market competition as his major challenge.  He aspires to hire employees in future.

He plans to use the loan of Ksh 50000 to purchase more coconuts for resell.  He joined Yehu because of their good products.

loans.use: to purchase more coconuts for resell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 37 year-old married man and father of one child. 

Ali has been a butcher since 1999; his business is going on fine.  His good reputation and quality of products he serves helps him development business.

Ali has been an Al Majmoua borrower for six cycles.  All his previous loans helped him improve his business and his family's social and financial situations.

Ali is applying for a loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, to increase his meat capital with special prices since he will pay in cash. These special prices help him sell his products.  Ali will also increase his herbs stock since he makes special blends and sauces.

He hopes, that in the future he can decorate his butchery in a better way.

loans.use: to increase his meat at better prices.

loans.name: Nicolàs

texts.es:
Nicolás es un hombre de 47  años de edad, Casado, con 2  hijos dependientes, Vive en casa propia, contando con los servicios de  luz y agua, el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 200  familias; actualmente vive en el caserío Valle Nuevo distrito de Mochumì, ubicado a 15 minutos de esta.
La actividad que desarrolla Nicolás es la comercialización de animales lo cual tiene bastante experiencia en este tipo de negocio; así, mismo comercializa carne de cerdo al kilaje. , el negocio esta situado en su domicilio, aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro.   , y 
El monto solicitado del crédito es de 4,500 nuevos soles lo que será para invertir en compra animales como porcinos, caprinos, ovinos, aves de corral, etc., y de está manera poder aumentar su capital de trabajo y poder tener mejores ingresos para su hogar, así mismo cuenta con clientes ya establecidos.
texts.en:
Nicolás is a 47-year-old gentleman who is married and has two dependent children. He lives in his own home which receives electricity and running water. Nicolás currently lives in the village of Valle Nuevo, which is 15 minutes away from the District of Mochumi. This place is a small community that has approximately 200 families.

Nicolás has a business in which he sells animals. He has plenty of experience in this type of work. Nicolas also sells pork based on the weight. His business is located at his home and he learned this trade from his parents. Nicolás is known for being a perfectionist at his work. The loan amount of 4,500 PEN that he is requesting will be invested in the purchase of pigs, goats, sheep, poultry, and other livestock. This will enable him to increase his operating capital so that he can earn more household income. Nicolás already has established customers.

loans.use: to buy small animals.

loans.name: Catalina  Del Carmen

texts.es:
Catalina de 38 años de edad es originaria de Chinandega actualmente vive en Granada, casada, madre de tres hijos los cuales están a su cargo, de oficio comerciante en el negocio de pulpería, realizo estudio  hasta la primaria. Inicio su actividad desde hace 2 años después de haber tenido una mala experiencia en su primer matrimonio queda como madre soltera decide viajar a Costa Rica en busca de una mejor vida para ella y para sus hijos trabajo por un tiempo como empleada de una familia, luego dejo el trabajo comenzó a vender buñuelos y fritanga de ese trabajo fue ahorrando dinero que utilizo para regresar a Nicaragua a poner su propio negocio dejando en Costa Rica a su actual esposo que conoció porque trabajaba con ella  luego ella se regreso a Nicaragua. Catalina poco tiempo después de haber puesto su negocio vio la necesidad de inyectarle más en productos debido a la alta demanda de la clientela. Ella realizo préstamos en instituciones financieras para conseguir capital de trabajo. Actualmente  lleva dos años en el negocio de pulpería donde recibe el apoyo de su esposo y de sus hijos.
Cuenta con otros ingresos ya que el esposo viaja a Costa Rica en temporadas buenas de trabajo para mandarle remesas que invierte en la pulpería. Catalina realiza el préstamo para compra de granos básicos tales como pan, galletas, leche, aceite, azúcar y compra de bebidas variadas el cual estima le ayudara ya que podrá satisfacer a la clientela con los productos de mayor demanda y ampliara su negocio.
texts.en:
Catalina, 38, is from Chinandega but currently lives in Granada.  She’s married and the mother of three children who are still in her care.  She’s a merchant; she has a grocery store.  She completed elementary school.

She started her business two years ago after having a bad experience with he first marriage.  She was left a single mother so she decided to go to Costa Rica in search of a better life for her and her children. She worked for a time with a family as a domestic employee.  She left that job and started selling ‘buñuelos’ [fried flour tortilla sprinkled with sugar and cinnamon] and fried fast food and saved some of what she earned from that business to return to Nicaragua and open her own business.  She left her current husband in Costa Rica because she met him there because they worked together.  She returned to Nicaragua.

Shortly after opening her business, Catalina saw the need of injecting more products into it due to high customer demand.  She took out loans in financial institutions in order to get working capital.  She’s now been in the grocery store business for two years and she gets support from her husband and her children.

She also gets additional income because her husband travels to Costa Rica during good work seasons and sends her stipends that she invests in the grocery store.

Catalina is taking out the loan to buy basic staple items like bread, cookies, milk, oil, sugar and to buy assorted soft-drinks that she feels will help her satisfy customer demand with products in highest demand and will expand the business.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en: Josefa is 53 years old and married with two children. She lives in Capucao, Ozamiz City. Josefa used her last loan to purchase crop fertilizer such as manure. Her business is successful, and she's taking a new loan to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. In the future, she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Erkhembaatar

texts.en:
Erkhembaatar, 26, is a taxi driver. He lives with his mother, sisters and brothers in one small, old house which is located in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

He has been running his business since last year and before that he used to work for a private company with a very low salary.  Now he wants to make some repairs and renovations to his taxi to improve his business.  This will include body color changes and a new engine. 

He believes that his taxi service will get better and his business earnings will increase notably.  The loan he is taking will be dedicated to repair his old and bad taxi car which was made in Korea in 1993.

loans.use: to repair his old taxi car.

loans.name: Souad

texts.en:
Souad is a 49 year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two children. One of them is working and the other attends school. 

She has owned a bakery since 2009 and her husband has sold car parts for the past twelve years.  Today, she needs to borrow a loan from kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase products for her bakery such as sugar, flour.  

She notes that this will boost her productivity and her profits.  In the future, she plans to enlarge her bakery and diversify her products.

loans.use: to purchase products for her bakery such as sugar, flour.

loans.name: Nasib

texts.en:
Nasib is a 51myear-old Lebanese married man.  He lives with his wife and three working children. He’s the one responsible for covering his family expenses and responding to their needs. 

Nasib has owned a car battery shop where he works as a trader.  He has been involved in this business for the past eighteen years. 

Today, he’s looking for a loan from kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the needed quantity of batteries for his shop.  He notes that this kiva loan will increase his sales. In the future, he plans to open other branches in the surrounding area.

loans.use: to purchase the needed quantity of batteries for his shop.

loans.name: Ganbold

texts.en: Mr. Ganbold, 29, sells sliver articles in the market. He lives with his wife in a rental apartment which is in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running his business since 2010. Previously, his sister used to run this business.  Mr. Ganbold received his business from her.  In few days, students will celebrate their school graduations. During that time, his sales volume increases notably and thus, the business earnings. It is a good opportunity to expand his business sales. Now he needs to purchase more silver articles from his suppliers. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to increase his sales commodities.

loans.use: To increase his sales stock.

loans.name: Glenda Maricela

texts.es:
Glenda es originaria de Granada, de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de bebidas variadas anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de buñuelos, de 42 años de edad, realizo estudios hasta la primaria, madre de 5 hijos de los cuales dos están a su cargo y los otros son mayores de edad tienen vida independiente. Ella inicio su actividad   desde muy joven vendiendo en la calle con su mama, luego se caso decidió independizarse comenzó a trabajar por si sola aunque siempre recibe el apoyo de su mama con la venta de bebida, cuenta con otros ingreso pues el esposo se desempeña como guarda de seguridad y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, sus productos los comercializa en el parque central de Granada donde se siente satisfecha ya que donde esta ubicada cuenta con mucha demanda debido a que llegan extranjeros nacionales y internacionales que visitan el lugar a comprar de sus bebidas.
Solicita el préstamo para comprar bebidas tales como gaseosa, jugos, agua purificada para aprovechar la temporada del verano, ella estima que este crédito le ayudara ya que incrementara su inventario con productos que son de mayor  demanda en los clientes que pasan sedientos a buscar algo que tomar por el parque central de Granada, sus planes futuros es crecer en el negocio para obtener mas ganancias con las que podrá hacerle mejora a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Glenda is from Granada and a merchant by profession.  She sells assorted beverages.  She used to sell ‘buñuelos’ [fried manioc balls stuffed with cheese and drenched in honey].  She’s 42 years old and only went to elementary school.  She’s the mother of five children two of which are still in her care; the others are adults and live on their own.

She started her activity with her mother while still very young.  When she got married she decided to go off on her own and to start to work for herself although she always has her mother’s support.  She sells beverages and also has additional income from her husband who works as a security guard and helps her with household expenses.  She sells her products in Granada’s central park where she feels satisfied because she’s located at a spot with high demand because national and international visitors that come to the place buy beverages from her.

She’s asking for the loan to buy beverages like soft-drinks, juices  and purified water to take advantage of the summer season.  She thinks that the loan will help her because she’ll increase her stock of products that have the highest demand by customers who pass by parched looking for something to drink along Granada’s central park.  Her future plan is to expand the business to earn higher profits to use to make some home improvements with.

loans.use: to buy beverages like soft-drinks, juices and purified water.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
This is Lorna, 48, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Ibarra, her business partner, and a father to her child. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Lorna operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 23,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Lorna hopes to be able to expand in the coming years, just as she dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. She is 44 years old, married, and has five children aged between 2 and 27 years. Her husband is also a farmer.

Jocelyn works with her husband in cultivating their land and growing rice crops. They also hire some laborers to help prepare their land for planting. Jocelyn does her best to keep their farm productive. 

She requested a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers and pay for labor. Jocelyn hopes to increase the amount of land that they are cultivating and include more crops in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Samir

texts.en:
Samir is a 44-year-old married man and father of three children.

In 1999 Samir started working in agriculture to provide his family with a fine living.  He owns a tractor which helps him make his work easier.  Samir plants tobacco and it's highly requested in his region, because it's of a very good quality.  He also transports water to neighbors and neighboring farmers, because his area suffers from a lack of irrigating water.

Samir is well known in the area for his good reputation.

Samir is applying for a loan from KIva partner Al Majmoua to buy a new truck to transport the seeds necessary for his business and to store them until he plants them.

He might also start selling seeds to farmers in his area to expand his business range.

loans.use: to buy a new truck to transport the seeds necessary for his business.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 28-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married with two children between the ages of 4 and 1 years old. One of them goes to school. 

Robert runs a mixed goods store business. He has been in the business for 10 years. He has no employees. Robert has no other source of income in addition to this business. His major challenge is a low rate of income only. In five years' time, Robert hopes for a better business by having many products to sell wholesale as well.

Robert heard about Finance Sudan through the promotion done in the market by the loan officers. He is taking out a loan of 3,000 SDG to purchase more items like radios, dry cells, clothing and many others. Robert says that he really appreciates Finance South Sudan for bringing him these opportunities. He is happy because the help can make his dreams come true.

loans.use: to purchase more items like radios, dry cells, clothing and many others.

loans.name: Dismas

texts.en: Dismas is 49 years old, married to Susan, and blessed with six children between the ages of 6 and 18 years old. He owns a retail shop. He started the business seven years ago and earns a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). He has requested a loan of 100,000 KES to purchase crates of sodas, baking flour, maize flour and cooking fat to stock in his shop. The anticipated profit will help him repay his loan as well as provide for his family's basic needs. He hopes to see his family develop financially. This is his third loan.

loans.use: to purchase crates of sodas, baking flour, maize flour and cooking fat to stock in his shop.

loans.name: Mayela Melissa

texts.es: La señora Mayela, es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo el cual trabaja por cuenta propia, ellos tienen hijos , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , Mayela desde hace varios años labora en una empresa privada , pero su sueldo no le ajusta para poder comprar de una sola vez materiales de construcción y poder realizar mejoras a su hogar .Lo cual solicita el apoyo de Kiva para que le brinden facilidad  y realizar sus sueños de ver construida su vivienda , ya que sus pequeños van creciendo cada día y necesitan de privacidad .El crédito lo quiere para comprar materiales de construcción .
texts.en: Mayela lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe with her husband who is self-employed, they have children and her plans for her family are to improve their living conditions. For several years now, Mayela has been working in a private company, but her salary doesn't stretch far enough to be able to buy construction materials in one go to make improvements to her home. This is why she has asked for Kiva's support to make it easier and achieve her dreams of seeing her home completed, as her children are growing up quickly and need privacy. The loan she requests is to buy construction materials.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Jenny Del Socorro

texts.es: Jenny de 47 años de edad es originaria de Granada, soltera, madre de 4 hijos los cuales están a su cargo, de oficio comerciante en el negocio de pulpería, realizo estudios hasta la primaria. Inicio su negocio desde muy joven con su mama vendía frutas luego se caso decidió independizarse y siguió con la venta de frutas después con deseo de superación decidió con el apoyo de su esposo poner una pulpería a la edad de 34 años  en la casa que le alquilaban a una tía del esposo, no cuentan con otros ingresos pues solo se apoyan del negocio de pulpería y la venta de frutas. Realiza el préstamo para compra de coca cola, agua purificada asi como granos básicos tales como arroz, pan, azúcar, jabón, aceite, etc. Este le ayudara ya que tendrá los productos que le demanda la clientela el cual le generara mas ganancias, sus planes futuros es mantener su negocio  fijo y surtido para hacerlo rentable.
texts.en:
Jenny, 47, is from Granada.  She’s single and the mother of four children who are in her care.  She’s a grocer.  She completed elementary school.  

She started her business while still very young with her mother who sold fruit.  When she got married she decided to become independent and continued selling fruit but later on wanting to improve herself and with help from her husband she decided to open a grocery store at the age of 34 in the house they rented from her husband’s aunt.  They have no other source of income besides the grocery store and the fruit sales.

She’s taking out the loan to buy Coca-Cola, purified water as well as basic staples like rice, bread, sugar, soap, oil, etc.  It will help her because she’ll have the products that have the highest customer demand in stock which will generate more profits.  Her plan for the future is to stay in business and to keep it well-stocked to make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Veronica Del Carmen

texts.es: Veronica es originaria de Granada, de oficio comerciante en el negocio de pulpería, de 33 años de edad, casada, madre de 2 hijos. Ella inicio su  negocio desde hace 2 años vendiendo solo bebida y frijoles cocidos luego decidió invertir mas en el negocio hizo prestamos en financieras para compra de de granos básicos asi fue creciendo en el negocio hasta poner a la edad de 31 años  lo que es actualmente su pulpería recibe el apoyo de su esposo quien cuenta con un negocio aparte. Realiza el préstamo para invertir en la compra de granos básicos tales como arroz, aceite, azúcar, pan, leche, frijoles todo lo básico para satisfacer las necesidades de la clientela, sus planes futuros es mantener su negocio bien surtido con los productos que tenga mas demanda en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Verónica is from Granada.  She’s a grocer by profession.  She’s 33 years old, married and the mother of two children.

She started her business two years ago selling just beverages and cooked beans.  Later on she decided to invest more in the business and took out loans in financial institutions to buy basic staples.  This is how the business started to grow until at the age of 31 she managed to set up what’s now her grocery store.  She also gets support from her husband who has his own separate business.

She’s taking out the loan to buy basic staples like rice, oil, sugar, bread, milk and beans; all the basics needed to satisfy customer demand.  Her plan for the future is to keep the store well-stocked with products most in demand by her community.

loans.use: to buy staple items to stock her store.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha es una mujer de 35 años de edad, soltera y con dos hijos como carga familiar, vive en la parte rural del Caserío Nueva Esperanza distrito de Tambogrande.
La actividad que desarrolla la Bertha es la venta de productos de belleza, los cuales recorre en los  caseríos más cercanos donde tiene clientela conocida, además se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral en una parte de su domicilio.
El monto solicitado del crédito será de 1,000 nuevos soles lo cual lo invertirá en su negocio y de esta manera poder seguir atendiendo mas pedidos a su clientela, además de realizar algunas mejoras en su corral de sus animales compra de calamina para techo, y  de esta manera obtener ingresos y  poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Bertha is 35 years old, single and has two children as her dependents. She lives in a rural part of Caserío Nueva Esperanza, a district of Tambogrande. Bertha works selling beauty products which she takes around the neighbouring villages, where she has a loyal client base. She also keeps poultry at home. She will use the amount of 1,000 nuevos soles she has asked to borrow to invest in her business so she can continue to offer more items to her customers. She will also carry out some improvements on her chicken runs, like buying calamine for the roof, so she can give the birds a better quality of life and earn more income.

loans.use: To invest in more products for her cosmetics business and carry out repairs on her chicken runs.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is married with four children. Natividad is forty years old and lives in Osukan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Natividad sells rice to earn a living and had this business for four years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to have additional capital.

Natividad has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, Natividad hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to have additional capital and to buy sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Restituto

texts.en:
This is Restituto, twenty-eight, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. His wife is Mechelle, the mother of his two children. Together with his wife, Restituto manages their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Restituto operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. He earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Restituto hopes to be able to expand soon. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in his business.

loans.name: Luzmenda

texts.en:
This is Luzmenda, 55, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Orlando, her business partner. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.

Luzmenda is a dried fish vendor. She buys different kinds of dried fish from her suppliers and then sells them in the market. Her store is located in a temporary fish market.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php1000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 40,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more dried fish needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Luzmenda hopes to grow her customers and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of dried fish needed in her business.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is 41 years old. He lives in Kvareli District, East Georgia with his family: his wife, Tebro, and three children. Tebro works as a bread-baker in a local bakery. Solomon works as a worker in the village. 

Along with their main jobs, the family has a small-scale agricultural business. They cultivate a family-owned plot of land and sow potato and maize. Solomon sells the harvested products on the local market. The total average monthly income of the family is 400 Laris. Although Solomon and Tebro work hard, they still live under the poverty level and receive social assistance. 

Solomon requested credit for purchasing fuel for a tractor to till the land. Also, he will purchase fertilizers and sow potatoes. Tebro and Solomon will work hard to receive a good harvest in the summer. Also, he will use part of the credit to build stairs for their house. In summer, Solomon will sell the harvest and get profits, which will be used for the family’s well-being.

loans.use: to purchase fuel for the tractor for tilling the land and also fertilizers.

loans.name: My Home Group

texts.en:
Mary is 37 years old. She is divorced and has three children. She has been selling ladies bags, shoes, and clothes through door-to-door sales for eight years to support her family. 

With the loan, Mary wants to buy more stock of clothes, shoes, and bags to increase her inventory and sales for a good income. She believes this loan will help her save more money to rent a shop to house her goods. 

She is a member of the group called “My Home Trust Group". Members of the group agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of clothes, shoes, and bags.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
César es un hombre de 49 años de edad de estado civil casado, con 2 hijos a su cargo, vive en el distrito de la matanza y cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales, la zona cuenta con más de 10 mil habitantes y el cliente habita en casa propia y en pueblo joven.
César se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas, tales como el limón, tamarindo, maracuyà, naranjas, mangos, entre otros, todo este desde hace 5 años, y en la zona de la matanza.
El monto del  préstamo solicitado es de 1508 nuevos soles y lo necesita para invertirlo en su negocio, específicamente para la adquisición de mercadería, tales como limón, mango, naranjas, ya que es la época de este tipo de negocio.
De esa forma tendrá mejores ingresos y en consecuencia una mejor condición de vida en la zona, y el mercado es rentable para invertir en este negocio, pues la población en su mayoría, específicamente los varones son los que se dedican a la agricultura, y al sembrio de frutas y menestras, todo esto trae consigo que los riesgos para el cliente sean menores, y son la influencia primordial para que invierta y por lo tanto obtenga mas ganancias para el sustento de su familia.


.
texts.en:
César is a 49 year old married man with two children in his care.  He lives in La Matanza District and has good personal and work references.  The zone has more than 10,000 inhabitants and he lives in his own house in a new town.

César is a fruit merchant.  He sells lemons, tamarinds, passion fruit, oranges and mangoes, among others.  He’s been doing this for five years in La Matanza.

The amount of the requested loan is 1508 new soles that he needs to invest in his business, specifically to acquire merchandise like lemons, mangoes and oranges that are in season now.  In this way he will have better income and as a consequence better living conditions in the zone.  

The market is profitable to invest in this business because the population in general, especially the men, are farmers growing fruit and vegetables which means risks for customers are few and the main influence to invest thus obtaining more profits for his family’s support.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio Cesar, de oficio artesano, casado,  actualmente es trabajador asalariado en una empresa publica, desde hace 10 años, el cual comenta que le ha servido de gran ayuda porque por medio de su salario ha podido solucionar de alguna manera sus obligaciones,  el esta necesitando realizar unas mejoras en su vivienda por eso se presenta a nuestras oficinas para realizar ese sueño de darles una mejor calidad de vida a su hogar, y darle la satisfacción de seguir mejorando.
  
Se acerca a nuestras oficinas a solicitar un financiamiento Para la compra de  arena, arenilla, cemento, piedra, hierro, piedrín, azulejos y poder  comenzar el proyecto construcción.
texts.en:
Julio César is a craftsman by profession. He’s married and is currently working as a salaried employee in a public agency; he’s been employed for ten years.  He comments that it’s been of great use to him because by means of his salary he’s been able somehow to cover his debts. 

He needs to do some home improvements though and this is why he’s come by our offices to make this dream of improving his home’s quality of life a reality and to have the satisfaction of continuing to improve.

He came by our offices to request a loan to buy sand, cement, stone, rebar, gravel and tile to start the building project.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, gravel, stone, rebar and tile.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
This is Cecilia, forty-four, a resident of Manila, Philippines. Her husband is Ronilo, a driver. Together with her husband and children, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Cecilia operates a buy-and-sell business. What she basically does is buy products from wholesalers sell them per item with a profit. Her products are stuffed toys, wall displays and other similar products. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many products that she offers. Her regular customers are neighbor and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10, 000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Cecilia dreams of having a shop and helping her husband through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To get an additional stock of supplies and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Asmahan

texts.en:
Asmahan is a fifty-four-year-old single woman, who is very well known in her region because of her experience and excellent business management.

Asmahan has been selling wood furniture and souvenirs since 1991. She also designs and sells special hand-made crafts for occasions such as birth, engagements, and weddings. She also works as a tailor, so her shop is very broad, and she splits it into departments; each part is for a certain business but at the same time they are in one place but blended in a beautiful smart way.

Asmahan has been an Al Majmoua borrower for seven cycles, her business has improved a lot with the help of Al Majmoua loans which she has invested each time in adding a certain product to her shop.

Asmahan is a hard working woman. She is applying for a loan from KIva partner Al Majmoua, in order to  buy a new collection of wooden souvenirs. These new items will attract customers' attention, and will please them. She hopes to open a wider shop in the future with a big showroom for her handmade souvenirs.

loans.use: To buy a new collection of wooden souvenirs to increase her stock.

loans.name: Elie

texts.en:
Elie is a fifty-nine-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and two children, one of whom is working. Elie is trying his best to be supportive and helpful to his family, especially as he is their main source of income. He has many years of experience in the agriculture field and started his own business as a farmer in 2005. He takes a good care of his land and he’s sure that it will give him good returns and provide excellent and natural fruits and vegetables. 

Today, he’s in need of a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the needed quantity of seeds and pesticides for his business. He notes that this will develop his business and boost his productivity.  In the future, he plans to buy new land and expand his cultivation.

loans.use: to purchase the needed quantity of seeds and pesticides for his business.

loans.name: Natela

texts.en:
Natela is 59 years old. She lives in a small village of the Kakheti Region with her 20-year-old son, Tariel. Natela and Tariel run a small agricultural business. They have a milk cow and five sheep. Natela produces cheese and sells on average 15 kg. of this product on the local open market. Also, the family owns a 0.16 hectare vineyard. Tariel sells grapes to local wine producer companies. 

As the income from the family farming activities isn’t enough for Natela and Tariel, they work as agricultural workers on neighborhood farms. Although the family members work hard, they still live under the poverty line and receive relevant social assistance from the government. Their average monthly income, including the assistance, is 350 Laris. 

Natela requested credit for purchasing calves. She will grow them for six months and sell them in the fall as grown calves for a higher price. After selling the calves, Natela will purchase more calves to expand the family business. As a result of the new business initiative, the income of the family will increase and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Felegona

texts.en:
Felegona is a 70-year-old widowed lady from Kisumu City and the mother of four children. Two are married, while the other two, aged 29 and 27, are under her care.

Felegona operates a grocery store, a business she has been doing for the last 46 years. She makes a monthly income of KES 15,000. She is taking her second KADET LTD loan, which she will use to buy bananas, onions, oranges, and pineapples. She will use her profits to add more stock to the business.

Her dream is to have a big business.

loans.use: to buy bananas, onions, oranges, and pineapples.

loans.name: Karla Adelina

texts.es:
Karla es una joven de 21 años de edad originaria de Granada, de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de cajetas(dulces tipicos) desde hace 3 años, realizo estudios hasta la primaria, madre de un hijo el cual esta a su cargo. Inicio su actividad desde muy niña vendiendo golosina con la mama en la ciudad  a la edad de 10 años, luego con prestamos de otras personas invirtió en el negocio de cajetas, donde recibe el apoyo del esposo que es asalariado ya que trabaja en el negocio de alquiler de lanchas  y aporta con los gastos de la casa. Ella tiene como expectativa trabajar  para tener un negocio más rentable.
Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la venta de cajeta en la compra de leche y azúcar, todos los insumos necesarios para su elaboración, este le ayudara ya que podrá obtener mayor venta que le generara mas ganancia, como planes futuros desea construir su casita de bloque de piso cerámica para  mejorar su  nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Karla is a 21 year old saleswoman originally from Granada.  She works selling traditional sweets and has done so for 3 years.  She completed her studies through elementary school.  She is a mother of one son whom she takes of.  She began her sales very young, selling snacks with her mother in the city at age ten.  Then, with loans from other people, she invested in her traditional candies business. She has the support of her husband who works in a salaried position renting boats and who contributes to the expenses of the home.  She hopes to work to make her business more profitable.

She requests this loan in order to invest in the sales of traditional sweets by buying milk and sugar, all the ingredients necessary to make the candies.  This will help her obtain greater sales and will generate more earnings.  Her future plans are to build a cement block home with ceramic floors to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy milk and sugar.

loans.name: Luz Yolanda

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer  casada sin carga familiar, hijos disipados, conocida en el medio, actualmente radica en el caserío Nuevo México distrito de Cayalti, no cuenta con los servicios básicos, vive junto a su esposo, quien  le apoya en las labores del negocio. y en el soporte económico familiar.
 Luz se dedica a la venta de abarrotes al por menor, desde hace más de 15 años en su caserío.; el  monto del préstamo solicitado es de 2000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la  de  una mototaxi e invertirá en su negocio de abarrotes, y con esto logrará atender la demanda insatisfecha en el lugar,  y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luz is a married woman with no dependents in her care; her children are all off on their own.  She’s well known in her neighborhood.  She currently lives in the Nuevo México settlement in Cayalti District.  She does not have basic utilities.  She lives with her husband who helps her with the business chores and to support the family.

Luz sell groceries at retail; she’s been in business more than 15 years in her settlement.   The amount of the loan requested is 2000 new soles that she’ll use to buy a mototaxi and to invest in her grocery store to meet unmet demand and be able to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a mototaxi for her business.

loans.name: Elie

texts.en:
Elie is a forty-two-year-old Lebanese man. He’s married, living with his wife and three children who are all studying. Elie is the one responsible for his family, and for paying his children’s educational fees. He has owned an electrical generator since 2009. He delivers electricity to his town and the neighboring villages. 

Today, he’s requesting a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to perform the needed maintenance on his generator. In that way, he will be able to better serve his customers. In the future, he plans to take a new loan and buy a bigger generator.

loans.use: to perform the needed maintenance on his generator.

loans.name: Chanda

texts.en:
Chanda is 34 years old.  She is married and has 2 children, aged 11 and 5.  In 2002, she established her cow-raising business. Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 7 loans from Patan BPW, and she used her most recent loan to buy a young dairy cow.  

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal.  Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk, from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50. In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, burned as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.  

In the future, Chanda plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy a young dairy cow

loans.name: Rosibel

texts.es:
Rosibel, es originaria de Estelí, de 40 años de edad, soltera, madre de 3 hijos los cuales están a su cargo, ella realizo estudios hasta el segundo año de secundaria, de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general actividad que realiza desde hace  3 años con prestamos  otorgados por instituciones, anteriormente tenia una joyería pero decidió quitarla ya que no le generaba mucha ganancia. Hoy en día  en el negocio recibe el apoyo de sus hijas comercializando sus productos en los alrededores de su comunidad donde a atraído buena clientela que le ha generado buenas ganancias que las ahorra para volver  invertir en su negocio.
Solicita el préstamo para compra de arroz, azúcar, frijoles, mechas de lampazo, gaseosa, etc. Este crédito le ayudara ya que podrá comprar los productos que más demanda  sus clientes  generándole a su vez mejores ganancias, como planes futuros desea que sus hijos se preparen como profesionales para que puedan salir adelante y puedan ser independientes.
texts.en:
Rosibel is from Estelí.  She’s 40 years old, single and the mother of three children still in her care.  She studied up to second year of secondary school.  She’s a merchant by profession.  She sells general merchandise, an activity she’s been carrying out for three years with help from loans from institutions.  She used to have a jewelry store but decided to close it because it wasn’t very profitable.  At present, her daughters help her with the business selling products around the community which has attracted a good clientele that has generated good profits that she saves to reinvest in her store.

She is asking for the loan to buy rice, sugar, beans, mops, soft-drinks, etc.  The loan will help her buy the products that are in most demand by her customers at the same time generating  better profits.  Her future plan is that her children become professionals so that they can get ahead and be independent.

loans.use: to buy merchanidse to stock her store.

loans.name: Ghinwa

texts.en:
Ghinwa is a thirty-five-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her parents. She collaborates with her father to be able to satisfy their needs and demands. She opened her own grocery store in 2009 in her town and has gained a fair number of customers so far. 

Today she’s requesting a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase more groceries and food provisions for her shop in order to increase her sales thus her revenues. In the future, she plans to open her own mini-market.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries and food provisions for her shop.

loans.name: Battogtoh

texts.en:
Battogtoh is a forty-two-year-old man who lives with his wife and a son in Dornogovi province, Mongolia. His wife is unemployed and his son is in secondary school. Battogtoh is a craftsman who makes gold and silver jewelery. He offers variety of options in different styles to customers. He has been running the business since 1991. As he does not have a workshop, he runs the business activity inside his fence in summertime and at home in wintertime. 

Battogtoh is a talented craftsman who says that "I would like to expand the business activity by building my own workshop inside the fence". The total amount he is requesting is 2,700,000 MNT to buy construction materials to build the workshop.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a workshop.

loans.name: Munhzorig

texts.en:
Munhzorig is a thirty-year-old man who lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. His wife is unemployed. His daughters go to secondary school and kindergarden. He has been running a taxi service since 2011 based on his driving experience. In order to ensure a good education for his children, he has moved to the city with the family. But he needs some support to repair his car. 

Munhzorig is a hardworking man who says that "I would like to continue my business successfully by purchasing some necessary spare parts for the car. And I am planning to save for my children's future". The total amount he is requesting is 500,000 MNT to buy spare parts for his car.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his car.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a thirty-eight-year-old business woman, who lives in Juba. She is married and has two children aged fifteen and three. Both of them go to school. 

Florence runs a mixed-food business, and she has been in this business for twenty years. She has one employee. Florence heard about Finance Sudan through fellow clients and outreach and promotion done by the loan officers. She is taking a loan of SDG 3,000 to purchase more items like beans, eggs, cooking oil, tomato paste, sugar, rice and many others. In addition to this business, Florence has small houses for rent as another source of income

In 5 years time, Florence would like to hope for growth in the business size and also to build a better house for her family.  

Her major challenges include low incomes and government plans of shifting markets from one location to another.

Florence says that, she is happy for Finance Sudan’s support; not only the financial support but also the business training that has opened her mind to how to do business better.

loans.use: to purchase more items like beans, eggs, cooking oil, tomato paste, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Maritha

texts.en:
Maritha has been practicing farming in Ndunyu Njeru town, and with her income she has been able to provide for her family's needs. She used her previous loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting. Her harvest was very profitable, thereby enabling her to pay the entire loan amount well and in good time.

Maritha plans to use the requested loan of KES 25,000 to buy more maize and onion seeds as well as fertilizer for planting during the current season. This will be her fourth loan.

In the future, Maritha hopes to expand her farming and also to invest in dairy farming to increase her income and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Bilha

texts.en:
Bilha is 48 years old. She is from Nakuru and is married to Moses; they have four children who are young adults and others who are still in school.

Bilha is a caterer. She has applied for her first loan from Kadet Ltd to enable her buy foodstuffs like wheat flour and cooking fat to add to her stocks.

She hopes to start a food kiosk in the near future, rather than cooking at her house.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, cooking fat, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Abdhalla

texts.en:
Abdhalla Mribe is a 21-year-old boda boda (motorcycle) operator in Mariakani. He is married and the father of one. He has been in this business for the past three years, and he is doing great. 

This marks his third loan from KADET to finance his business. He plans to purchase another motorcycle. He will use the anticipated profits to repay his loan and educate his child. He hopes to become successful in his business.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla Minoo is a 43-year-old cereals shop owner in Mombasa. She is a married mother of three. She has been selling cereals for the past two years. Her business is doing great.

This marks her second loan term with KADET to finance her business. She plans to purchase maize, beans, and cow peas to sell to her customers. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and repay her loan. She hopes to see all of her children well-educated and comfortable.

loans.use: to purchase maize, beans, and cow peas

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is a married lady, 36 years old, and has 3 children aged 13, 10 and 7 years old.  She owns a cereals store at Kaptildil location and has been in operation for a period of 7 years, earning a monthly income of KSH 7,000. She is servicing a fourth term loan from KADET LTD for KSH 80,000 and intends to use this amount to purchase 30 bags of dried maize and 10 bags of dried beans for resale. The earned profits will be used to educate her school-going children and to repay the loan. She hopes to prosper in her business and support her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of dried maize and dried beans

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Guadalupe continues her 10-year-old business of selling meat at a local market. She specializes in selling cuts of pork and beef. She would like a loan in order to buy more meat in time for the high season, which begins after Labor Day in May. Guadalupe is 35 years old and has three children, one infant and two who are in school. She hopes to save enough money so that she can buy a car in December.

Guadalupe is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Comuzone I" in Cusco, which is located in the Andean mountains at 3,400 meters above sea level. The bank is in its 17th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to purchase pork and beef at wholesale prices

loans.name: Yenni

texts.es: Jenni, tiene la edad  de 31 años, está en unión libre,  vive con sus 3 hijos y su esposo que son su mayor prioridad. Ella con el crédito pretende comprar los materiales para la construcción de un invernadero y comprar los insumos necesarios como carbón y fertilizantes para empezar a sembrar los productos. Ella quiere obtener de este nuevo proyecto las ganancias necesarias para ayudar con las necesidades del hogar y aprovechar tiempos libres para asistir su invernadero. Ella quiere generar un poco mas de ingresos para el hogar y darle a su familia un mejor bienestar familiar cada día. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Yenni is 31 years old and in a common-law relationship. She lives with her husband and three children, who are her highest priority. Yenni intends to use her loan to buy materials for building a greenhouse. She will also buy necessary supplies, such as charcoal and fertilizers, so that she can begin planting her crops. Yenni wants to pursue this new project so that she can generate income to help with the household needs. She plans to take advantage of her free time in order to manage her greenhouse. Yenni would like to have a bit more money for her home so that she can do a better job each day of providing for her family's welfare.

This is the first loan she is receiving from FUDECOSUR. Yenni has not received any other loans from the state banks. FUDECOSUR is offering this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy materials for building a greenhouse and charcoal and fertilizers for growing crops.

loans.name: Hayk

texts.en:
Hayk is engaged in animal-breeding, poultry-keeping and also bee-keeping. On his farm he has cows, goats, chickens, ducks, geese and several bee colonies.  

He sells the milk, cheese and honey he produces directly from his house. He sells poultry and beef to restaurants. Hayk says that bee-keeping is rather laborious but at the same time it is a relatively profitable business.

Hayk is thirty-three years old and he lives in Ijevan with his parents. His parents help him in the agricultural business and thus they provide for their family and develop their farm as well. Simultaneously with his occupation on the farm, Hayk works as a policeman. 

Hayk is asking for a loan of 600,000 Armenian dram to buy a lot of fodder for his farm animals and also to repair his beehives.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of fodder for his farm animals and also to repair his beehives.

loans.name: Tserendulam

texts.en:
Tserendulam is a twenty-nine-year-old man who lives with his wife and mother in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. He operates a cafe. In 2002, his mother started to make food and sell it at the local markets and to businesses. In 2006, he started to operate a cafe business with the help of his mother, and they rented a space in the market. Then, in 2008, they bought their own space to operate the cafe, which is located in another market. Tserendulam's wife also helps them. They have six employees in the cafe. They live on the second floor of the cafe. Tserendulam, also makes Mongolian traditional hats and sells them. 

Tserendulam is a hardworking man who says that "We would like to expand the business and in the future we plan to open another cafe in the local central market". He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT, to purchase new chairs, tables and some equipment for his cafe.

loans.use: To purchase new chairs, tables and some equipment for his cafe.

loans.name: Revaz

texts.en:
Revaz is 41 years old. He lives in Akhmeta District with his mother, Leila. Agriculture is the only source of the income for the family. Revaz owns a tractor. He provides agricultural services to neighborhood farmers and gets a service fee. The family also has a 1.2-hectare vineyard. Revaz makes wine and sells it in the village. The total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris. 

Revaz requested a loan to get a trademark and purchase bottles. He will sell his wine in bottles with his trade name. As a result of this marketing tool, Revaz can sell his product for a higher price and in increased volume. The income of the family will increase and Revaz and her mother will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase bottles and trademark for winemaking

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fruits.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy used her first loan amount to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting on her farm. She was able to plant and it was very profitable.

This will be her second loan amount, which she plans to use to buy three bags of fertilizer and potato and maize seeds for planting, as well as chemicals. Part of the loan will also cater for the labour charges.

In the future, Mercy hopes to expand her farming so as to boost her income, thereby improving her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 12 years. She is 40 years old and married to Murage. They have six school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of our field officers and this will be her second loan. She plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Agnes hopes to boost her farming and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Zendere

texts.en:
Zendere Kazungu is a 57-year-old dairy farmer in Kilifi. She is a married mother of six children. She has been rearing dairy cattle for the past three years and she is doing great. 

This marks her third loan from KADET to finance her business. She plans to use the loan to purchase more feed for her dairy cattle and also buy more cattle. She will use the proceeds to expand her business further and repay her loan. 

She hopes to educate her children, who are all pursuing their university educations.

loans.use: to purchase more feed for her dairy cattle and also buy more cattle

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma runs a unisex hair salon, which she has had for four years. She first learned the hairdressing trade as an assistant, and then eventually she was able to open her own business. She is 32 years old and lives with her partner and two children. Vilma is requesting a loan in order to purchase more hair products such as dyes, creams, and shampoo, which she sells in her shop. Her dream is to open another hair salon, eventually creating her own chain.

Vilma is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Comuzone I" in Cusco, which is located in the Andean mountains at 3,400 meters above sea level. The bank is in its 17th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy hair products such as dyes, creams, and shampoo

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is 40 years old and has served as a police officer for about 20 years. He has one child who is currently in high school. He says that he decided to join the police force because he likes the work and thinks it is important to comply with the law. Recently Juan purchased a house, and a loan will help him pay off his mortgage. His dream in the future is to open a small business, such as a grocery store or warehouse. 

Juan is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Comuzone I" in Cusco, which is located in the Andean mountains at 3,400 meters above sea level. The bank is in its 17th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to pay off his home mortgage

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is a cosmetologist, specializing in beauty services for events such as weddings, birthdays, and baptisms. She has her own shop, and she has been working in this trade for eight years. Mercedes is requesting a loan in order to purchase equipment such as blow dryers and straightening irons. Her dream is to open more locations and run a chain of cosmetology shops. Mercedes is 38 years old and has one child with her partner.

Mercedes is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Comuzone I" in Cusco, which is located in the Andean mountains at 3,400 meters above sea level. The bank is in its 17th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to purchase equipment such as blow dryers and straightening irons

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is 43 years old and has been an accountant for 25 years. His clients come to him seeking advice for personal accounts and for their businesses.  He currently employs two other people to help him run the business. Felix is requesting a loan in order to buy more computers for his office and to help pay for his daughter’s kindergarten tuition. In the future, Felix would like to open a second business, such as an entertainment center where people can come to play video games.

Felix is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Comuzone I" in Cusco, which is located in the Andean mountains at 3,400 meters above sea level. The bank is in its 17th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy office computers and to pay for his daughter's kindergarten tuition

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.en:
Alejandrina is 39 years old and married with three children, including her 7-month-old daughter who appears in the photo with her. She makes a living by raising chickens and guinea pigs. Right now she has 40 chickens and 70 guinea pigs. She buys them when they are young and keeps them for three months before selling them in the market. A loan will help Alejandrina buy more baby animals. Her dream is to have a large livestock farm where she can also raise pigs.

Alejandrina is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Comuzone I" in Cusco, which is located in the Andean mountains at 3,400 meters above sea level. The bank is in its 17th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy baby chickens and guinea pigs

loans.name: Fany Monica

texts.en:
Fany Monica continues working in clothing-related enterprises. She is 24 and currently works for a business that specializes in garment production. Fany Monica is requesting a loan in order to continue her vocational studies. She already has a certificate in the confection of textiles and is requesting a loan in order to pay for one more year of studies so she can receive an advanced “Nombre de la Nación” certificate, which is an official title overseen by the Peru Ministry of Education. She will start her classes in June. Fany Monica's dream is to open a shop that rents party dresses. 

Fany Monica is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Comuzone I" in Cusco, which is located in the Andean mountains at 3,400 meters above sea level. The bank is in its 17th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to pay for classes to receive a vocational certificate

loans.name: Sofia Yrene

texts.en:
Sofia Yrene is 41 years old and has an 11-year-old daughter. Her primary job is working as a kindergarten teacher, a position she has held for 13 years. Sofia Yrene has used previous loans to pay for her higher education, and she would like another loan in order to complete her master's degree in education. She has just half a year left to obtain her degree. Sofia’s dream is to have her own house and to secure a better job.

Sofia Yrene is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Comuzone I" in Cusco, which is located in the Andean mountains at 3,400 meters above sea level. The bank is in its 17th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to pay the tuition for her master's degree in education

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 42 years old and a single mother of two children. She has a stand where she sells clothing of all types for men, women, and children. A loan will help Josefina to purchase more clothing from wholesalers in Cusco. She would like to buy items such as pants and jackets. Her dream is to have her own house.

Josefina is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Comuzone I" in Cusco, which is located in the Andean mountains at 3,400 meters above sea level. The bank is in its 17th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as pants and jackets at wholesale prices

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.en:
Evangelina continues running a produce stand in one of the local markets. A loan will help her purchase more vegetables from Urubamba and Arequipa. For example, she offers her customers carrots, lettuce, onions, yams, and purple corn. Evangelina is 45 years old and has three children with her partner. She dreams of having a nice house and owning a car someday.

Evangelina is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Comuzone I" in Cusco, which is located in the Andean mountains at 3,400 meters above sea level. The bank is in its 17th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, carrots, onions, and cabbages in bulk

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 24 years old and sells cell phone accessories in one of the local markets. She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise, such as headphones, cell phone chargers, and batteries. Her dream is have a large shop where she can sell products at wholesale.

Elizabeth is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Comuzone I" in Cusco, which is located in the Andean mountains at 3,400 meters above sea level. The bank is in its 17th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy cell phone accessories, such as headphones, chargers, and batteries

loans.name: Avelina Margot

texts.en:
Avelina Margot has been selling accessories and beauty products to friends and neighbors for the last 7 or 8 years. She is 45 years old and married with two children. A loan will help Avelina Margot invest in more beauty products, as well as shoes and purses. She says that her dream is to have her own stand where she can sell her wares.

Avelina Margot is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Comuzone I" in Cusco, which is located in the Andean mountains at 3,400 meters above sea level. The bank is in its 17th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy beauty products, shoes, and purses

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.en:
Zoraida sells flowers from a market stand. She is 32 years old and says she has been selling flowers “for many years” now. A loan will help her purchase more flowers, candles, incense, and vases for her stand. She says that her flowers mostly come from Arequipa and Lima, and her personal favorite is the astromelia lily. On the side, Zoraida also sells food in the street. She is married with three children, including one baby, and she hopes to see all of her children become professionals.

Zoraida is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Comuzone I" in Cusco, which is located in the Andean mountains at 3,400 meters above sea level. The bank is in its 17th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to purchase flowers, candles, incense, and vases

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George lives in Kvareli District, East Georgia with his family: his wife – Dariko, two sons (fifteen and thirteen years old) and his parents who are retired. George is thirty-eight years old. The family earns a living through an agricultural business. They have a dairy farm with eleven milk cows. George and Dariko produce on average 150 kg of cheese per month. Dariko sells the cheese each Sunday on the local open market. Along with the above-mentioned the family grows maize and melons on the family-owned 2.5 hectares of land. They sell their harvest to local greengrocery retailers. The total average monthly income of the family is 1,000 Laris, including George's parents' pensions.  

George requested credit to rent a tractor to till the land and purchase fertilizers. After tilling and fertilizing he will sow maize and melons. George and Dariko will work hard on their plot during the whole spring, to get a good harvest in the summer. They hope that the weather conditions will be favorable as well. After selling the harvest George will get profits, which will be used for the family's well-being.

loans.use: to rent a tractor to till the land and purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Winnifred

texts.en:
Winnifred is twenty-one years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past two years, Winnifred has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Winnifred has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Winnifred to generate greater profits and pay half the school fees for her child. Winnifred hopes that in the future she will be able to spend more on the medical expenses. 

Winnifred is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Winnifred's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Matthew

texts.en:
Matthew is a thirty-four-year-old man who is married with two children. He owns a hardware shop in Mukuyuni. He has been in the business for ten years now. 

This will be his second  loan with KADET Ltd. He plans to use the entire loan to buy more stock to expand his business. With the anticipated profits, he plans to educate his children and in future, he would like to be a successful business man.

loans.use: to buy more stock to expand his business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a forty-six-year-old married woman with three children. She has a retail shop and has been in the business for nine years now and gets a monthly income of fourteen thousand five hundred shillings.

This will be her first loan with KADET Ltd. She plans to use the entire loan to buy more stock. In future she wants to expand the business to a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Shamil

texts.en:
Shamil is 22 years old. He lives in Kvareli District, East Georgia with his wife, Raisata, parents and elder sister. Shamil and Raisata married a couple of months ago. All the family members are involved in the family agricultural business. They have a sheep farm with 40 sheep. Shamil’s parents produce cheese from the sheep, which is quite expensive on the Georgian market. They sell it on the local open market.  In addition, the family sells lambs. Along with the above-mentioned, the family has five greenhouses where they grow cucumbers during the entire year. Shamil sells the harvested cucumbers on the local open market. The total average income of the family is 700 Laris per month.

Shamil requested a loan for renting a tractor to till the family-owned land, which isn’t used at the moment for agricultural activities. Shamil will also purchase fertilizers and maize for sowing. The family members work hard in the cornfield to get the harvest. In late summer, the family will get the harvest and sell it on the local open market. Their income will increase and allow the family members to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to rent a tractor and purchase fertilizers and maize to sow

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben has a shop where he has been selling clothes for three years. He buys the clothes from Lima. Most of the time he has it sent to Cusco, but he still needs to travel every two months in order to look at merchandise. A loan will help Ruben to buy more merchandise such as pants, shirts, and jackets. He sells clothes for adults and children. Ruben’s dream is to expand the size of his shop, which is currently 1 x 3 meters.
