Ruben is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Comuzone I" in Cusco, which is located in the Andean mountains at 3,400 meters above sea level. The bank is in its 17th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise, such as pants, shirts, and jackets

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.en:
Eusebia is a secondary school teacher. She is 54 years old and married with two children, who are now working as professionals. In addition, she runs an informal business selling clothes to colleagues and other acquaintances. A loan will help her purchase more jeans from Lima. In the future, Eusebia would like to open a department store where she can sell clothes, among other things.
 
Eusebia is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Comuzone I" in Cusco, which is located in the Andean mountains at 3,400 meters above sea level. The bank is in its 17th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy jeans from Lima

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Matilde is 46 years old and married with four children. She alternates her time between a couple of business endeavors. Her primary business for the purposes of this loan is the raising of chicks and hens. She has 700 chicks and 100 hens now. While she raises the hens to sell at the market, she mostly sells the chicks to other people, who then raise and fatten them. A loan will help Matilde purchase more chicks, which she plans to distribute amongst her neighbors to make a profit. Her dream is to have a large poultry farm.

Matilde has a second job finishing artisanal goods, primarily alpaca knitwear, such as sweaters. These products are then exported to Switzerland and Japan.

Matilde is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Comuzone I" in Cusco, which is located in the Andean mountains at 3,400 meters above sea level. The bank is in its 17th cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy chicks for selling

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
This is 28 year-old Mamie.  She is married and has 4 children aged 11, 9, 6, and 2 years. In 2006, Mamie established her textiles business. She began her business because she stopped at class 4 and her aunt did not encourage her to further her education. Instead, her aunt introduced her to business, and Mamie later got married a driver who gave her some money to begin petty trading. 

Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, Mamie earns about SLL 1,700,000 every month from this business. She has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan. She would like a new loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000 to buy waxed cotton (1 bale @ SLL 3,800,000) and lace materials (6 rolls @ SLL 200,000). In the future, Mamie plans to acquire a shop, buy a car, and educate her children to the university level. Sometimes she buys goods that are spoiled. She is hard-working and knows how to encourage customers. She hopes to pay this loan within the stipulated schedule. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to  buy waxed cotton and lace materials.

loans.name: Crecencia

texts.en: Crecencia is married and has 5 children. She is 52 years old and lives in Yahong, Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Crecencia owns and operates a coconut plantation to earn a living. She has been in this business for 8 years and earns PHP 3,000 each month. She has requested a loan of PHP 4,600 to pay for labor costs for coconut harvesting. Crecencia has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for one year. She hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs for coconut harvesting.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en: At the age of 33, Crisanta is a widow who lives with her 4 children in Malaubang, Ozamis City. Crisanta owns and operates a store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She has been in this business for 4 years, and each month she earns PHP 3,000. She has requested a loan of PHP 4,896 to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee. In 2008, Crisanta joined GDMPC. In the future, she wants to build a house and to see her children complete their education.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee

loans.name: Emelie

texts.en: Emelie has a live-in partner and they have 2 children. She is 54 years old and lives in Canicapan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Emelie owns and operates a plot of farmland, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 9 years and earns PHP 4,000 each month. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,347 to purchase farm chemicals. Emelie has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for one year. In the future, Emelie plans to save her returns in order to expand and make some improvements to their house.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Diana's Group

texts.en:
Monica is thirty-eight years old and married with three children. She lives with her husband and children in Beahu, a suburb of Takoradi. She is a hardworking woman and through her hard work, has helped her husband to give their children good education. She is a bread baker. She bakes and distributes to beverage sellers and other bread sellers in her community at wholesale prices. She has been in business for ten years. 

Monica desires to use the loan to expand her business by buying materials in bulk so that she can distribute to a larger number of customers.  She hopes to open a bakery training school in the future. She is in the “Aniounyam Mba”, meaning children of glory, Trust Bank group. The group members act as guarantors for one another so as to access the loan.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her bakery business.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is 42 years old. He is a farmer from Telavi District, East Georgia. He is married and lives with his wife, Dali, parents (retired) and elder sister. The family earns their living through agriculture. They have a dairy farm with seven milk cows. Solomon and Dali produce cheese and sell it on the local open market. Along with the above-mentioned business, the family owns a vineyard on two hectares of land. He sells grapes to the local wine producers. Solomon has a motorcycle and sells ice cream in the summer season in his and nearby villages. The total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris, including the pensions of Solomon’s parents. 

Solomon requested a loan for purchasing drugs for treating the vineyard for parasites. After properly done seasonal work, he will get a high quality harvest in the fall and sell it for a convenient price. The family will get a profit and they will use it for financing their daily expenses during the year.

loans.use: to purchase drugs to treat the vineyard for parasites

loans.name: Phy's Group

texts.en:
Phy, aged 44, is a married mother of five children who lives in a rural village of the Mongkol Borei district, located in a province near the Thai border. Out of her five children, she still has one dependent daughter to take care of. She is a rice farmer of three hectares of farmland, while her husband is a paid car driver. Phy has been in this business for almost 20 years now. The main challenges for her are floods during the rainy season, low crop yields from farming production, and the lack of working capital. 

Phy has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles and successfully repaid the loans with VisionFund. The past loans have helped her make her living better. She is now leading her group of two female members to apply for a loan with VisionFund of 1,000,000 Khmer Riels each. Her group member has been with VisionFund for five loan cycles. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes the loan will enable her to increase her income as expected, so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkol Borey District

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora is from Tabid, Ozamis City. She is 46 years old. Flora is married and has 4 children. To make a living, she manages a seaweed production business. She has been engaged in her business for 12 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2007, Flora joined GDMPC. Flora is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to buy seedlings and twine to expand the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and twine

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is a married woman who has 2 children. Evelyn is 44 years old, and resides at Gata Daku, Clarin. Evelyn owns and operates a farm to earn a living, planting and harvesting corn for sale. She's been in this business for 12 years. Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 4,600 PHP to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. In 2006, Evelyn joined GDMPC. In the future, Evelyn wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Marryjo

texts.en: Marryjo is married. She is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. Marryjo is a farmer and she manages coconut production to earn a living. She has been doing this for 6 years and every month she earns 4,000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 4,320 PHP to pay for costs paid in farm maintenance. Marryjo has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Marryjo hopes to finish the studies of her children.

loans.use: to pay for costs paid in farm maintenance

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 44 years old and married with 3 children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Arlene has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business.

Arlene has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is from Panay Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old and married with 4 children. To make a living, Herminia owns and operates a specialized general store. She has been in this business for 8 years and earns PHP 10,000 a month from these activities. 

In 2004, Herminia joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of PHP 19,500, which she will use to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 58 years old and married with 3 children. With one child in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Conchita runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, spices, soft drinks, soap, and eggs. Conchita has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her business.

In the future, Conchita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks to sell in her business

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 55 years old and married with 5 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a hardware in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell.

Cristina has borrowed and paid 23 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the hardware store for 20 years and also earns an income from a general store. Cristina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks to sell

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 58 years old and married with 3 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Estela runs a business direct-selling Avon products in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as lotion, shampoo, perfumes, and soap. She has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional products to sell.

In the future, Estela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional products to sell

loans.name: Chanda

texts.en:
Chanda is thirty-four years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Chanda has a shop that sells rice, pollard, rice, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy stocks of rice, pollard, corn, snacks and beverages.

Chanda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Chanda hopes to improve her business for the sake of her children's education.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice, corn, polard, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is forty-two years old and has four children. Imelda is married and two of her children are in school.

Imelda is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Imelda requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to raise.

Imelda has been raising livestock for eight years now, and has borrowed fifteen times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Imelda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock to raise.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is forty-nine years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Josephine works very hard to provide for them.

Josephine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy more stock for her general store.

Josephine has been in this business for fifteen years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, milk, biscuits, bread, canned goods, etc.. 

In the future Josephine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Olga Yojany

texts.es:
Olga es una mujer de 34 años de edad, madre soltera, con 2 hijos dependientes, Vive en casa propia, la cual fue heredada por sus padres. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en el caserío Viviano Espinoza en el distrito de las Lomas en tambogrande, con deseos de superación. Solo cuenta con servicios básicos de luz.
La actividad que desarrolla  Olga es la venta de productos de belleza, de abarrotes, bebidas, golosinas y crianza de animales menores desde  hace aproximadamente más de 12 años. Atendiendo todos los días en su propio domicilio y recorriendo a las diferentes zonas cercanas a su caserío, para lo cual cuenta con clientela establecida. 
El monto solicitado del crédito es de 3,000 nuevos soles, lo que será destinado para invertirlo en su negocio  y para la compra de alimentos balanceados de sus animales y de está manera poder aumentar su capital de trabajo poder tener mejores ingresos para su hogar, así mismo cuenta con clientes ya establecidos.
texts.en:
Olga is a 34-year-old woman who is a single mother with two dependent children. She lives in her own home which she inherited from her parents. Her house is located in the village of Viviano Espinoza in the District of Las Lomas in Tambogrande. Olga hopes to be successful. The only basic service she receives is electricity.

Olga sells beauty products and groceries such as beverages and candy. She has also been raising small animals for more than 12 years. Every day she manages all of her businesses from her home and makes deliveries to different areas near her village. Olga has an established customer base. The amount of 3,000 PEN that she is requesting will be invested in her business and the purchase of balanced feed for her animals. This will increase her operating capital so that she can generate more household income. Olga already has established customers.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business and balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Francy Lucelia

texts.es: Francy es una joven de 23 años de edad originaria de Estelí,  soltera, de oficio comerciante en el negocio de pulpería, su nivel académico es universitario. Inicio su actividad con dinero que tenia ahorrado  ya que la mama le envía remesas de estados unidos desde los 22 años, anteriormente tenia una venta de ropa pero decidió quitarla pues no le generaba muchos ingresos, se siente satisfecha con su negocio ya que esta en un  lugar visible donde tiene buena clientela, su expectativa es mantener su negocio debido a que es independiente y le permite estar a lado de su familia. Solicita el préstamo para compra de granos básicos tales como avena, jabón, pan, leche, arroz, azúcar, etc. Todo lo necesario para surtir el negocio, como planes futuros espera mantener el negocio para poder salir adelante y tener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Francy is a young woman, 23 years of age, who was born in Esteli. She is single and a merchant in the grocery business. Educationally, Francy reached university level. She began  her monetary activity with money she saved from remittances her Mother has sent from the United States since Francy was 22 years old. Previously, she had a clothing store but decided to abandon that since it didn't generate much income.

Francy feels very satisfied with the store; it is located in a visible spot where she enjoys a good clientele. She expects to maintain the business because it gives her independence and permits her to be at her family's side. 

Francy is requesting a loan to buy basic grains such as oatmeal, plus soap, bread, milk, rice, sugar, etc., all that's needed to stock her grocery business. Concerning future plans, she hopes to maintain the business and be able to get ahead and have a better standard of living.

loans.use: buy basic grains such as oatmeal, plus soap, bread, milk, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Taliko

texts.en:
Taliko is 56 years old. She is a mother of one daughter and has a 16-year-old granddaughter. She goes to school. They live in a small village near Telavi, Kakheti Region. The family earns a living through their agricultural business. They have two milk cows. Taliko produces on average 30 kg of cheese per month. She sells it in Telavi. Along with the above-mentioned, Taliko grows maize on the family-owned one hectare of land. She sells it in Telavi as well. The total average monthly income of the family is 350 Laris.

Taliko requested a loan for financing the spring seasonal works on their plot. She will rent a tractor to till the land and purchase fertilizers. After tilling and fertilizing, she will sow maize. She will work hard during spring and summer to get a good harvest. After selling the harvested maize, Taliko plans to save to purchase calves. She plans to diversify the family agricultural activities in order to increase the income of the family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to rent a tractor and purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Zaza

texts.en:
Zaza is 44 years old. He is married and lives in Telavi District, East Georgia with his wife, Ia, and mother (retired). Zaza is leading the agricultural business of the family, which is their only source of income. Ia works as a salesperson in a village store. Zaza grows various vegetables and maize on the family-owned one hectare of land. He spends most of his time on the plot. The total average monthly income of the family is 600 Laris, including the pension of Zaza’s mother. 

Zaza requested a loan to finance the spring seasonal work on their plot. He will rent a tractor to till the land and purchase fertilizers. After tilling and fertilizing, he will sow maize and vegetables. Zaza will work hard during spring and summer to get a good harvest. After selling the harvested maize, Zaza will get a profit and reinvest it in the family farming activities to expand and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to rent a tractor and purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Versaldo

texts.en: Versaldo is a married man with three children. Versaldo is 55 years old and resides in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Versaldo used his last loan to purchase additional vehicle spare parts. His business is successful, and he is taking a new loan to pay for costs paid in repairing his motorcycle for the business's expansion. In the future, he hopes to be able to expand his business.

loans.use: to pay for costs paid in repairing his motorcycle

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is from Molicay, Ozamiz City. She is forty-seven years old. Perlita is married and has two children. To make a living, Perlita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. Perlita has been engaged in her business for ten years and earns PHP 8,000 a month for these activities. 

In 2010, Perlita joined GDMPC. Perlita is requesting a loan of PHP 12,440 which will be used to pay for the labor cost of plowing the land and buying seedlings. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for the labor cost of plowing the land and to buy seedlings.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is fifty-eight years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Luz runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Ma. Luz has been in this business for fifteen years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar, milk, coffee, canned goods, etc.. 

In the future Ma. Luz would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Sally

texts.en:
Ma. Sally is forty-three years old and widowed.

Ma. Sally works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Ma. Sally has borrowed and paid for seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Ma. Sally aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is forty years old and has four children who are in school. Maricel is married. 

Maricel is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Maricel requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Maricel has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed eleven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is thirty-seven years old and widowed with two children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Ann runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Mary Ann has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, cream, milk, sugar, sardines, etc.. 

In the future Mary Ann would like to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is fifty-six years old and married with seven children. With one child in school, Patricia works very hard to provide for them.

Patricia runs a spice retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional spices to sell.

Patricia has been in this business for eleven years and sells a variety of items such as onions, garlic, ginger, spring onions, etc.. 

In the future Patricia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional spices to sell.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Elvie has a shop that sells snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 11,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients like sugar, cheese, rice and flour.

Elvie has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, Elvie hopes to improve her business to provide for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make snacks like fruit cakes, banana cakes and hot cakes

loans.name: Telma Del Socorro

texts.es:
Telma es originaria de Diriomo- municipio de Masaya actualmente vive en granada, de 52 años de edad, realizo estudios hasta la primaria, de oficio comerciante se dedica al negocio de abarrotería, madre de 2 hijos. Inicio su actividad desde hace 15 años viajando al mercado de Granada a vender los pocos productos de frutas y granos básicos que sacaba de la cosecha, luego con el tiempo compro un tramo con el dinero que le generaba el negocio de sus ventas de frutas y granos básicos desde entonces empezó a vender diferentes productos que son de autoconsumo en la población, trabajando con el apoyo de créditos otorgados por financieras, sus productos son comercializados en el mercado de Granada. Cuenta con otros ingresos ya que el esposo se desempeña en la agricultura y aporta para los gastos del hogar, su expectativa es agrandar su abarrotería.
Solicita el préstamo para compra de granos básicos tales como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, etc. El cual considera que le ayudara ya que podrá ampliar su negocio con el objetivo de obtener más ganancias, se considera una persona con mucha experiencia y dominio en el negocio pero sobre todo muy responsable con sus créditos.
texts.en:
Telma is from Diriomo, which is a municipality of Masaya.  She currently lives in Granada.  She is 52 years old and has a primary education.  She sells groceries for a living and she is the mother of two children.  She started her business 15 years ago traveling to the market in Granada to sell the few fruit and staple grains products she got from her harvest.  With time, she bought a stall with the money her business was making from selling her fruits and grains and since then she has started to sell different products that are produced and consumed within the area.  Working with the help of loans she has received from financiers, she sells her products in the market in Granada.  She depends on other sources of income, as her husband works in agriculture for a living and he contributes toward the household expenses.  She expects to expand her grocery business. 

She is asking for this loan to buy staple grains, such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, etc.  She believes this will help her because it will enable her to expand her business, with the goal of earning more.  She considers herself to be very experienced and knowledgeable in regards to her business, but above all she is very responsible with her loans.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 62-year-old married man. He has six children between 5 and 25 years old. He describes himself to be a leader, social, patient and determined. He operates a pushcart where he provides pushcarts for hire and sells pressure lamps, lantern lamps, garden pipes etc . He has been involved in this business for 12 years. John's business is located along a busy road and near a viable market and his primary customers are casual laborers of pushcarts and shopkeepers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be seasonality when few customers come to buy the items. He will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy wood for making a pushcart. His business goal is to be a sole supplier of pushcarts in Mwingi town. He hopes that in the future, with the anticipated profits, he will educate his children.

loans.use: to buy wood for making push carts.

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab is 22 years old. He lives in a small village in Telavi District, East Georgia. Zurab lives with his mother, grandparents and younger sister. His mother works as a pharmacist in Telavi. Zurab’s sister is a student. 

Zurab is busy with the family agricultural business. He takes care of three milk cows. Zurab produces yogurt and sells it to Telavi grocery stores. In addition, the family owns a 0.2-hectare vineyard. Zurab works hard in the vineyard to get a good harvest. He sells it to the local wine-producing factories. The total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris, including the pensions of Zurab’s grandparents. 

Zurab requested a loan for purchasing a milk cow. With four milk cows, he will be able to increase production and sales of yogurt by 30%. The income of the family will increase and they will be able to purchase additional household goods, which are needed in the village, to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Shiela is a thirty-two-year-old single woman. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, where her wide array of banana and vegetable production is located. She has been cultivating this land since she was twenty-nine years of age. She normally receives PHP 3,500 a month. 

Earlier, in 2011, Shiela joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of PHP 6,300 to purchase fertilizers such as manure to increase production. When the crop is sold, the revenue from it will be used to expand the area of her production so that she can earn more income to sustain her daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en: Juanita is married, 45 years of age, and lives in Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental together with her child. Juanita is operating a sari-sari store to earn a living. She has been in this business for 9 years and she earns 5,000 PHP every month. She is requesting a loan of 7,506 PHP to purchase supplementary goods for her store. She joined GDMPC in 2007. Juanita wishes that their business will make more progress.

loans.use: to purchase supplementary goods for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Soila Marina

texts.es: Soila tiene 35 años de edad, es originaria de Somoto- Municipio de Estelí, de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de comida. Su actividad surge desde hace 3 años con ingresos propios que ella tenía ya que anteriormente trabajaba en una fábrica y con lo que recogió de su ganancias  decidió poner su propio negocio siendo este una venta de comida ubicado en el departamento de Estelí, no tiene otros ingreso pues se ayudo solo de lo que saca de la venta de comida donde se siente muy satisfecha ya que en el lugar en que  se encuentra tiene buena clientela y vende bastante, con su negocio ha podido sacar adelante a su familia. Realiza el préstamo para compra de arroz, aceite, plátano, repollo, azúcar, todo lo necesario para la elaboración de sus comidas, el cual estima le ayudara ya que invertirá en el negocio para obtener más ganancias, como planes futuros espera crecer en su negocio para brindarle un buen bienestar a su familia y llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en: Soila is 35 years old and is from Somoto, Municipality of Estelí.  She is a merchant by trade and sells food.  She started this business three ago with her own income that she had earned previously while working in a factory. She pulled her earnings together to set up her food sales business which is located in the department of Estelí.  She doesn’t have other income since she supports herself only by what she takes from the food sales. She feels very satisfied because she has a good clientele at her location and sells enough. With her business, she has been able to get her family ahead in life.  She is requesting the loan to purchase rice, oil, bananas, cabbage, sugar, and all that she needs to prepare her meals.  She considers that the loan will help her because she will invest in the business to obtain more profits.  As far as her future plans are concerned, she hopes to grow her business in order to provide for her family’s welfare and to have her own home.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, bananas, cabbage, and sugar.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel es un hombre de 43 años de edad, conviviente, con 03 hijos dependientes, vive en casa propia en el Caserío Santa Isabel, ubicado a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Mórrope. Cliente con experiencia financiera.
La actividad que realiza el Miguel es la crianza y venta de animales. Cliente cría sus animales en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, lo cual alimenta a sus animales con polvillo, maíz y pastos naturales. 
Adicionalmente Miguel trabaja en el campo en la labor de jornal y también se desempeña como contratista (lleva personal para trabajar en campos).
 El monto del crédito solicitado es de 2000 nuevos soles, dicho  crédito será para la compra de alimento balanceado para su ganado y compra de animales para negociar. , y con esto logrará atender la demanda insatisfecha en el lugar,  y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Miguel is a 43 year-old man who lives with his 3 dependent children in his own house in the village of Santa Isabel, which is located 15 minutes from the city of Mórrope.  He is a client with financial experience.

Miguel works raising and selling animals.  He raises his animals in pens located behind his house.  He feeds the animals with "polvillo" (animal feed made from rice) , corn, and by grazing.  In addition, Miguel works in the fields as a day laborer and also works as a contractor, taking workers out to labor in the fields.

The loan amount requested is 2000 nuevos soles.  This credit will be used to buy nutrionally balanced feed for his livestock and to buy animals to sell.  With this he will be able to meet an unmet demand in the area, and be able to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: purchase nutritionally balanced feed as well as animals for resale.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel es de la comarca la laguna  tiene 4 hijos  de 20, 18, 16 y 11 años de los cuales solo una estudia el 6to grado de la primaria en la escuela de la comarca, es casada  y aunque el marido este trabajando en Costa Rica pocas veces dice que le manda dinero para la alimentación de sus hijos.  Isabel se dedica a la siembra de frijol y maíz desde hace 10 años , producto de la ganancia de la cosecha ha comprado 1,5 manzana de tierra que en esa zona es cara por ser tierras fértiles ella dice que cuando saca la cosecha la lleva a vender al mercado de Managua ya que allá se vende mejor Isabel. Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación es que saca a su familia adelante pues le toca ser padre y madre de familia y al mismo tiempo ser la que lleva el alimento diario. Ella usara el crédito para comprar la semilla del frijol de siembra , comprar los insumos y tener disponible para pagar mano de obra   ella  dice que el crédito le ayudara  adquirir y solventar parte de los gastos que se realiza en la siembra de granos básicos. También dice que una vez que saque su cosecha pagara el crédito y la ganancia que le quede comprara lo que le haga falta para mejorar la casa.
texts.en: Isabel is from the La Laguna Region. She has four children, who are 20, 18, 16, and 11 years old and of whom only one is in school, in the sixth grade at the local school.  She is married and even though her husband works in Costa Rica sometimes, she tells us that he sends her money to feed their children.  Isabel has grown beans and corn for 10 years now and, as a result of the money she has made from her harvests, she has bought just over 2.5 acres of land, which is expensive in this region because it is fertile.  She tells us that when she gets her harvest, she takes it to sell at the market in Managua since sales are better there.  Through a lot of effort and dedication, Isabel gets her family ahead, as it is up to her to be both mother and father to her children in addition to providing food for them daily.  She will use her loan to buy bean seeds to plant, to buy supplies, and to have enough to pay for labor.  She tells us that the loan will help her acquire and pay for part of the expenses she accrues in planting her staple grains.  She also tells us that once she gets her harvest she will pay off her loan and, with the earnings that are left over, she will buy what she needs to make improvements her home.

loans.use: to buy bean seeds to plant, to buy supplies, and to have enough to pay for labor

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en:
Shadrack is the father of one child, aged three years. He has been in mixed farming for six years and currently sells his milk and poultry products to the local market. He also runs a mobile money transfer service.

Shadrack has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says this will improve his farming income and enable him to specialize in dairy farming within the next five years.

Shadrack says unreliable rains and the high costs of inputs and diseases are his major challenges.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David has been in farming for over two years and runs his farm with two farmhands. He produces maize and milk for the local market. He is a father of three children aged between twelve and eight years. He also works as a veterinary officer.

David has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says his knowledge in disease management and general experience in dairy farming will ensure he reaps the best benefit from the loan acquisition. He hopes to adopt a zero-grazing system for his dairy business in the near future and improve his family living standards.

David says high cost of production and sourcing of capital are the major challenges in farming to him currently.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Inee

texts.en:
Inee is thirty-one years old, married, and lives in the Philippines. 

Inee is providing motorela or motorcycle services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy tools like a t-wrench, an air compressor, a screw driver and pay for the gasoline for the services.

Inee became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, Inee hopes to improve her services.

loans.use: to buy tools for the maintenance of her motorcycle and pay for the gasoline.

loans.name: Kibibi

texts.en:
Kibibi is a 44-year-old businesswoman in Mombasa. She sells clothes, a business she has been doing for the past two years with success. She is married.

This is her second business loan from KADET. She plans to purchase more wrappers, blouses and skirts. She will use the anticipated profits to reinvest into the business. She hopes to excel in the business.

loans.use: to purchase more wrappers, blouses and skirts

loans.name: Sari Makmur Group

texts.en: The Sari Makmur group has a new head, Ni Made. She's replaced Ni Komang who resigned. Now the group has nine members and Ni Made is responsible for the group. The loan will be used to purchase piglets, feed, and for renovating the barn. Ni Made will use her loan to purchase superior piglets. She's already had three local pigs for porkroll. The local pigs will be sold every two months and the super quality pigs in the fifth month of the loan period. She hopes the effort will run smoothly, that she can earn enough profit to save some, and that it will be successful like that of her friends before.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed, and renovate a barn

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is thirty-five years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Analiza has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, bath soap, shampoo and beverages.

Analiza became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, Analiza hopes to improve her business for the sake of her children's education.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, bath soap, shampoo and beverages.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is fifty-one years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Nenita has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 13,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, shampoo, soap and beverages.

Nenita became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, Nenita hopes to improve her business for the sake of her children's education.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, shampoo and beverages.

loans.name: Juana Luz

texts.en:
Juana Luz is thirty-two years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
 
Juana Luz is providing motorela or motorcycle services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy tools like a t-wrench, air compressor, screw driver and to pay for the gasoline for the services.

Juana Luz became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, Juana Luz hopes to improve her services for the sake of her children's education.

loans.use: to buy tools for the maintenance of her motorbike and pay for the gasoline.

loans.name: Madina's Group

texts.en:
Madina's group is comprised of three hard-working women. Madina is seventeen years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala east region of Uganda. For the past year, Madina has been working hard to manage her small mobile business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Madina has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Madina to generate greater profits and expand her business. Madina hopes that in the future she will be able to own a shop that sells clothes. 

Madina is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Madina's future prospects by helping her to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is forty-two years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Emily has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 21,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Emily has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Emily hopes to improve her business for the sake of her children.

loans.use: to buy stock like canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a woman with three children, two of whom are enrolled in school while the third is still under school age. She is married to Omar, a mason. Amina lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She sells fish from her home, her primary customers being her neighbors. She aspires to open a restaurant in future, and she describes market competition to be her major challenge.

Amina intends to use her loan of KSH 20,000 to purchase fish to sell.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Yelba Del Rosario

texts.es: Yelba es originaria de Granada, de 45 años de edad, casada, de oficio comerciante en el negocio de pulpería en el que cuenta con 25 años de experiencia. Yelba ha trabajo con créditos otorgados por nuestra institución el primer préstamo lo utilizo para compra de productos básicos y lácteos tales como arroz, frijoles, leche, queso y azúcar el cual estima le ayudo ya que el invertir en sus productos le trajo mas ganancias. Ella solicita un nuevo préstamo al igual para compra de granos básicos tales como arroz, pan, avena, azúcar, leche y para recargas claro y movistar. En el negocio recibe el apoyo de su esposo, su expectativa es que una vez cancelado el crédito buscar nuevas mercaderías para seguir manteniendo su negocio estable al igual seguir trabajando con el apoyo de nuestra institución y KIVA ya que ha resultado un cambio positivo para su negocio.
texts.en: Yelba is from Granada and is 45 years old and married.  She is a shopkeeper with a grocery store and 25 years of experience.  Yelba has worked with loans authorized by our organization.  She used the first loan to buy basic products and dairy products such as rice, beans, milk, cheese and sugar.  She believes that this helped her because by investing in her products she gained more income.  She is requesting a new loan of the same amount to buy basic grains such as rice, bread, oats, sugar, milk and for Claro and Movistar mobile phone top-up cards.  In the business she receives support from her husband.  Her expectation is that once she has paid back her loan she will seek out new merchandise to continue maintaining the stability of her business and to keep on working with the support of our organization and KIVA, which has resulted in a positive change for her business.

loans.use: to buy basic grains such as rice, bread, oats, sugar, milk and for Claro and Movistar mobile phone top-up cards

loans.name: Ivett Yahaira

texts.es:
Ivett Yahaira, trabaja como ejecutiva de ventas  en una casa comercial de la ciudad de León, inicia su activad laboral a las 8 am finalizándolas a las 5:30 pm, es madre de 2 hijos.

Ivett se siente agradecida con ceprodel ya que le ayudo con su primer crédito el que fue empleado para la construcción de su vivienda, hoy en la actualidad solicito el segundo crédito para compra de zinc y perlines los cuales fueron utilizados para mejoramiento del techo de su vivienda ya que esta próxima la temporada de invierno, permitiéndole obtener una mejor condición de vida para toda su familia.
texts.en: Ivett Yahaira works as a sales executive at a business firm in the city of León.  She begins her work day at 8:00 am and ends at 5:30 pm.  She is the mother of two children.  Ivett feels grateful to Ceprodel because they helped her with her first loan which she used for the construction of her home.  At the present time, she is requesting the second loan to purchase zinc metal sheeting and purlins which she will use to improve her home’s roof.  This will allow her to improve her family’s living conditions for the coming winter.

loans.use: to purchase zinc metal sheeting and purlins.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has six children. 

Helen has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 20,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, detergents & beverages. 

Helen joined HSPFI this year. In the future, Helen hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap and beverages

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 36 years old and is a married woman with three children ages 7, 11 and 13. Her husband is a farmer. 

Marilyn has had a sari-sari (general) store business for 10 years. She sells various items like toiletries, spices and vegetables. Marilyn's income is used to provide for her family's daily needs. 

She finds it difficult to replenish her inventory rapidly, so she has applied for a loan to buy more items to sell such as eggs, vegetables and canned goods. This will help increase Marilyn's sales and business profitability.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as eggs, vegetables and canned goods

loans.name: Lara Grace

texts.en:
Lara Grace is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Lara Grace has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 15,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, bath soap, shampoo & beverages. 

Lara Grace joined HSPFI this year. In the future, Lara Grace hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, bath soap and beverages

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is taking another loan of 25,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to establish a kiosk. She intends to add stock of beans, wheat flour, and sugar. The previous loan enabled her increase her profits and she is now opting to start a new business of operating a kiosk. Fatuma is really grateful to both Yehu and Kiva for their support. She desires to open a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to establish a kiosk.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro, tiene la edad  de 75 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa que es su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito va compra los abonos, herbicidas y pago de mano de obra de la asistencia y mejoras a su Cañal. El cuenta con mucha experiencia en el manejo de este cultivo y según su conocimiento piensa que es necesario asistirlo para así obtener de él un mejor rendimiento de producción. El quiere sacarle provecho a su siembra de caña y obtener ingresos económicos para su bienestar y el de su esposa. El quiere asegurar su futuro económico pues actualmente son tiempos difíciles para generar dinero. El con esta mejora está muy segura que su Cañal aumentara la producción y sus ingresos económico estabilizando si economía. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Pedro is 75 years old, married, and lives with his wife who is highest priority. He will use his loan to buy compost, herbicides, and pay for labor to maintain and improve his sugar cane field. Pedro has plenty of experience in managing this crop. Based on his knowledge, he provides the necessary attention so that he can obtain the best production results. He wants to take advantage of his sugar cane crop so that he can provide for the welfare of himself and his wife. Pedro would like to secure his financial future because he currently has difficulty generating income. He is very confident that increasing his sugar cane production will stabilize his financial situation.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. Pedro has not had any other loans from the state banks. FUDECOSUR is offering this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy compost, herbicides, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Benita

texts.es:
Benita es una mujer de 46 años de edad, casada y sin hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa propia con su conviviente, la casa está ubicada en el caserío CP-8 Malingas del Distrito de Tambogrande. Cliente vive en la parte  rural del distrito y no cuenta con servicio de luz.
La actividad que desarrolla la Benita es la crianza de ganado menor (ovino, porcino y aves de corral), los cuales al alcanzar peso y tamaño adecuado los comercializa en el mercado local. Complementariamente cuenta con 1.0 ha de terreno agrícola en el cual tiene limón en producción. Su esposo es trabajador estable en una empresa de la zona  y le pagan mensualmente lo que apoya en la canasta familiar.
 
El monto solicitado del crédito será de 1,700 nuevos soles lo cual lo invertirán en  la compra de alimento balanceado para su ganado. , y  de esta manera obtener ingresos y  poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Benita is 46 years old, she is married and without dependent children. She lives in her own home with her partner, which is located in a very small neighborhood of CP-8 Malingas in the district of Tambogrande. She lives in the rural part of the district and doesn't have electricity.

Benita rears small cattle (sheep, pigs and poultry) for a living, which she sells in the local market when they are reach the right size and weight. Additionally, she has 1.0 ha of agricultural land which produces lemons. Her husband has a permanent contract with a business in the area and they pay him every month, which helps with the household needs.  

The amount requested for this loan is 1,700 Peruvian Nuevos Soles which they will invest in the purchase of animal feed for their cattle, and in that way, obtain better profits and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for her cattle.

loans.name: Ana Gabriela

texts.es:
Ana Gabriela, trabaja como auxiliar de contabilidad en una empresa de la ciudad de León su horario  es de 8 am  a  6 pm es  madre de una niña de 10 meses.

Gabriela  se presentó a las oficina de ceprodel a solicitar un crédito para compra de arena,  cemento y realizar acabado final a su vivienda, con esto ella ha logrado a  cumplir su sueño de tener su vivienda digna donde tiene mejor condiciones de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en: Ana Gabriela works as an accounting assistant in a company in the city of Leon.  Her work hours are from 8 am to 6 pm.  She is the mother of a 10-month-old girl. Gabriela came to the CEPRODEL office to request a loan to buy sand and cement to complete her house.  With this she will have achieved her dream of having a suitable home where she have better living conditions with her family.

loans.use: to buy sand and cement.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane is 34 years old, married and lives in the Philippines. She has a food/retail shop (or sari-sari store) that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, bath soap, shampoo and beverages. Mary Jane has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Mary Jane hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo and beverages.

loans.name: Elba Francisca

texts.es:
Elba Francisca, trabaja como ejecutiva de ventas  en una casa comercial de la ciudad de León, inicia su activad laboral a las 8 am finalizándolas a las 5:30 pm.

Elba solicitó su primer crédito a ceprodel para compra de arena, cemento, bloques, hierro, piedrín los cuales fueron utilizados para la elaboración de un cuarto permitiéndole obtener una mejor condición de vida para ella y su querida mamá siendo única hija.
texts.en: Elba Francisca works as a sales executive in a business in the city of Leon.  She starts works at 8 am and finishes at 5:30 pm.  Elba is requesting her first loan from CEPRODEL to buy sand, cement, concrete blocks, iron and gravel that will be used to build a room.  This will allow better living conditions for her and her beloved mother, for whom she is the only daughter.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, concrete blocks, iron,  gravel, etc.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is 38 years old and married with 3 children.  With 2 children in school, Aileen works very hard to provide for them.

Aileen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. She has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future Aileen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn is married with 8 children. She is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Ginalyn sells vegetables like pechay (Chinese cabbage) and cabbage and fruits like apples and oranges to earn a living and has had this business for 6 years. She has requested a loan to buy additional stocks of vegetables and fruits.

Ginalyn has been a member of HSPFI for 5 years. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the betterment of their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of vegetables like pechay and cabbage and fruits like apples and oranges.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 

Clarita has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to increase her stock of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo and beverages.

Clarita became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, Clarita hopes to improve her business to provide for the education of her child.

loans.use: to increase her stock of canned goods, snacks, soap and beverages

loans.name: Mujeres En Acción Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en su décimo  séptimo  ciclo es un comité ejemplar que siempre trabaja en equipo y se ayudan mutuamente. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y que luchan por sus hijos y por el futuro de ellos.
Podemos hablar de la Sra. Graciela tiene un taller de costura que esta en crecimiento con cuatro personales. Comenta que gracias a su  negocio ella ayuda a su familia y cubre los gastos del día a día. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando a mas personas con fuentes de trabajo.
Graciela solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, gomas, botones y demás insumos para poder seguir creciendo.Agradecen todas ellas por la oportunidad que están recibiendo de la fundación paraguaya y de kiva.
texts.en:
This comunal bank is in its 17th cycle.  It is an exemplary communal bank that always works as a team, and the members help each other.  They are very hard-working women who struggle for their children and their children’s future.

Graciela has a sewing shop that is growing with four people.  She says that thanks to her business she helps her family and covers the day to day expenses.  Her goal is to be able to keep growing.  This way she will be able to continue helping more people by providing a source of work.

Graciela is requesting the loan to buy fabric, thread, elastic, buttons, and other supplies in order to be able to continue growing.  

They all are grateful for the opportunity they are getting from the Fundación Paraguaya and from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic, buttons, and other supplies.

loans.name: Clara Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, ciudad hermosa de verdes  montañas y paisajes  encantadores, conocida desde hace muchos años como la Ciudad Del Valle  encontramos el lugar donde se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal La Frontera De Urvavisa.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Clara, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  11 y de 6 años de edad, ambos estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo trabaja ocasionalmente.

Ella para ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudar a su marido con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, vende arroz ya sea por libras o por saquillos, tiene un pequeño local en su casa en el cual vende estos productos, ella además de esto también prepara y vende dulces y pasteles, nos cuenta que son muchos sus clientes que le piden que les prepare sus dulces ya que según ella le quedan deliciosos y estos los prepara para fiestas o recepsiones que sus clientes tengan. Lleva dos años en estas actividades y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar arroz, azúcar y otros víveres para preparar los dulces.

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que no les falte nada a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In Portoviejo, the beautiful city of green mountains and enchanting scenery long known as the City of the Valley, we find the place where, every fifteen days, the members of the Banco Comunal La Frontera De Urvavisa convene.

Here we meet Clara. She is thirty-five years old and married. From her marriage, she has two children, ages eleven and six. They are both in school. Her husband works occasionally.

In order to make a little money and help her husband with the family expenses, Clara runs a business. She sells rice, either by the pound or by the bag. She has a small shop in her home where she sells these products. In addition, Clara also prepares and sells sweets and cakes. She tells us she has many customers who ask her to prepare desserts, since according to her, they are delicious. She makes them for parties or receptions that her clients have. She has two years experience with her businesses and they are going very well.

She will use this loan to buy rice, sugar, and other supplies for making her desserts.

Her goals are to get ahead in her business so that her children will lack for nothing.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and other supplies

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
La Joven Martha Lorena, es soltera  comerciante se dedica a venta de cosméticos  en uno de los   mercados de la ciudad de León, diariamente inicia a realizar sus ventas desde las 6 am a 5 pm, ella realiza este tipo de trabajo para la mantención de sus dos hijos. 
 
Este crédito lo solicito  para  la compra de cosméticos, bolsos, carteras, bisuterías por mayor en la ciudad de Managua donde viaja dos veces por semana por que compra el producto más barato y obtiene mejores  ganancia. 

Martha  esta agradecida con  Ceprodel por que le ha ayudado a incrementar su inventario con productos de mejor calidad,  confía en Dios que nuestra institución le pueda seguir ayudando a crecer.
texts.en:
Martha Lorena is a young, single woman who works selling cosmetics in one of the city markets of León. She works from 6 in the morning until 5 in the evening so that she can support and provide for her two children.

She is requesting this loan in order to purchase bulk cosmetics, bags, purses, and imitation jewelry in Managua. She travels twice a week to the capital to purchase products at lower prices, giving her a better profit margin.

Martha is grateful to Ceprodel for their support, as they have helped her to increase her inventory and offer higher quality products. She has faith in God that this support will help her to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, bags, purses and imitation jewelry.

loans.name: Silvio

texts.es:
El Señor Silvio es de la ciudad de Asunción,  es muy buena persona, es padre de una niña a la cual la cría solo, es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora.
El se dedica al comercio, tiene una despensa bien surtida con la cual tiene los medios para poder mantener a su familia. El comenta que desde muy temprano sale al mercado de abasto a surtir su  Despensa la cual tiene muy buena concurrencia de clientes en especial gente de las zonas aledañas.
Solicita el crédito para la abastecer su local carne, bebidas, lácteos, ya que tiene mucha demanda y quiere poder cumplir con ellas. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
Silvio is from the city of Asunción.  He is a good person and he is the father of a little girl who he is raising alone.  He is a very hard-working and enterprising person.  Silvio is a businessman and owns a well-stocked general store which is the means for supporting his family.  He tells us that he goes to the wholesale market very early to supply his general store which has a very good customer turnout, especially people from the surrounding areas.  
He is requesting this loan to supply his store with meat, beverages, and dairy products because he wants to be able to meet the high demand for these products.  He is grateful for the opportunity he is receiving.

loans.use: to purchase meat, beverages, dairy products, and other items.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria. a 47-year-old married mother of four children, has been selling ready-to-wear clothes and dresses as well as shoes and sandals for seven years, earning PHP 12000 each moth. A member of HSPFI since 2007, Maria has requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy additional stocks of clothes, shoes, sandals and dresses.

In the future, Maria hope to improve her business for the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of ready-to-wear clothes, shoes, sandals and dresses.

loans.name: Eufenea

texts.en:
Eufenea is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. 

Eufenea has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store where she  buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo & beverages.

Eufenea has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Eufenea hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap and beverages

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa is a 21-year-old married woman with 2 young children. Her husband is a farmer.

Marisa is also a farmer and primarily grows rice crops to sell. She earns 3000 PHP per month doing this farming. Marisa does her best to be a good mother and wife. She hopes to open a sari-sari (variety) store business to help augment their income.

Marisa will use this loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to earn better and be able to start a new business soon.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, a 46-year-old married mother of eight children, lives in the Philippines where she has been operating a sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages for the past five years. A member of HSPFI since 2011, she is requesting a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy more stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

In the future, Teresita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks such as canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: C 9374 Abunzubumwe Group

texts.en:
Elina is 27 years old and married with one child. She sells charcoal and has been in this business for two years. Elina is the leader of the group which is called "C9374 ABUNZUBUMWE". She is in the middle holding a sign.

Elina has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more sacs of charcoal for sale. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future and she will be able to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacs of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El comité 8 de Diciembre nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo de un grupo de mujeres que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar. Ellas tienen como meta poder trabajar juntas y por medio de ese trabajo mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
La Sra. Lorenza se dedica a la venta de ropa y de lencería y cuenta que tiene siempre muy buena variedad de esas prendas, por lo que tiene muy buena clientela. Ella es una persona que se esfuerza siempre por dar a su familia lo que ellos necesitan para tener una vida sin necesidades.
Lorenza solicita el crédito, ya que tiene pedidos de prendas y lencería y quiere poder cumplir con ellos, además quiere estar abastecida con buena variedad para atraer a más clientes.
texts.en:
The “8th of December” committee was established through the management and support of a group of women united by a common goal of working together and striving to improve their conditions and quality of life.

Lorenza works selling clothing and lingerie, and she offers a wide variety of high quality products to her customers. She is a very hardworking woman who does everything for the good of her family, and in order to give them a life free from want.

Lorenza is requesting this loan in order to pay off orders of clothing she has made to further stock her business. She also wants to be able to offer a wide variety of products to increase her customer base.

loans.use: to purchase clothing products for resale.

loans.name: Yadira Epifanía

texts.es:
Yadira Epifania, casada, madre de 2 hijos y  trabaja como auxiliar de contabilidad de  una emisora radial de la ciudad de León, inicia su activad laboral a las 8 am finalizándolas a las 5:00 pm.

Yadira solicitó a ceprodel su primer crédito para compra de una refrigeradora, la cual será de gran utilidad para la mantención de sus alimentos.
texts.en:
Yadira Epifanía is married, and is the mother of two children. She works as a bookkeeper for a radio station in the city of León. She starts work at 8 every morning, and works until 5 in the afternoon.

Yadira is requesting her first loan in order to purchase a refrigerator, which will allow her to safely store food in her home.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator.

loans.name: Las Marias Group

texts.es:
Las Marías se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá desde el año 2008. El grupo está integrado por 19 mujeres, quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el ciclo número 11 del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya.
Mary es la presidenta del grupo, ella nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de leche. Trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano, ya que sale a repartir su producto. Por medio de su trabajo ella ha podido salir adelante y ayudar con los gastos de familia. Su meta es ser una gran microempresaria.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de lacteos, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y teniendo el producto en stock.
texts.en:
Las Marías is the name of a group of hardworking women who live and work in the city of Itá, Paraguay. The group is made up of 19 entrepreneurial women who, since 2008, have worked together and are in their 11th business cycle. 

Mary is the president of the group, and she works selling milk. She gets up early every morning to travel around making sales. As a result of her work, she has been able to get ahead and help with her family’s expenses. Her goal is to become a great entrepreneur and small business owner.

She is requesting this loan in order to continue her business and stock products for resale.

loans.use: to purchase milk for resale.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El presente comite se formo con 15 mujeres de la ciudad de Luque, el grupo se encuentra en el primer ciclo del programa, y tienen como objetivo ayudarse las unas a las otras y darle a sus familias todo lo que necesitan para una vida mejor.
La Sra Lourdes es una de las miembros, ella es Costurera , tiene 27 años, esta casada con el Sr Ovidio quien es vendedor, juntos tienen 2 hijos. Ella comenta que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio ayuda a su marido con los gastos de la casa y de esa forma pueden darle una vida digna a sus hijos. La  Sra Lourdes tiene una meta ampliar su negocio y de esa manera tener un lugar estable.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, gomas, botones y demás insumos para poder seguir cumpliendo con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The committee pictured above is made up of 15 members from the city of Luque. They are in their first program cycle, and have come together with the common goal of supporting one another and providing a better life for their families.

Lourdes is one of the group members, and she works as a seamstress. She is 27 years old, and is married to Ovidio, who is a salesman. They have two children together, and Lourdes works very hard to help her husband with the household expenses and to provide a better life for their children. Lourdes’ goal is to grow and stabilize her business.

She is requesting this loan in order to purchase fabrics, thread, buttons and other products to keep up with her clients’ orders.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, buttons and other products.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia es una mujer de 49 años de edad de estado civil conviviente, y con 2 hijos a su cargo, vive conjuntamente con su esposo y en casa propia en el AA.HH San Francisco distrito la Matanza - Piura, cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona, es una persona responsable y muy conocida,  el distrito cuenta con mas de 10 mil habitantes y ella habita en este pueblo joven.
Lidia se dedica a la venta de chicha de jora y  también a la crianza de animales menores, tales como pavos, ovejos y otros, todo esto desde hace 5 años, y lo hace en su domicilio.
El monto solicitado del préstamo es de 508 nuevos soles y es para invertirlo en la parcela de su esposo, que a la fecha tiene sembrado de cultivo de menestra var. Zarandaja y requiere del dinero para el mantenimiento de cultivo.
Para que de esa forma el cliente cuente con más ingresos y por ende una mejor condición de vida en la zona, además el mercado es bueno para la inversión en este tipo de negocio, pues en su mayoría sobre todo las amas de casa son las que comercializan la venta de la chicha de jora.
texts.en:
Lidia is a 49 year old woman who lives with her partner and takes care of her 2 children.  She and her partner live in their own house in the AA.HH San Francisco District La Matanza - Piura.  The District has ten thousand residents, and Lidia lives in this young town.  She has good personal and professional references.  She is responsible and well-known.
Lidia makes her living selling "chicha de jora" (an alcoholic drink made from fermented maize) and also raising small animals like turkey, sheep etc.   Largely, it is the women of the house who sell "chicha de jora."  She has been doing all of this from her home for the last 5 years. 
Lidia is requesting a loan in the amount of 508 nuevos soles (USD $200) to invest in her husband's plot, which is currently planted with  Zarandaja beans.  She needs the money to maintain the crop.
With the loan, the client will be able to earn more money, and thereby have a better standard of living for her area.  In addition, the market is good for investing in this type of business.

loans.use: to invest in maintaining her bean crop and to purchase animal feed.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es:
Sra. Esmeralda; tiene 25 años de edad, nació en la provincia de Chumbivilcas en Cusco, pero actualmente vive en Andahuaylillas distrito de la Provincia de Quispicanchis en Cusco - Perú, es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo de 7 años de edad, 
Esmeralda trabaja vendiendo carne de cordero, ella lleva su mercancía  a Quillabamaba, provincia del la Convención; esto representa 8 horas de viaje para llegar hasta allá, Esmeralda  vende carne de cordero y res al por mayor, ella regresa nuevamente luego de 2 semanas, realizando el largo viaje para llevar otra carga. En esta oportunidad Esmeralda solicita solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de corderos para la venta de su carne. 
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Andahuaylillas en la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.
texts.en:
Esmeralda, 25, was born in Chumbivilcas province in Cusco, but she now lives in the Andahuaylillas district of Quispicanchis province, in the department of Cusco, Peru.  She lives with a partner and has a 7 year-old child.

Esmeralda works selling mutton.  She takes her merchandise from Convención to Quillabamba, which is an 8 hour trip.  She sells the mutton and beef at wholesale.  She goes back again every 2 weeks to make this long trip to bring another load.  At this time, Esmeralda is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of sheep, so that she can sell their meat.

She is grateful for this loan, and promises to make all of her payments according to the established schedule.

Esmeralda belongs to the communal bank "Las Triunfadoras."  This bank is located in the Andahuaylillas district of Quispicanchis province, in the department of Cusco.

loans.use: to buy sheep for her mutton business

loans.name: Lenilyn

texts.en:
Lenilyn is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Lenilyn has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Lenilyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Lenilyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Berna

texts.en:
Berna is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala east region of Uganda. In the past, Berna has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells snacks. 

To help expand her business, Berna has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cooking oil, and will help Berna to generate greater profits and expand her business. Berna hopes that in the future she will be able to open a salon. 

Berna is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Berna's future prospects by helping her to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
Cristy works hard to support her family. Cristy is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Cristy requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like bread, soft drinks, detergent and other groceries.

She has been in this business for a year.

In the future, Cristy would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like bread, soft drinks, detergent and other groceries.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.
